4mmp1zlj9jlZhKm7HbpAyw.text: What a strange place!  Great service. Strange menu. Great decor. Laid back atmosphere. The white trash burger is Excellent!  Definitely coming back soon

cFmZbHwu34rfUAcYgh2dOg.text: Pinky's lived up to and went beyond the hype! Food was really phenomenal - you must order a burger ding dong style. Service was very speedy and the price can't be beat. Will definitely be back!

QzZjBIU2KQT44oQ2ASwWIA.text: Not the healthiest food but great service, great atmosphere and great prices. Would definitely go back!

JZyfFJ9D50NO63Z9RmVAZQ.text: Pinky's has awesome food, great prices and unprofessional, unpleasant service. Ive been embarrassed to bring my friends and family here because the service  is some of the worst I've ever experienced. And it's consistent. I'll get to the positive first. The food is fantastic, it's simple and humble but everything I've had is delicious. Especially as a vegetarian, Pinky's has tons of options that you can't usually find at other restaurants. Their veggie burger is great but my go to is the Stray Dog, a sweet potato hot dog with vegetarian chili, onions and slaw. It is SO good, it's been a long time since I've had a real hot dog but I'm pretty sure the Stray Dog tastes just like the real thing. Also for sides, their red potato salad is great, so are their potato chips. The entire menu is really affordable as well, with a meal with sides usually coming to around $10. But all is not well. I've been coming to Pinky's to eat for a couple years now, ignoring the subpar and unfriendly service that I just deemed to be expected from Pinky's. The food and atmosphere made up for it. But I just can't do it anymore. I'm sure I'll eat Pinkys again in the future but it will have to be To-go. The servers are so consistently rude and inefficient that I just don't want to leave another lunch or dinner feeling worse than when I came in. It's as if it's an employment requirement that you must appear disinterested and annoyed at all times. Servers have a permanent scowl and they make the dining experience uncomfortable for me and my party time and time again. Just today I was having lunch with my sister when a larger, older, red haired female server brought our fried pickles out. We had just ordered and finished another order of fried pickles previously but ordered a second. When she put it down I asked if we could please get another two ranches for the pickles. She LITERALLY rolled her eyes and cut me off to say "they're .75" i politely explained to her that I never received any ranch to go with my second order and she walked off while I was talking I was slightly stunned because she was so abrasively rude when I was just making a simple request. I have been a server myself for years and the way the majority of the servers here are is laughable. Lastly, I dropped my debit card on the ground and my sister put it on the table for me. a waiter walked by and interrupted my conversation to say "is that you prompting me to take my payment??" And pointed at my card. I was SO shocked and embarrassed that he would be so confrontational to me. I said "no, I just dropped it on the floor and picked it up but I'm ready for the check now if it's convenient" and he walked away with out saying anything. As a server if my table had a card out on their table i would simply ask "are you ready for your check?" He was so nasty and unfriendly for NO reason. It's maddening the way that no care is paid to service here at pinky's, napkins and sauces are often forgotten as well and drinks are left to go empty. I wish I could just not be a patron of theirs at all but the food is just too good.

o4MGBXvLTmyWdo667CPOjA.text: Good food, great price. I came here fur lunch with a coworker and was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was.   Service was quick and efficient.   I ordered a turkey burger and fries and my coworker ordered a salad. The food was spot on and was delicious.  Prices were reasonable and service was quick. Nothing about here specifically stood out but I can tell this is the place to go if you want a quick sit down meal.   Parking SUCKS but the service and food makes up for it.

ubj_8-rOht6zxYYyzZNl4A.text: I know everyone loves Pinky's but my experiences here have just been ok.  The food is decent.  I've had the fried pickles, the Corn dog shrimp, the Westside randy and a few other things. The Westside randy was the best of the bunch.    The beer list was completely off on my most recent visit.  Why have a laminated beer list if you're out of everything on the list?  Seems like a waste of money to me when just a regular paper list would be easier to reprint and cheaper. But oh well.    Service is ok here. Nothing exceptional. They take your order, tell you they are out of the first 3 beers you selected, and they bring your food out.    At the lack of parking doesn't make this place somewhere I want to visit often.  I actually preferred the Huntersville location which I also visited recently.

qAGF3pLdAigtFkJEQ9RLxA.text: This place always makes me happy.  The decor and environment is great, fun and welcoming.  The service is always good.  I like the white trash burger, one of my favorites! The food is inexpensive and the drink special are inexpensive also. Everything always tastes terrific!!

4eAtTul-OnzFSk2bRdQtqA.text: In Charlotte for work and found this restaurant on yelp. Hoping vibe in here. It is 1 o'clock in the afternoon I am here for lunch but several people are at the bar drinking

EXheqq0sjQsfhet5K690TQ.text: I love Pinky's! The environment is laid back and unique. Burgers are fantastic, not huge so if your are starving, order accordingly. Great fries and salads too!

t8Gr0NSQhrmN9XI4Dh0Vog.text: Pimpn fries were awesome, servers and staff were friendly, however I decided I wanted to try the Reuben veggie dog (I don't eat meat and have been missing hot dogs!) and when I ended up not liking it I told the server who went and got a woman who I'm guessing was the manager. She came to the table and said "was something wrong with the veggie dog?" And I said I'm sorry I just didn't care for it. She gave me a disapproving look and then said "well have you ever had a veggie dog?" I said no I wanted to try it though. She said "oh... ok..." I am a server and would never make anyone feel bad for wanting to try something new and not liking it. Will probably not be back.

3Sz0hESI2eKox9mv4xH3zQ.text: Fried pickles......  I debated only writing that because any place that serves this delicious dish always has my heart.... so naturally I'm going to tell you to order fried pickles...but wait there's more!!!  Pinky's is an awesome little burger joint and you can't go wrong with any thing you order. The white trash burger is golden and of course it has fried pickles on it!!!!!!!   If you're trying to be healthier go for the tahini salad. It's delicious and the falafel is cooked perfect.   Also this is a great little late night place to avoid the uptown rush- cocktails are $5-7 and they're huge. Most of them are served in a mason jar. You can also upgrade to a double for a few bucks extra. Ps. The Squirrely temple is great!!!!

BbzlXDR6oyHEiBPS6yIQ8w.text: Had a great time with my family. Loved the food and drinks. We ordered the popcorn chicken salad which was enough for 2 people. The chicken patsy melt was delicious and White trash burger was yummy. The tacos were little messy but it was good. We were seated in the patio outside and the environment was refreshing. They offer good selection of local beers as well.

KKOEquiR6TGBjX3cqLspyg.text: I rarely give 5 stars. Let me repeat... I RARELY give 5 stars. But this place was on point! I had the White Trash Burger and added bacon (bacon elevates everything... it's a known fact) and switched out the cheese for pepper jack. I had sweet potato fries and they were fresh and AWESOMMMEEE!!! Even my Arnold Palmer was GOOD! It had pink lemonade in it. Check the photo!   My burger was juicy. I loved the crunchy pickles on it. The burger was perfect for my hands... it's like... it was made to fit in my hands... and in my mouth.   The waitress was mad attentive. I require the bare minimum, but she kept checking on us, asking how everything was. Even another lady came through to see how everything was going. Now if I get the bare minimum, I usually leave a 20% tip; but I think I left like 30something%   Bravo Pinky's... Bravo!

Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hey White Trash Burger w/ Bacon and Pepper Jack Cheese... Get.. in...muh... bellay!

WjqChI5E1ka1Fw6j6Mp9rQ.text: Like Pinky's better than the Penguin.  Of course the place is small just like the Penguin.  It has been awhile since we have gone but the burgers were great!

YMaDNqcMorrhdNlUy6t3mA.text: Delicious hush puppies and yummy food. The fried chicken was good and the waffles fries were enjoyable, although could be a bit crunchier. The coleslaw was nice but nothing special. Definitely worth trying out with a lovely atmosphere. A view of the Charlotte skyline if you sit outside too!

Koip2FKz0H6p3OPo-vCgeg.text: Came for my birthday today! (3/17/17) the wait wasn't long, food is great!!!! Service is the best!! I will be a regular!!!!

2ecAPnj5S-zMWfCV2cZs4w.text: Just wanted to follow-up here. Still one of my favorite places...the husband, kiddo and I usually hit it up sometime on Sunday (we call it "the Holy Church of Pinky's", since we usually make it here instead of church - ha!).   We've had some rough experiences lately though...bringing a toddler out anywhere is super stressful at times and the wait staff can make or break it. The wait staff has been in transition lately and we had stopped going in lieu of a chain restaurant with an extensive kids menu and wait staff that liked our kid.   When the little man first started eating solid foods, the wait staff gave their recommendations on how to order stuff to get the best deal on a smaller portion, because he's two and two year old's just don't eat all that much.  But, then, that staff left and the newbies didn't know what we were talking about when we asked for a "side of fried chicken" or a "kids burger". They'd let us wait just a little too long for food/drinks, or not bring little man's food in a timely manner (gotta expedite the kids meals), plus weren't friendly...it was too much and we stopped going.  Decided to give our favorite place another try this last week and had a GREAT experience. Still got our least favorite waitress, but she has really picked up the pace and gave us a much, much better level of service than we had come to expect from her.  The service makes such a big difference.  Looking forward to an even better experience next week!

Pqd1O2iurPB1S4h_iZlCug.text: This forsure is my ultimate go to spot. Especially after a night of drinking lol. They have heathy options, fatty fried options / cheesy things and decent prices ! The atmosphere is super dope and they have good customer service. And the bartenders are cool

Vw2Ac5rsqnDGsPxdTeVLwQ.text: The pimpin fries are good. They have pretty good burgers too! You really can't mess up fried pickles so those were also good. The banana pudding it's also pretty good. But I when there one night or some pimpin fries and I was waiting 20 minutes and I was like what's taking so long.. I go and check on it and it was just sitting there. And the person didn't even apologize or the long wait. But I'm not going to let that one experience make me not go back though.

fzuWCJq3O6fALoT5hYY1kw.text: Food and service was awesome. I ordered the popcorn chicken salad with ranch dressing. Yummy! I pulled some of the fried onions off to the side to eat as an appetizer. Service was good! Will definitely return! Sorry no pic was so hungry I ate it all up

pfKkBR3o8Kp80dvYwTX6cg.text: How can a place be an awesome biker bar and kid-friendly at the same time?   Here's a list of reasons, in no particular order, why this place f'ing rules: **Vintage KISS pinball machine **The crab puppies were so good that even Dylan D., the pickiest f'ing eater in the world, loved them **Having a sleeve of tattoos seems to be a requisite for employment **Photo booth **Excellent, filling salads (I loved my Buffalo Shrimp) **Good selection of beers on tap **Good wine list

bp1vlk-NzlGEjhMV_Fkc-Q.text: Holy cow this place is great!   My first visit was with a group of coworkers after doing an Escape Room adventure.  There were five of us at noon so the wait was long.  But it was well worth it.  I had the grilled pita which was arguably the best peta I've ever had.  Only minor complaint: I ordered fries and the waitress forgot but she later gave them to me to go and didn't charge. So Win Win!    My second visit was the next day because I forgot my credit card and had to go back to get it.  It was around noon again so very crowded but I got a seat at the bar and had the mammoth burger and fried squash.  The burger WAS mammoth and delicious.  Not greasy but very moist.  Excellent burger and I consider myself a burger aficionado so when I say it's excellent we're talking top 10 burger here.    But the best thing was the fried squash.    Each one was like a little piece of southern culinary heaven.  Golden fried and crisp with a slightly sweet salty taste.  And there were so many that try as I might (and believe me did) I could not finish them all.    If you have never been to Pinky's get yourself there.  I envy you your first taste of Pinky's deliciousness.

qfeQiP-97K9eh_mi2Gr24g.text: Pinkys is always awesome. Our go to for the most comfortable comfort food. Yum to the pimento cheese fries and the white trash burger we devoured. The constant stopping by various servers is confusing as they all work together but we dealt with it as two of the guys were easy on the eyes. Stop at our table anytime boys but bring by some fried pickles and a mimosa when you come!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese fries. Yes. Just yes.

iDyBc8gz9BQghUq86vVpqQ.text: I used to live in Wesley Village across from Pinky's... Needless to say, I went there quite often when I was craving some greasy food. Their ding dong style anything is amazing -- crunchy peanut butter, sriracha, and cilantro slaw.   They actually have some decent salads too. I like the falafel salad.

KsIvCY16ZkbWFiyKnFiiOA.text: Really excellent burger and a 5 star corn dog.  Really outstanding corn dog!  I'm saying it twice because I would not have expected it to be so dang good based on corn dogs sampled at other restaurants.  Did not have the french fries, so no comment on them.  Onion rings while ok, were not in the same league as the burger or cd.  I think a thicker ring would have worked much better.  I should have had a 2nd corn dog instead of the rings.  Burger was a single because of the addition of the corn dog.  The doubles and triples looked outstanding and I would expect just that much more delish-i-ness (?) by adding more patties and cheese.  Hats off to the cooks!  Bartenders are attentive and I was never thirsty.  Muchas gracias!  I may have been the only non-tattooed person in the place, but no issue with that whatsoever.  Everyone seems like really nice peeps.  Great music.  Too many IPA's for my taste and would have liked a nice micro-brewed lager, but ended up drinking PBR's which were just fine with the excellent burgers and cd's.  Only 4 stars due to the onion rings, but y'all are doing great things...

tFQ0a6dPfDyG02VoOUZSsQ.text: So many great vegetarian options! Corn dogs, veggie chili, black bean burgers... Love this place. Funky little dive bar.

qMbZ8yycVFlvRdJccih9OA.text: Pinky's is GREAT! I come here for lunch about once a week and I haven't had anything up until this point that I wouldn't order a second time.   This place is super unique - decor is funky and fun - the outside patio is perfect for a tasty meal on an nice day.  The service is fantastic.They wait on you as a group so you always have someone the to constantly check in. You'll never have to ask for a refill - the fill you up before you can even realize what's going on.  The "Westside" burger is delicious - mustard, chili, slaw & onion!? "I put that sh** on everything"  The Grilled Greek Pita w/ chicken is my go to sandwich. I almost wish there was more chicken put into it, with it being so good.  Nonetheless, the food is very good, the atmosphere is fun and it is always completely packed during lunch hours (always a good sign).  Highly recommend!

0W8hofl9jAGTEIQpMdwEBQ.text: Like Jules, I'm glad I waited to give a review for Pinky's.  My boyfriend & I had gotten take out, I'd say early last year & I got some kind of burger and the slaw.  I was not happy at all. I ended up feeling sick on my stomach afterwards.    Fast forward to yesterday, when I was in an extreme rush, hurrying from one appointment to another.  It was after 1 PM & the lunch rush had died down, thank goodness. I needed the order to go & was immediately helped by a friendly waitress. Like Dion alluded to, the decor inside is fun & hip, & they had some jamming music playing.  Everything looked clean.  I got the Pterodactyl burger with "everything" - mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion, & pickles, along with the (waffle) french fries & a sprite. Luckily, my food came out in about five minutes & I was on my way.  I nommed away on my fries along Morehead and onto South Blvd. They were tasty! They were lightly salted & light - they weren't heavy like Chic-Fil-a's waffle fries.  Once I got to my second appointment, I dove into my hamburger. OH M GEE, it was delicious! It didn't seem heavy either! The toppings were fresh & thankfully, the onion wasn't too overpowering. The burger was juicy & cooked to perfection.  The cons: parking is limited on site. You're probably going to end up parking across the street where the tattoo parlor is - & even there, parking isn't great.  The restaurant  itself isn't too big either, so seating could be an issue. Ha! I have to agree with Jimmy - this IS NOT the place for the health concious!

cf-XJtOLfQn5Bn8wlYtxpA.text: Great food - Even better price for what you get... The burgers are some of the best in the city  + the wings and blu cheese are cooked perfect & flavor fantastic - Go!!!

GUcCd_FREPm-5oIPTnwNQg.text: I leave this review with a heavy heart as I know pinky's is a big deal in Charlotte. However, I have been four times hoping for a different outcome, but leaving with food poisoning every single time.   I always enjoy the food when I am there but hours later, not so much. I love burgers and I love fries and the menu looks so great and I want pinky's to be good so badly. I hear people talk and I dream about having a delicious burger but every single time, without fail, I have gotten sick. What from? I am not sure. The last time our entire table got sick so I can't be going crazy.   The restaurants appeal and staff are great so If you head that way, maybe just ask for a well cooked burger. Let me know how it goes.

mrEau4QH1EGV7tNiae4TPQ.text: If you haven't been to Pinky's Westside Grill you don't know what your missing! When I arrived I was warmly greeted and seated promptly! I ordered the nature boy burger ding song style without cheese and mayo with some hummus mixed in and I was blown away ! I also ordered the pinto bean salad that  was fantastic this place has a retro feel and is priced reasonably ! Check it out you won't be disappointed ! P.S. This place has ton of vegetarian options and almost anything can be made vegan by removing cheese or certain sauces!!

jcsCLkfeZSy6_hIl9-Qq2g.text: I love this place.   It is a total hole in the wall but the prices and great and the food is better. Service is always quick and efficient. A lot of times I get a cocktail and on Friday they have craft beer roulette which is fun.  Unicorn Tears cocktail = delicious. As for food, I've liked everything that I've gotten. I tend to get the Westside Randy pita with chicken on it and a side of delicious fried goodness onion rings.  We go all the time. Never had a bad experience!

f6BRy7Ia5bkbYX3T3E_H1w.text: Good food! Great friendly people! Crabby puppies were great! Loved the sauce. We would go back! White trash burger great! Patsy melt great. Big John great! Little noisy but fun atmosphere. Staff was awesome!

9Y6BZg1kHq2g_3L3YKWz1w.text: Took the family to Pinkys around 5 on Saturday and we LOVED it! Service was friendly, inviting and very attentive to all customers. The atmosphere was inviting with music and good conversation with other customers and employees. The food was quick to the table and so good. We shared the waffle cut chilli & pimento cheese fries. The fries were crisp, the chilli was just the right consistency with a light spice & kiss of sweet which complements the creamy sharp cheddar bite of the pimento cheese. My wife had the patty melt; it was cooked perfectly with a good crisp crust from the flat top and gooey melting cheese. For her side she had the black beans and I must say these are a must have. Fresh, tender and sweet with a light spice, so good. My son had the popcorn chicken tossed in Buffalo sauce. The chicken was served in a very generous portion, big plump , juicy white meat with a light breading. He had enough for lunch after church the next day. I had the "pinky dog" which is an all beef dog served on a toasted bun with chilli and pimento cheese (refer to earlier in this post for details in chilli & cheese). With fountain drinks and tip we spent just under $50 so not bad. Was a great experience and excellent food, we definitely recommend it and will go back.

dBjIQX3AWFpIVbZMxX7YYw.text: I'm so glad I came here instead of eating at the hotel or company has us staying at.  The food was amazing. I had the white trash burger and a side of fried pickles. Everything was so good and the customer service was wonderful.  If I was in town again, id definitely come back.

_4uHUf0acwHFQWBd1OP3xA.text: Great portions and burgers that can be customized. Normally seating is fast. They also have good drink specials through out the week.

jgR0l7qxmtEFDpSzGGI5tA.text: I'm not going to lie, I was hesitant to go to the location because it isnt in the best part of town but the area is improving as new restraurants open.  Pinky's is a greasy burger joint with decent prices. The hummus is good and the fried pickles are excellent.

gkn6qd5p_3pNZP6Bil0wNg.text: This is a must place to come to on the West Side of town! I have been here several times, and the service has always been the best! You can't go wrong with any thing on the menu.  That Triple G! WOW and the Corndog Shrimp!  When you top it off with HOME MADE DESSERTS! Just be ready to eat some amazing food....

3nUgQuPzXYCgwOwARIDkrw.text: Cool little burger joint. Great onion rings and some wacky sandwiches. Better than most other burgers in the area.

u7KgVTaEOC31mNu25-VCDw.text: This place used to be a great place to eat, but tonight my fiance and I went there for a burger and wings. The burger was very dry and way too much bread. My fiance ordered buffalo wings, but there was a heavy presence of garlic in the sauce. It didn't even taste similar to buffalo sauce. Not that we don't like garlic, but when we order buffalo wings we would like it to at the very least resemble it. Lastly the practice of "team servers" where every server shares every table is so inefficient. We felt like we were waiting around for long periods before we could get help. We didn't feel taken care of as customers.  This practice needs to get kicked to the curb.

BF8yAz4c6KsL3KtyCVLnbQ.text: This place is amazing. I have tried countless items from their menu. All ranging from burgers to salads to appetizers and even their vegetarian items. My husband LOVES the banana pudding! The vibe is extremely hip and it's a fun place to eat it. I always highly recommend this restaurant when friends and family come into town. Staff is always friendly and the food is always severed to perfection. I have never had a bad experience here. This place rocks!

oVzze0w9n7Z3AUE17jZmwQ.text: Pretty nice establishment and the people are cool and everyone makes sure that your not neglected plus the food is great and I would def recommend coming here again

fUu68z5KVXjbooOleDN74w.text: Pinky's is a good spot to head when you're hungover on New Year's Day.  There was about a 20 minute wait since I guess everyone else had the same idea, but the tantalizing smells made it all worth it.  We were both hungry so we ordered a large basket of fried pickles.  Because it was so busy, we were seated next to another couple at a table that could hold a 4-top.  However, they ordered a small basket of fried pickles, and our orders were delivered to one another.  Luckily, the small basket wasn't small at all, so we were fine with it.  Any more would have been too many fried pickles, anyway.  They were perfectly fried, the batter was nice and crispy, and the pickles were juicy and salty.  I had requested a side of spicy ranch, which worked perfectly with them, but they otherwise came unadorned.  I think they should at least be served with some kind of dipping sauce.  For my meal, I got a Mammoth burger (two patties) with everything (mayo, LTO, pickles), cheddar cheese, and some fresh jalapenos.  The menu states that all burgers are cooked to medium well, a shade above the medium I normally like my burgers, but I gave them the benefit of the doubt.  They absolutely nailed it - this was the best burger I'd had in years.  The patties were perfectly seasoned, and they must use a lot of fat in their grind because even cooked to medium well, they were very very juicy.  The jalapenos lightened the burger and added some welcome kick.  I would eat one of these burgers every day if it wouldn't give me heart disease.  For my side I got onion rings, which the server warned were "cut really thin", which I was fine with.  The problem here is that they weren't onion rings...they were onion straws.  No rings to be found.  The onions were cut so thinly that it was mostly batter, and after sitting in the container for a few minutes while I enjoyed my burger, they kind of steamed to a soft consistency and weren't terribly enjoyable so I only ate about half of them.  I'd recommend either renaming them onion straws on the menu to avoid misleading the clientele, or adjusting the recipe so they're actually rings of onion.  Remember how our pickles order got messed up with the other couple at our table?  The same exact thing happened with our entrees as well.  Luckily we easily resolved it, but it was still a slight misstep.  Overall, this was a very encouraging first trip and I will definitely be back.  Aside from a couple bumps in the road for the service, and the underwhelming onion straws, the burger was so amazingly good that it was enough to earn them four stars.  Iron out the other issues and I'd gladly award all five.

T0JTUckFXikhKPrFu3FDIQ.text: Amazing burger joint! Here are some of the highlights:  -You don't have one server. All servers circulate throughout the restaurant helping patrons. They share the tips. -The Ding Dong Way is the perfect mix of sweet and spicy. If you're going to add cheese, I'd recommend going with a more mild cheese like provolone.  -$2.50 drafts on Thursday.  -Pimento cheese fries with the option of adding chili or bacon. Make sure to get a side of their ranch for dipping!  -Parking is behind the building/right around the corner.

Iu2r9pGj-Y_AGBo3z_dk3A.text: I've only had the crab hush puppies and fried pickles tbh, that's enough for me to come back again and again. I've limited my meat intake which limits the menu for me personally, but I've heard great things about the "white trash burger" and another famous Hotdog they offer, but nonetheless, you won't be disappointed with your choice. Great place to get daily drink specials as well. Decent crowd. Music ... eh (room for improvement). Atmosphere overall - bearable.

B1vzruSNxecmsec1SGOh4Q.text: White trash burgers are amazing!!! Nice mix of unhealthy delicious food. Huge jugs of ranch and drinks galore. Love this place

Ny5dAswdgZ9lH-kn1XhwlQ.text: Great Burgers! Awesome atmosphere, loved it! Will definitely eat here again the next time I am in Charlotte.

npoZodJU2WZyOYEjWHV-ng.text: Mediocre but gets the job done. Good for a group after work or school. Sandwiches are good. Basic bar food for the most part. But I haven't been in a few years.

JVoYCPbBlhkDUKZvdXSMPQ.text: Awesome fried food experience.  Staff is eclectic and worth the trip.  Had the White Trash Burger,  on-point.    There was a wait, parking ample.

__idQgHFa9UL8Ud6oB-w9Q.text: The mammoth burger, crab hush puppies, white trash burger, corn dog, waffle fries and sweet potato fries were all good along with the sauces. Service is very quick because the servers don't have time to stop and chat (I prefer this type of service)   The ding dong was not very good with peanut butter. Will return if in Charlotte

UaazUYX8KpQorr1YcpNLYQ.text: Wonderful. Love the crab puppies. You have to order the crab puppies. The white trash burger is my favorite. I love everything about this place. The food , the people and the atmosphere. Love it.

H11EB2iZqWJ20-zx3YazEw.text: My Co-Workers and I were looking for a place to go to eat since we were out by the aviation museum and there is nothing around that. I suggested pinky's because it is legendary for good food. So we drive over and get seated immediately which is awesome.  Ordered our food and admittedly it took a while but its a legendary place we expected it . It came to a halt when I was about done with my chicken sandwich and around a piece of the chicken was a slimy black hair. I almost threw up. It was gross. Now I will say as a caveat that I showed it to a server and the sandwich was taken off our bill. But my experience here is still a hair in my food and that is sad.

yWaqo52T0f1Aezo5SXTBIw.text: Really wasn't all that . If you want to visit simply because Guy Ferri went then go, they have the signed posters and episodes playing. However, the food was good but it wasn't all that.

_b9Ga_uBQM2SDjn4Qk6R7A.text: I love pinky's decor, vibe, and atmosphere l. They have great drink specials daily and I really enjoy the margarita pitcher. Now I'll be honest the burgers lack a lot of flavor and I don't understand how this is a "top ranked" burger. The burgers have no taste to them. I should have known better but I wanted to see what the hype is about. I now know for a fact Guy will co-sign anything. Still four stars because I do love this place but the burgers fall short.

EDPELELtdzJHDE7ooeI76A.text: ALWAYS on point. The food at Pinky's is what I like to call 'Adventure eating!!" Today we got the Crab Puppies for an appetizer. They are crab stuffed hush puppies! They are SOOOO GOOD. I could have eaten just those as my meal and been fine with it!! I had the 'The Patsy Melt' and sweet potato fries as my meal, both were great! My husband had the Pterodactyl Burger and added pimento cheese and bacon. I tried it and honestly liked it a good bit better than my Patsy Melt. Also would 100% suggest the Corn Dog Shrimp Basket!! It is very unique and very VERY good. Atmosphere is awesome as well. Would definitely suggest this restaurant!

ZjwEyTu70a820fkIBkDQbg.text: Great food! I would like to thank Envirosafe Pest Control. Www.pestcontrolcharlotte... for taking care of the fire ants across the street. Pinkeye has the best white trash burger and buffalo shrimp in town. Thanks again to Envirosafe Pest Control in Charlotte for all they do!

tJ2Fq1ZJKFGSyEllHZ1zAQ.text: Parking here was a little difficult cuz of the lack of space. Food came out fast which was good. Loud atmosphere but good food. Had the chili cheese fries and white trash burger. Unfortunately our meal was interrupted by a table fighting. If you can hear arguing over the music then you know it's getting serious. We had to leave before it got anymore physical. Not a place we'd sit and eat at because of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

s1BgWxBePEaizXesRSqKRg.text: You do have to dig deep and find local institutions to dine at while visiting another city. Stay away from those chains!  Pinky's was recommended to us by a nice guy who was working at the Manifest Records. So, yes, listen to the locals. Then, while looking through the local paper, Pinky's made the top 5 for best dinners in Charlotte! And yes, it made more than an appearance in Guy Fieri's "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives".   So, we kept the best for the last and stopped at Pinky's on the way to the airport, hoping for the best. The outside decor, a cute VW bug on top of the building didn't disappoint. Same with the cool, funky decor. If you're into music, movies, comics, this place is a little paradise decor wise. You'll keep looking around while listening to their fun tunes they're playing. Not a boring minute in there.  As you can imagine, this joint doesn't specialize in health food, although they have decent salads, wraps, a few Middle-Eastern dishes. Otherwise it's American diner food, with a Southern influence, pushed to it its limits.  We started with a basked of fried pickles, my first ever, and they were good. Greasy with goodness.  My husband tried their Korean Pork BBQ tacos and they were very tasty, with a nice slaw, the Tahini Salad was decent, fresh,  so was the White Trash burger (reading the menu in this place was a hoot).We got waffle fries for the table.   I saw their burger of the month while checking their menu on line (in November they had a Greek burger), the photo made me drool and that's all I kept thinking about. We went there in December, during the X-mas holidays, so the burger of the month was different, but the Greek one turned into a personal obsession for me (I love burgers and Greek food, so this was a perfect heavenly combination in my book). I usually don't go divaesque on anyone, but since the servers were super nice, I asked about the Greek burger and they offered to ask the chef to make one for me, with pita bread instead of buns and they did, and they made this girl super happy. The Greek burger didn't disappoint, it came with fresh tomatoes, feta cheese, Kalamata olives. Opa! Thanks for indulging me! It melted in my mouth, full of goodness.  What else can you drink with this type of food? We got a pitcher of local beer (the pitcher was our server's idea, it made it for a better deal, $15), tried the Lenny Boy de la Witt, a bit amber, I wish it was a bit stronger, but decent overall.  And no, we didn't stop here. We went big, so we ordered the desserts, the biggest banana pudding we've ever seen and the Cheerwine pound cake, nice, moist and fun.  Decent prices, good service, free parking to the right, once you pass the restaurant, cool, funky decor.  Once again, you don't go to Pinky's for health food, you indulge, dive in, experience a cool, fun, local institution.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean pork BBQ tacos
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. My Greek burger
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. inside

I1EbmyQ5B3Evtkl5gdtLtg.text: Fresh of the plane at CLT, I just HAD to eat before I made the drive back to WNC.  Yelp suggested a cool little spot called Pinky's.  I immediately dug the atmosphere and the funky vibe.  Grabbed a seat at the bar in a small(er) booth built for two (sort of).  Booth could have used a bit more elbow room but I didn't get knocked into, so I guess it was alright.  I wanted to grab a quick bite and head out, so instead of scouring the large menu, I opted for the Mammoth burger (two 5oz patties) with cheese and bacon (can never pass up bacon!) on a gluten-free bun (rejoice!).  At first, I was second-guessing the 5oz patty size, but when you want more than 8oz and less than 16oz (standard "big burger" size nowadays), 10oz is a pretty good compromise.  I chucked on a size of sweet potato fries for good measure.  Food came very quick, and I was off to the races.  Fries were tasty, with just the right amount of crisp vs bend. I enjoyed them with a touch of salt.  The burger looked stout thanks to the smaller and taller patties, but the crowning (no pun intended) glory was that bun.  I haven't ran into a non-plain, non-sucky gluten free bun yet - but this was interesting.  Poppy and sesame seed buns encased this burger, and I was very intrigued.  The burger was cooked well with a good amount of season, but could have used a bit more pizzaz.  I guess with all the options, the plain burgers are plain.  The bun broke apart like a GF bun should so I definitely don't fault them for that - but it was tasty.  I really thought Pinky's shined i the service department.  It felt as if I had the whole staff waiting on me, and was helped by no less than 5 or 6 of the waitstaff.  Great teamwork, and I never had to wait for anything (even though I didn't need much).   Price was very reasonable for the food offered.  Would definitely return to again when in the CLT area.  Only downside, seems as if the parking lot was a bit small, and there seemed to be some remodeling going on - not sure if that cut the spaces down or not, but hey, new improvements are awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mammoth burger with cheese and bacon

vj0vwc3EOjLTH7CXOOCu1g.text: Been coming to this place for years and they never skip a beat. Took my boyfriend here to get a sense of the southern punk/hipster scenery in Charlotte. The staff is all very upbeat and friendly! Which is one of my favorite things about this place. I got the chicken philly and it was so so delicious! My boyfriend got the tuna melt and it was TO DIE FOR! their menu is big enough and elaborate as to what each menu item is for those who wouldn't know.

c9Covxa7painanXk4uNuCA.text: I ordered the Patty Melt and it had absolutely zero flavor. I couldn't taste it at all and I was really hungry. Usually when you're that hungry everything tastes good but not this. It didn't taste bad but it didn't taste at all! And all the wait staff have gross piercings and weird hair. The host had a huge nose ring that made him look like a cow or some other farm animal. The waffle fries were okay, and they only have waffle shaped fries, no other options. The seating inside is really cramped. You're basically shoulder to shoulder with the table next to you.  If you do go just don't get the patty melt. The banana pudding is pretty good though.

60wmMQgypudkYcQY4fImlQ.text: I went in on the Memorial Day Weekend after seeing this restaurant on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.   I was torn between the White Trash burger and the Corn Dog shrimp, but ended up getting the burger with a side of fries. Honestly, I thought the burger was average, but it was tasty. Next time, I'll try the shrimp.   What I did thought was exceptional was the attentive service I received from the entire staff.   Also, they have great drink specials. On Saturday's, any cocktail that has Absolut vodka in it is only $5. I settled on the Wedding Punch and it was delicious.  I would recommend parking in the back, just keep driving past the entrance and you'll see the lot for parking.  I saw a yelper complaining about the walk, but it's nothing to worry about.   Overall, it's a fun place with a funky vibe. I'll be back, for sure!

hmegqcNKNuue01fJpJE0Uw.text: We ordered the Crab Puppies as an appetizer, they were a little odd, but the tarter sauce they were served with was amazing. The burger was very good. Our service was somewhat slow. It was hard to know who was our actual server as they all kind of tagged teamed the outside tables. I wasn't a real fan of that.

C1B1AuFE6MSMtHrb4FtVeA.text: Great atmosphere! The best Patty Melt around! Make sure to get the house made chips- you won't be disappointed.

p8DzArAoDr9G4oJv-8PZoQ.text: This place is really cool. It's kinda funky and weird but very good. The food was really good and the service was really good too. Very good for vegetarians as well.

hH_XLlrQFNpnDC9rLDXGTg.text: The food was amazing. The staff are the best staff I've ever encountered. I got my food to go but picking up my order was the best part. I ordered the Pimp'n fries with chili, cheese & bacon, Viking corn dog, & Spaugh buffalo wings. Everything was delicious. I did ask for my wings to be extra crispy in which they weren't but they were still good. I highly recommend this place if you're driving through or in Charlotte!!

OL8LaW_caHsmyYmSnxMSNw.text: I stopped in here for dinner while visiting town.  With great Yelp reviews and a stop on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives I felt I was in good hands.  To top it off my uber driver raved about it so I went in feeling pretty confident.    To start, they had Firefly vodka, one of my favorites!  You don't find many places where I'm from serving it.  So I got one of the $5 cocktails with it, yum tasted like summer!    Also, pimento cheese isn't super prominent where I live so I took every chance I could to have it on just about anything while I was in town.  I zeroed in on the Pimp'n Fries and there was no turning back, melted pimento cheese over waffle fries, just the comfort food I needed!  Since it was just me and I was towards the end of my stay I knew getting one of their raved about burgers would be a waste since I was pretty content with my Firefly and Pimento Cheese fries for dinner.  BUT in the effort of being a little bit of a responsible adult I ordered the chicken tacos.  I was actually pleasantly surprised, the meat was very tender and the toppings were all really fresh, a nice compliment to the very decadent fries I was inhaling.   Atmosphere is fun and funky (True of most Triple D stops) and the service was great.  Everyone was super friendly and very accommodating.  A great way to round out my stay!

JYVJvKwrRZgkJMTEIDzvgw.text: Loved it.  Great burger fantastic corn dog.  Super service and wonderful prices.  Be back

eDrhh5LWAFPvknZtwHkgnQ.text: Placed an online order through uber eats and they cancelled it. I called and while they sounded apologetic, they said they cancelled because they're too busy. What kind of business cancels a $58 order they don't have to worry about delivering themselves?

wlASmNrf_R-KEdOlrwu-4g.text: What a amazing place to sit and have a cocktail or some tasty food. Amazing service along with great atmosphere. Love it!!!

nMQTXinsWup9UvJVr7EiXg.text: All I know how to say is YUMMMM! This is one of my favorite places to go! Love their crab puppies and live for their hotdogs! Highly recommend!!

fPs4h3RUY7mg5jaA39AWfw.text: One of the best burgers in Charlotte and their fries are delicious. Cool laid back atmosphere and friendly staff.

ltDwqZCuA6__afRMA-M9RQ.text: Greg's Fried Pickles. Pimpin Fries. Westside Burger.  Yummmm.  Next time will be the schrimpz.  Love this place as it reminds me of college days parking in the gravel lot and going across the street to the Pterodactyl.  Which is another great burger on the menu. Love the cheap prices including the drink specials. Can't beat $1.50 PBR on Monday or half price craft beers on Tuesday.  And don't the banana pudding is so big it comes with a to go container. It's that big.  The staff rocks and the music made me want to stay longer.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding. It&#39;s so big don&#39;t be surprised if the to go container arrives at your table too.

KKXCjLz0y2c74aa403vBqg.text: Want a relaxed experience and a yummilicious meal?   Try pinky's west side grill.   Only drawback was the loud traffic but the outdoor dining was great otherwise.  Best today:   Crab puppies!  Woah Nellie!   I'll make it back soon to this DD&D joint.

Qx9D35tDIw57VOQpbTWlnw.text: The place has a biker type vibe to it to me. All the female waiters are tatted up (some from the legs up)! They made the guys appear soft. Lol. The service was nice. Not much of a smile but good. Guy Fieri from the Food Network must have been here quite a bit and have autograph pictures and other items displayed in the place. I had The White Trash burger! Yeah the name of the burger made it sound like I got it from a trailer park BBQ right... Lol. It was juicy and fresh but not as flavorful as I would like it. The fries were, well FRIES! Nothing special about them. The food came out fast. Obviously the place is a local favorite because it filled up very fast. All in all I might try it again.

gx8C9c2jJpyngqSCPoL4AA.text: Order the crab puppies! They were Delightful. The atmosphere is nice, staff friendly, and an overall great place to eat.

9vX2fcN9H-7z8R8wB5qsrw.text: Everything I have tried here is DELICIOUS. The Pimp'N Fries are a must. Lots of creative choices on the menu. The staff is friendly and super-efficient. Large cocktail menu in addition to beer and wine.

97NcuFP8zmRS70xWvSlV0A.text: Definitely my favorite dive bar.  The bartenders are AWESOME, especially JesKa.  The banana pudding is delicious.  I love how great the food is at such a low cost.  It is within walking distance of my home.  I love the new patio for summer time alfresco dining.

fTJarnWcNN8oZIMwm1evKA.text: I came by myself and got seated in 15-20 minutes. My server was sweet and I ordered the sweet potato fries with honey mustard first. The fries were average, but the honey mustard was amazing! It is apparently house made, so I highly recommend getting it with whatever you order.   She didn't come back to see what else I wanted, but someone else did. I ordered the chicken tacos and waited for about 30-45 minutes. The second server  checked on me several times, so she was very attentive and I appreciated that. When the food finally came, she said she would give me a 50% employee discount due to the wait and I was thrilled! I wasn't in a rush to be anywhere so I didn't mind the wait and didn't ask for a discount, but this was really wonderful customer service! (Especially because my most recent dining experience was the complete opposite.. see my review for hillside farmacy in Austin tx if you're curious).   Overall, this is a pretty solid 4/5 star review because the food wasn't extraordinary, but the customer service made up for it. I wouldn't mind coming back if I'm in town to try something else.

TXZ00tNb8BT7jlIwL20dmQ.text: Live the atmosphere. The food was great. Jeff had the Pinky dog and needed a knife and fork to eat it. I had the Pasty burger and it was delicious! We also shared the fried pickles and they were excellent. Service was exceptional. My drink never got half empty. Really like this place. We be returning!

Se7slOgJlE7MaCdun5tmsw.text: Meh. A mediocre rating for a mediocre experience.   The food was OK - not great nor special.  The Shrimp Dogs (corn dog breaded shrimp) were uneventful, mostly breaded, and non seasoned below market shrimp.   Popcorn Chicken weren't crispy at all, basically just small grilled balls of small chicken pieces. It also costs an extra .75 to toss it in buffalo sauce that tasted like it came straight from a bottle of Frank's Red Hot (okayyyy make your money I guess).   Only plus side were the waffle fries. Not too crispy, not soggy, lightly salted.   Food presentation is paper plates, boats, and napkins which is fine being its kind of a divey place with cooky but fun decorations- and that fits the theme they're trying to achieve.   The service itself was nice, friendly, and prompt. Can't complain there.   I dunno for $30 with tip included, this place was over priced for the quality they serve. I probably won't be back and will let this one disappear into the back of my head, along with the other mediocre places to eat in Charlotte.

gnL8ugBHgofVT2BcEZ0zzA.text: Fantastic burger & tasty waffle fries. The spicy ranch dipping sauce paired well with the fries. The service was astonishingly quick! Loved it! The servers were all polite & always smiling. The burger "ding-dong" style was amazing. A flavor blast of peanut butter & siracha is weirdly delicious. Banana bread dessert was huge (in a good way). Will definitely be back!

o_POB4laJFxL8cIXYrtMqg.text: Always great food and fast service. Tried the specials a couple of weeks ago - Asian pork burger with honey cilantro slaw and Korean BBQ as well as the squash bisque. Both were absolutely delicious.  I usually get the kinda fried turkey with a pimpin fries opener. I don't even love turkey most of the time but this is great!

YuB5gQrrNq-Bmgw29XglOg.text: Best burger in Charlotte. They get busy, so I would suggest going on an 'off' time, but the prices are very reasonable and the food is always consistent.

juMrRB3QErMRnh1D67s5ww.text: I love Pinky's. I haven't found too many local restaurants that have a vibe or prices like Pinky's. The burgers are great and inventive. The fries and crabpuppies are great. It's easy to order too much food here, because the prices are so awesome. The drink menu is very fun and very reasonable. I have never had to wait to eat here, but I've seen it busy even though it's a bit out of the way. Crane machine and photo booth are in the lobby area, which is always fun. I haven't had their desserts, but they always have fun cakes as options. Go, but don't go too much so I can keep getting sat quickly.

hPet2T15Zy7Kh9rDpQ4SrA.text: Having lived in Charlotte for a little over a year now, this was a place my husband and I had been wanting to visit. We are amateur burger connoisseurs, and we have heard great things about Pinky's, so, needless to say, we were pretty pumped for some Pinky's! We went on a Saturday night, so it was kind of busy. This does not bode well for customers because their parking lot holds approximately 8 cars (give or take a few). We lucked out and got a spot, but it was a hot mess when we were trying to leave! Next, the ambiance. The staff is very friendly, and the establishment itself is fun. It had that diner feel (I think it is a converted garage??), but while some diners can be antiquated and kind of dirty, this one was trendy and almost "hipsterish".   I am an avid hot-dog fan (trashy, I know), and the Pinky Dog looked MIGHTY yummy, but I was feeling a burger this evening. I ordered the White Trash Burger (burger patty with fried onion rings, fried pickles, and spicy ranch) because it is so highly regarded by fellow yelpers, and my husband got a mammoth burger "Ding-Dong Style" (includes crunchy peanut butter, honey-cilantro coleslaw, and Siracha hot sauce). We also split the Pimp Fries (waffle fries smothered with homemade pimento cheese and bacon). They looked like they had some really good cocktails, but we weren't there for drinks, so perhaps another time (and I will get that hot dog!).  The verdict: it was OKAY. My burger itself was not very good and a little over cooked (we were not given a cook-to-order option). The fried pickles and onion rings were good (how can you go wrong with fried food?), but there could have definitely been a little more spicy ranch on it; I couldn't really taste it at all. My husband's burger was about the same. The burger itself did not impress, but the toppings were unique and pretty good. He also felt that they skimped a bit on the Siracha. The fries, however, were the star of the meal. Their homemade pimento cheese is pretty delicious. I could probably have just eaten that with a spoon and been satisfied (remember what I said about being trashy?).  Thus, there are way better burgers in Charlotte, so I will not be going back for those, but there were some redeeming things that might have me paying them another visit in the future.

L8szvdHcUv-PtgRBQ9i2lg.text: 8 absolutely love this place.  The White Trash Burger is out of this world.  Great food and awesome place.

8eZx1C1mzfafyJf7HvovKw.text: They could be friendlier.  I got here right when they were opening on a weekday.  I had to get there early because of a doctor's appointment nearby.  When I went to the door, it was locked, and they had a chair wedged underneath it.  I pulled on the door and waited for them to open it.  When they did, I went in, they didn't greet me, smile, nothing.  They just turned their back to me and went about their business.  I walked past them and stood where a person normally would if they were waiting to be seated.  I turned to look back at the same staff that were annoyed that I was their first customer of the day, and said "Can I just sit anywhere"?  The beardy one mumbled "yeah", and I went to sit down at a 4 top table.  I was the only one in the restaurant.  Five seconds later, he ran over to say "This place fills up fast, do you wanna sit at one of the smaller tables"?  Ugh.  Not really, I don't want you to cram a party of four in beside me.  That's what I thought you meant by SIT ANYWHERE.  I got a Tyrannosaurus burger and fries.  Both were delicious, but the burger was smaller than I expected.  I got banana pudding for dessert to finish, and it was delicious and definitely homemade.  I had 4 or 5 different people visit my table to refill my drink, while I ate, so I never knew who my actual server was, and how to base my tip.  The beardy one that first greeted me helped the most, but he never smiled, nor said have a nice day.  Basic niceties, that's what this place is devoid of.  I will go back, because the food made up for the service, but if I am treated the same way, that'll be the last time.  I don't care if you're trying to be hipster, you come off like an a** in the process.

ID4KmCwKwEK9GXZIyyz42A.text: The food at pinkies is limited for those of us allergic to gluten. They offered fries in clean oil but I cannot bring myself to believe that the cleaned fryer is really not contaminated. On the other hand the burgers and the not quite fried turkey sandwiches are excellent if a little large.  The limeade/ginger drink is a tall cup of wellness that can heal what ails you. Not sure why I feel better when I have it but I do. The place is noisy but the food is worth it. I'd give more stars if there were more gluten free options especially dessert.

intpezt9wCLqedIKEMxDxg.text: Yumm!!!  Was on a road trip from Virginia to Georgia when we stopped and ate at this place. It was so good that I wanna go back to Charlotte just to eat here!!!  The cheese pimiento fries were really really good omg. I never had the American cheese pimiento before and they were really good on fries. I was in heaven  I got corn dogs shrimps or something and those were really good too. It was way too much food! My boyfriend got the buffalo shrimp tacos and his dad got a salad since he was on a diet... I felt bad for him watching us eat all this delicious fried food. He definitely had willpower. But he said that his salad was really really good.   I love this place and want to go back! I don't know why the bill came out to a lot even though everything seemed really cheap. It was just three main things and an appetizer but I don't care, the food is so good I'll go back somehow!!! Cheese pimiento fries pls~  pros food is yummy!  cons somehow bill is more than u expect not the healthiest option but i dont care bout dat

wvP62FnKCMObCBz5qoNj1Q.text: If you like greasy food.  This is your place.   We came around lunch and had to wait some for a table.

You8Z_DxxHErSL6effowZA.text: I thought I wrote a review for Pinky's already? WTF. Again, this is a Friday or Saturday I've been working out all week and I've been meeting my fitness goals and I'm  going to eat something FUN to treat myself so I don't go nazi crazy kind of place. Maybe it's me, yes it's me, I go early to avoid crowds. It is a funky kind of place. Flounder is my fav. Get the flounder on Friday. No I'm not Catholic. I've been to Pinky's 5 times and I usually go with this pretty young girl I like but she is way too young for me but she doesn't mind because I pay for her meal, I like to watch her eat. And she has the best eyes. She is very funky too and she fits right in. The waitresses are always winking at her. Is he your Dad they ask? She always says maybe.

a9cC_wUtF_XxEU81C_ZtAw.text: Pinkys was great. Had the recommended ding dong sandwich and my wife had the big John and both were cooked too perfection. Fries were good too.

7EwKsAjD-ekWCN2FSxMbwg.text: Usually, I would give the restaurant 4 or 5 stars for great food and atmosphere. However, while attempting to get a seat today, the 5 of us waited for over an hour after being told it would be a short wait. Forty-five minutes into the wait we settled for a shaded outdoor table, but once the sixty minute mark hit we decided to leave, especially since several others had been seated before us.

6UtynLqiHiZMsjTkEIYmiQ.text: My favorites include the pimento grilled cheese sandwich and the Pinky dog (also with Pimento cheese!) I always order the fries smothered with pimento cheese and I'm always disappointed, though. The cheese is always overcooked, as if it was fried in the microwave too long. Note to self: stop ordering that!  In news other than pimento cheese, the corn dog shrimp are delicious. It's basically what you'd think: Corn dog batter wrapped around jumbo shrimp. I order it with blue cheese and buffalo dips. Speaking of dips, they are amazing, and so is the ranch. Very nicely done.   NOT good for large groups, as they won't seat you until your entire party has arrived. As I tend to hang with people that simply cannot show up on time, it makes for a tough venue. But with 2-3 people, it's a great experience and I always love enjoying my cheat meal here!

MFFO6vIJk1I7EpxYB8N4xA.text: Absolutely delicious! I went into Pinky's to grab some takeout before watching Wrestlemania 30 and it was a great decision. First off, the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant completely suit my personality, so I was in heaven the moment I walked in the door. I placed my order and it was ready in no more than 10 minutes. The Turkey sandwich was out of this world and the hush puppies were fried to golden perfection. I finished the meal off with some banana pudding that reminded me of how my grandma used to make it. All in all, I can't recommend this place enough and I'll certainly be dropping by a few more times before I leave.

4biiuTyvxJY3SR4KQc9shA.text: It's Pinky's. It's fun, quirky and kind of bad for you but that's what makes it good. You can't go wrong here. It's all yum!

Eq0J7q2ZrzMcUwUnK9qXbw.text: Definitely a must when in Charlotte. This place has great atmosphere and the food is even better. My favorite is the Ding Dong Chicken Sandwich which is a grilled chicken breast topped with crunchy peanut butter, slaw, and siracha. If that's too weird for your pallet then try the White Trash burger or Falafel.

-BZF30s_iTk27IHOwwpiOg.text: Pimpin' fries with veggie chili. (Thanks, Tonya P. for the recommendation. Total game changer.)  Fried pickles.  Vegetarian hot dogs.  Nature boy, ding dong style.  Tall, cool, cheap cans of PBR.  There's not a better place for you to enjoy heartburn-inducing food. Despite the lack of parking spaces and the not-so-enthusiastic service, it's a go-to for me. I would eat here once a week if my jeans didn't protest so loudly.  Great place for kids, or just grabbing dinner and beer with friends.

HnjZP7tGl5SqIXBX6F1hvQ.text: Don't let the buzz fool you. Pinky's is part greasy junk food, and part vegetarian galore.  Many healthy options available.   Great ambience, cool little spot!  Sides can be split with a friend.

s3G3H2vpa6oCfZzDW4NQ1g.text: MAAAAANNNN I DONE HIT THE JACK POT IN CHARLOTTE NORTH CAROLINA I Done Stumbled Upon Triple DDD SPOT That's Loaded With Vegan /Vegetarian Options. k_r8_KwgJTmSdvUfR9JLwA.text: Great service as no less than 4 people checked in on us.   Son had the Pinky Dog - hot dog with chili and palmetto cheese.  Can't go wrong there.  We share hot wings and they were as good as it gets.  I had the Spinach Salad and added bacon.  I was Andy able to eat half as it was so loaded with bacon, feta and artichoke hearts and I drowned it is spicy ranch.    I'll be back!

rU3zwAA0xrGQn3-u-lc4Tw.text: Fun family place with really inventive menu items. Loved it & can't wait to come back. If it seems weird, order it! You won't regret it.

Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pterodactyl Burger.. wish I had gotten it ding dong style!

EBH7ewQuBZDHqOXGJnP43w.text: Diners Dives and Dumps ! Oh how this place has airplaned downward into the abyss of once was a decent burger joint - burgers were over and under seasoned - how did this happen ? Staff wasn't very attentive at all. Let's just say management needs to take a look at customer service and constant care and quality control on the food that comes out the kitchen. Hope this review is an eye opener for you guys - hoping things turn around! Lates

9aCRLctqTA709yPoB95xFQ.text: We are here while on vacation. Food was really good, service was quick and best of all it was inexpensive. The next time we come to Charlotte we for sure will be stopping at Pinkys.

7VxwC-DSyIaQTX72UhMlYw.text: Diner food delicious eats!  We tasted the crabcake hush puppies and they were amazing, salty, savory, crunchy and delicious. There were several large crab hush puppies in the order, maybe 12-15.  I ate the ding dong chicken sandwich and it has peanut sauce and slaw. The flavors are like thai-asian chicken seasoning. The portion is generous and the seasoning tasted a little spicy but tasty.   We didn't have drinks but they had good beers listed. Parking is easier down the road in the dirt lot. We got there at 11:45 a.m. for lunch and there was no wait time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu 2018 thinking ding dong Ding Dong Chicken Sandwich is my order

E7YiOVRxqHqbAeF7YhwU9Q.text: Pinky's saved the day! We had a party last night and let's just say I wasn't feeling top-notch this morning! I needed fries and grease and a Diet Coke and wow did Pinky's deliver on all of that! Started with the loaded fries with chili and that was a corpse reviver! Then Alex ordered a burger and I ordered the Big John chicken sandwich and no regrets!! The service was great, place was poppin' and even better all the clientele appeared to also be on the struggle bus so this was a judgement free safe zone!!! Will be back! Thanks Pinky's!

iUJtMP77z8msjlFVLw9TOw.text: I love this place! Everything I've tried from drinks, my fave the "white trash burger" and desserts have been awesome! Service is always great too!!!

X6UOt6AjUcxrGXRpEnwPRA.text: Meh....wanted it to be better than it was.  Great vibe, cool looking staff, food just so so.  Falafel a little under cooked, pita had too much feta cheese.  May be a burger would have been better? Metal music in background I enjoyed - seriously.

j_Rpjt6re51ipTVPT59JYA.text: This is a cool place for lunch.  It gets packed pretty quick on weekdays.  If you crave for some fried foods and beer then give Pinky a try.  You will have to park in gravel lot since parking is very limited.  I would recommended this place to my friends n colleagues!!!

Chk9jqegGb4UK0SNH007gw.text: One of my fav things about pinky's is...they play good music! Good food for on the lower end prices compared to most burger places around Charlotte. Got a good funky vibe going on there; but it's welcoming and cool. And you can't beat their drink prices! That's my second fav thing about pinky's! ;)  I had a strawberry lemonade marg for ($6) but it was Sunday where they have 1/2price so $2.50 a glass.   Their sweet potato fries with honey mustard=my fav side.   Their burgers are good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgers, sweet potato fries, black eye pea salad.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drink menu. Great specials er day tho!! For real.

6VnZ-sQHlqeWK-h-R3x_Zg.text: We were in the area and decided to try Pinky's Westside Grill . We noted there was outdoor seating offered.  The restaurant inside and out has all kinds of signs and decorations on the wall making the restaurant quite interesting.  Rock music was played loudly inside which was not the most relaxing  conditions to eat lunch in my opinion. The menus features soup of the day , lots of fried food such as fried pickles ,fried Buffalo wings  , crab hush puppies. Some healtier foods like white bean and rosemary hummus, salads to choose from spinach salad , chicken salad  tuna salad ,turkey salad . Fried baskets: popcorn chicken baskets , corn dog shrimp baskets, different kinds of tacos , hot dogs, and of course their famous burgers plus all kinds of sandwiches and sides like southern slaw, fried squash onion rings ,  black beans, potato salad, hush puppies and sweet potato fries etc . My dining mate and  I tried the white trash burger which we heard was one of the most popular burger choices.( burger with provolone, fried pickles, fried onion rings). Burgers offered as doubles ( an extra burger on the bun ). All burgers are cooked medium well. Staff are friendly and accommodating, prices average, plated on paper, comes out hot, average portions. We liked our burgers, waffle and sweet potato fries and tasty honey mustard sauce. Tasty food, catchy names on menu. However we found nothing extraordinary with our burger and fries. However if you are into burgers dogs and fried food; all good with interesting combos. And oh yes, vegetarian burgers and hot dogs on the menu too. Desserts , banana pudding, cake etc. We would return and try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. inside view of white trash burger

cj9J14q5T1I-N_kZAW-v8Q.text: At Pinky's Westside I had what some might call it "winner winner burger dinner." I got the White Trash burger, which was spruced up with ranch dressing, fried pickles (of Penguin drive-in legend), and onion rings. A side of crispy waffle fries and a Shirley Temple for the first time. Oh my goodness! I can eat that every.single.day. Daily Specials: EVERYDAY: $5 Mimosa and Bloody Mary AND $15 Margarita Pitchers. Mon: $1.5 Draft beers Tue: 1/2 price Tallboys & local bottles and cans. Wed: $3 well drinks & margarita + $6 long island iced tea + $1.5 beers. Thur: $2.50 All drafts + $5 unicorn tears. Fri: $3 craft beer roulette. Sat: $5 absolute anarchy (all absolute flavors). Sun: 1/2 price glasses of wine. A meal at Pinky's Westside is definitely unforgettable! Four and Three Quarters Yelps.

f9LUlFK0XXD2ItYhNdCSzw.text: Incredible little lunch spot.  I felt like I hit the lottery when I found this spot!  I stopped in at about 1:30pm on a weekday and they were still busy at that hour.  I only had to wait a few mins for a table as they seem very efficient.  The food was quick, delicious and the service was fast and friendly.  I would definitely recommend this spot for lunch.

fXEEu3dsx5MeRtqx59aVxQ.text: Worth the wait! The line moves faster than expected and the food (and prices) are worth it! I love sitting outside for lunch on nice days while enjoying the tacos, shrimp corn dogs and one of their well-priced beers. Parking is even super easy with the lot next door!

YA5CwQwrEdFO2PYhvIFuOQ.text: Pinky's is the weird, quirky place I wish someone had told me about four years ago when I moved to Charlotte. I love the eclectic decor and the staff has always been pleasant. And of course, most importantly, the food!! My favorites are the Beyond Meat burger, sweet potato fries and crab puppies. Go hungry!

ftS8RU4yz_qWiy9aLhlgag.text: Amazing food and friendly staff! It stays pretty busy  so not ideal if you're looking for a more private place to eat. I've gotten something new each time and have not been disappointed!

o6UD8vG-5okELHV07ITR6g.text: Pinky's is  a Charlotte staple. I hope Pinky's never leaves and never changes. A great southern style friendly spot to stop in for a quick meal or drinks. The food is very good but the prices are great. Personally I love the burgers and all of the sides. Really good prices on beer as well! I wish there were more friendly affordable places like Pinky's!

umoF8YuM9_5ikrknLJbzSA.text: Good food. Good service. I got the mammoth burger with 2 patties. It was delicious but hard to eat as it was so big. Would definitely go back when visiting Charlotte. There was a little bit of a wait as the place isn't very big.

rMDan081ZEO_M7Bskd70hg.text: This is worth the drive. I Live in randleman and due to health don't get out much when my husband wants to cheer me up after treatment this is the place. Vegan corndog , any burger, pickles and really anything going to try the corndog shrimp when able to eat seafood.

1P4vkh_e4cZaqZ0-lsbASg.text: Average spot.   This place is very cool, they did a great job creating a look and feel. As for the food, it is average. If you lived close, it would definitely be in the rotation, because it is a nice place.   Warning! If you are visiting and you have limited meals to try great food, this is not the place. Do not waste a meal here. The burger is nothing special, the taste of the actual patty is blend. The Chili Chese Fries are good, but nothing to write home about. Again, this place is not great, I would not recommend for an out of towner.

rdFKBcTV7fcPMeeO3r7Q8w.text: Kerrie was our server tonight and Kerrie was amazing! My hot tea was delicious. Our fries were hot & so great. Thank you! Tonight was a beautiful night because of the wonderful service & delightful food. Thank you!!

M1gO637Sn9ds_lrXy8gDvA.text: This place was kinda wild. Funky is a pretty good way to describe it,  and I can see why it was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives! Wild = good in my books, by the way!  My husband really wanted to try the crab hush puppies and I am glad he ordered them - they are super good! He ordered a white trash burger which he liked a lot, there is something about the meat that makes their burgers very tasty. Even the non-meat  (aka vegetarian) nature boy was seriously very good, though!  My order was right up my alley, a ding-dong style burger. This creation includes slaw, crunchy peanut butter and sriracha..and it really works. I did add some extra sriracha to cut thru the sweetness of the pb a bit, but I also really love spicy things.   I knew the pb/spice combo would work and be delicious because it's super similar to my staple breakfast; a toasted English muffin with pb, chili paste and cucumber.  Try it if you like this burger!

V-FrZksuiYxknvzg6XpGDg.text: This is my favorite place. I Come at least three times a week to get the grilled popcorn chicken salad. Everyone is so nice and the salad keeps me satisfied for the whole day.

BuQfi59XK_b9O1uFnYNu6g.text: Atmosphere is very welcoming and fun! I enjoy Pinky's each and every time I go! Margarita pitch for $14 you can't beat!!! My fiance enjoyed his white trash burger and I enjoyed the Patsy Melt yet the meat to bread ratio was a bit off it was good. The sweet potato fries were delicious!

JSUHhOucORwR7dSTZ4wMDQ.text: Ordered 4 different meals & an appetizer and ALL were great! Real burgers & chili! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome food &amp; cool place to eat!

bVaI-zWRfKidGR5EONlV3w.text: I am a little biased given that Pinky's is walkable from my house, but this is one of my favorite go-tos for cocktails and a bite to eat. There is something for everyone from a good old fashion burger to the more unique ding dong chicken (grilled chicken with PB, slaw, and sriracha -- trust me, it works); all types of salads, sandwiches, and apps in between.   I've tried almost everything on the menu but my standard meal here always starts with crab puppies -- hush puppies with crab meat. Good drink specials and a fun cocktail menu top it all off. Oh, and friendly service to boot!  Parking isn't so great. There is hardly any in the front but they have a full dirt lot in back. No big deal, other than it's a few extra steps but that never hurt anyone. I would also give a word of caution to parents taking their kids here: they play all kinds of music, some with non-kid-friendly language. I personally don't give a BLEEEEEP because that's part of what makes the place so charming for me. But I know others might be turned off by it.   Otherwise, definitely check the place out, I think almost anyone can enjoy it!

A3ZVsycQJNk3OXzraYwl3A.text: Best diner burger in town. Just your perfect burger without anything crazy. White trash is my favorite!

T6SFNQhUUnZgVodpEYzlGQ.text: The Triple G Burger was to die for! The crab puppies were my favorite app, and the banana pudding was the best banana pudding I've had in a long long time. The service and atmosphere were really nice too. Pinky's is a must go-to spot when your in Charlotte. Straight

z2Mb48M8kOKgvFottaLDlg.text: We stopped here for the banana pudding. It was really clutch. The container is a full pint for 4$. Please make sure to stop by if you are in the Charlotte area.

H37Unl-DOO2c9INh_y6hMg.text: Usually a little wait, but always great food. My favorite is the hush puppy shrimp. DELISH. Really cute building & all the servers are a pleasure.

phA-mB9qj2b1Yl8Zth19Og.text: Cheap and tasty.   They offer a build your own burger if you don't like the preset burger choices. Pinky dog which was overflowing with chili and pimento cheese.  The sweet potato chips and fries were good.  The burgers, hot dogs, and tacos are all good.

RwLD7zXB6zS9P5aUaUfRAA.text: Came to Pinky's with friends while on my Keto diet . The menu looks so appetizing, different combinations that I would have loved to try. I had a simple 5oz pterodactyl burger with bacon, cheese, and mushrooms, pickles (no bun). It was very delicious! Everyone at the table enjoyed their choices. Surprisingly my friend got the soup special-crab bisque & she said it was tasty; it had chunks of crab & potato. Can't wait to try some of the other options post-keto.

4hQiuJmhc4g2NFgXpAP2Cg.text: This was a place I had recommended to me from a friend at work! You can tell this place is popular because it was packed when we went. Now I do have to say they were able to filter through and get everyone sat pretty quickly which is impressive. All the staff seemed to work together and help everyone out. I loveee pimento cheese and it seemed like you could pretty much put it on anything, so I got some on my fries and stuffed myself. They also had half off glasses of wine on Sunday when we went! The boyfriend got a burger, and it was super delicious. Overall, great place to stop and grab a bite to eat. I only gave four stars because it had most of the seating is outside, which the south is hot, so no thank you!

d1eefXF8EknE4pwPNHPPxw.text: My girls loved their meals. One had a patty melt and loved it!  My other daughter got the popcorn chicken meal and loved it as well.  My husband got the chicken tacos and said it was OK. I think we would try the Korean BBQ tacos next time.  The service was great!

6X4GxhwJ_uNTd8kGVpHcKA.text: First time here and came in during lunch so had to wait a bit but not too bad. Ordered the Pinky's dog with pimento cheese and chili. It came on a pretzel bun which was a nice twist. The hot dog was ok, not great, but not bad. Got the onion straws and they were great. Came out very hot and loved them. Started with the fried pickles and they were good if not a bit greasy. My wife had the taco salad and it was huge with big chunks of chicken. She took some home and had enough for another whole meal. The prices were average. My biggest disappointment was the service. The staff was polite but not friendly at all. Had to ask a couple times for drink refills and had to ask for the check. I wouldn't rule this place out because of the service but just want you to know what to expect.

feFEy9ibEaNnJXoU1VrRBA.text: This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to a place that appeared on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives, to Pinky's Westside Grill in Charlotte.  Dora here. Don't be alarmed not to find a spot directly in front of the diner. Just at the end of the strip, you'll find ample parking, a plus for any business near downtown. The inside was jammed for a Sunday lunch.  For my lunch, I ordered the White Trash Burger, which includes provolone, fried pickles, and onion rings with a spicy ranch sauce and a side of onion rings (straws). For some reason, the burger that arrived had raw pickles and onions with mayonnaise. The burger was OK, a little over cooked for my taste, but served on a soft bun. Maybe if it would have been served as advertised on the menu, I would have been more impressed. The onion rings were good, but a little greasy.  Dora here. Check out the popcorn chicken, little nuggets of breaded and fried white meat, served atop waffle fries with a side of slaw. I'm a huge fan of chicken, fried or grilled, so when I saw this on the menu, I couldn't convince myself to go with something more adventuresome. Like Pimp'n Fries (waffle fries topped with chili and melted pimento) or the Asian-inspired Ding Dong Chicken Sandwich, marinated chicken slathered with peanut butter, hot sauce and slaw. I probably should've worked up the courage because the chicken could've used less time in the fryer; the outside was a bit dry and brittle. Awesome waffle fries, though, light on the seasoning and not too-potatoey as some tend to be.  Still Dora. Pinky's tag-team friendly servers ensure that your cup never runs dry. And if the crowd hanging around outside on a Sunday afternoon and the awesome reviews are any indication, we might've caught them on an off day.   We rate this restaurant 3 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving good food. ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog
