Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet potato fries and Buffalo Shrimp Tacos

UmikQkQLes624eYL5l9uzA.text: Triple D Curse in full effect!  So, let me say this it's a really fun and big place!   The Food: We ordered a few different items, Fried Pickles, Burgers.  My Burger was flat, no seasoning And it was boring...Also my pet peeve, the breading did not stick to the fried pickles, I hate that.   The Staff: Super nice, and knowledgeable on the beer list!  The Place: Super fun place, very lively and fun!  But very very busy!  The Drinks: GreAt selection of Local Craft beer and a Full Bar!   Again just average middle of the road, I tend to think a lot of places phone it in once getting on DDD.

Bj3eNr3UHerocf9ZeYqwlQ.text: Amazing experience. Went on a busy Saturday night after a huge event at Bank of America Stadium and got in and out in an hour and 15. Service was amazing and the food was fresh and great. Best part was after food and a 25% tip for the great service dinner for me and my girlfriend was only $25. Would recommend 10/10.

W6HXFMPn36VV371roaHJLg.text: What a fun place with good ol fashion "junk" food, but the taste was fantastic.   We got some fantastic deep fried crab puppies.  They were full of crab and they came with some fantastic tartar sauce.  Another appetizer we got, which was the best thing we got was the Pimp'n Fries.  One of the best things I have ever have.  Waffle fries drenched in a pimento cheese mix.  Just fantastic.  Worth the calories and guilt when they are gone.  Get them!!!  We had burgers, chili dogs and a salad.  They were above average.  Not the best ever but good.  This place is legit because of all the comfort food options and the price is so cheap.  What a reasonable price for great food and beer.  The happy hour specials which are always going are fantastic.  This place will become a regular for me. Go and indulge !

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna Wasabi Salad
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Puppies
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimp&#39;n Fries.

nE7xvUQdY9sG1JTwNta7iA.text: Our party of six came in here on a cold, rainy Sunday evening.  The place was busy and we were told about a 15-20 minute wait, which turned into 50 minutes.  Meanwhile, smaller parties of 4 were being seated immediately.  The host kept apologizing but that didn't get us seated any sooner.  I saw two tables empty and they could have been pushed together for six people but it didn't happen.  They were given to people who came in after us.  Eventually, we were seated and the waitress did immediately come to take our drink order.  During our wait to be given a table, we had already memorized the menu and decided what we wanted, so she took our food order also.    I ordered the popcorn chicken and husband wanted the corn dog shrimp. I ordered the mixed drink called Unicorn's tears.  Everyone's drinks came but mine.  I had to ask about it and there was another wait because the waitress forgot to put the drink order in.  She apologized and eventually, our food and my drink arrived.  The food was good and husband was pleased with his shrimp.  I didn't like the Southern slaw, but my chicken and waffle fries were fine.  Others in our group were happy with their food also.    I think I would have enjoyed the evening more if it had gone smoother with the seating issue.  I was ready to go somewhere else after the 20 minute mark had passed and seeing others be given a table ahead of us.  I liked the atmosphere, loud music, eclectic people...but it will be awhile before I return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn dog shrimp - featured on &#34;Diners, Drive-in&#39;s and Dives.&#34;
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Popcorn chicken with buffalo sauce, waffle fries and Southern slaw
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Unicorn&#39;s Tears - tasty, but you have to really like pineapple

A8tBzjo8MK-vkiQiUh2omA.text: Pinky's burgers and thinly sliced onion rings are my jam. They have a really cool vibe inside with unique decor and loud music. You can order through Postmates, and I'd recommend doing that on weekends. It's not really worth the horrible line on Saturdays..it gets ridiculous. Other than that, it's affordable, good food from friendly people!

_WCkJJPwKTR9dQsMxLkQZw.text: Food was okay we ordered take out and a few items in our order were left out and took about 20 more minutes to be made. They were very crowded so we understood just hated we had to go back. The place is very loud so be prepared to talk over music and other conversation. And parking is terrible. Other than that I would return for food but not the parking. Uber maybe...

xnIkuQ8RViqXvep-cOe4hw.text: I just love everything about Pinky's.  The atmosphere, the people, the menu, you get the picture.  It's one of those spots that I hope never goes out of style but is beginning to be more and more well known, which is probably a good thing.   I've had sandwiches and burgers that are delicious here, and their sweet potato fries are perfect, as well as the fried pickles.  Also recently tried a salad option which was great.  It was a hefty salad - order the buffalo shrimp but asked for grilled chicken instead of the shrimp and they give you a healthy portion of the chicken on top!   They have a perfect patio for those nice weather days, and a huge bar selection with many local beers on tap and plenty to choose from! It's definitely a must try for any charlottean.

H2Ku7ZEQsYcqBgFtHQkL9Q.text: Funky and fun and loud.  Good menu options for a diner kind of a place.  Visually stimulating with the art and signs and servers' tattoos!   Glad I went.  My BIG JOHN Chicken sandwich was good.  Instead of little tiny paper plates, I wish they would have had real plates.  Nothing comes with the sandwiches.  Side dishes are extra.  This is not the place for deep conversation, due to the noise level.   But, overall, PURE FUN.  I would recommend it for the experience itself!  The crowds of people there indicate its popularity.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

UPLY6Tm6liwl1A2-VeSUKQ.text: Ordered a burger  from here and it was pretty good. I love super beetles so I was in love with them from the start. It's located in a cute little area. We found this place on diners drive ins and dives I believe and we were pleased. We went as we were traveling back home and we stopped by early so the place was empty and we really got to enjoy having it almost all to ourselves.   Can't say I have any complaints from this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

BcsTWYBtIeAcLkWaiqWWqg.text: Been coming here since they opened. These people made the penguin what it became and then got screwed hard on making a deal with the property owner. Ironically the penguin just closed for good and this place is rocking everyday.  Line out the door during prime times.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love this place

ZhFAxveCn9YGE8nkwSNedg.text: We were really excited to finally eat at Pinky's.... unfortunately it never happened. We arrived with our dogs in tow thinking we would grab dinner and then head to Lucky Dog. Well that didn't go as planned. They don't allow dogs on their patio. I definitely understand this rule and I don't have a problem with it but I do have a problem with them not stating it on their site or Facebook. The majority of restaurants in Charlotte allow dogs and I was really surprised they didn't and didn't even have a sign posted on the door saying so. I'm giving two stars for lack of communication. I will update this review when we are able to come back without the pups.

yb_goUXd4Wkj-IK6UwkyQQ.text: Pinky's is not somewhere you go for healthy eating. I felt like my cholesterol shot up a zillion points after eating here, but after a night of drinking, I needed it.   We ordered the fried pickles and crab hush puppies. The fried pickles were good, but the crab hush puppies were awesome. I do not eat hush puppies often, as I live in the Northeast, so to have such things with the addition of crab was just fantastic.   Wanting to do the South right, I ordered the grilled bologna sandwich "westside," with chili, slaw, mustard, onion, and then some pimento cheese. My cousins ordered the white trash burger (provolone, fried pickles, ranch) and a patty melt, respectively. Both of them had nothing but good things to say about their sandwiches.   I wasn't thrilled with the bologna sandwich, but I ate it anyway. The roll was a little too soft, which made things very sloppy - although that was probably to be part of the experience. The bologna didn't have much taste; I think I was expecting something more like Taylor ham. But it was prepared well, because my Southern cousins approved when I let them try it. As a result, I can't criticize the kitchen; it just wasn't to my personal taste. You win some, you lose some... unless we're talking about weight, which I'm sure I wouldn't lose if I lived near Pinky's.  The service was great and the prices were fair. I would like to come back and try some of their fun mixed drinks one night, as well as the Cheerwine and Sun Drop pound cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Tony Baloney, westside style with pimento cheese
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab puppies and fried pickles

JpdkvKEctw8yFRmRrNFiEQ.text: super cool place. my burger was delicious, good beer, the fried pickles were ok (i'm critical of fried pickles. i demand the best and only the best), the staff and patrons were fun.

JSo9xXNN5wO5cIM312ncvA.text: The food was okay.  I left with a full stomach but I wasn't overly satisfied with my meal.  My boyfriend and I ordered a lot of menu items ranging from the hushpuppies with crab meat, Southern 500 hot dog, turkey burger, fries and onion rings.  While the crab puppies were tasty, nothing was memorable.  I probably won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hushpuppies with crab meat

ZX-QlHv2e0vCIpMxVO3IvA.text: I love this "dive" restaurant! Most everything is fried and southern and not the healthiest, but it's amazing! Highly recommend the fried bologne sandwich and fried squash! Their crab puppies are pretty unique and love eating a few of those. The drink menu is diverse and offers quite a few fun drinks. It's a small restaurant, so wait times can be long, but all of the waiters/waitresses work as a team, so service is pretty quick once you're seated!

k8Qss51z9juPUBeiWeHP5Q.text: A friend of mine came in town and she wanted to eat some where that was fairly close to her accommodations.  We decided to go to Pinky's.  I am glad I did.  I ordered the "White trash burger" and she ordered the "Veggie" burger.  We were pleased.  I highly recommend this place.  The food is good and budget friendly.

gYIxsJtSBKItP4EkYrRqKA.text: We ended up at Pinky's since our inital restaurant/bar choice was crowded, but we weren't disappointed!  The food was tasty for diner style food. The menu was easy to read and featured different food offerings (Burgers in 3 sizes, Hot Dogs -Corn Dog or Rueben styled, Chicken or Burger Sandwiches with crunchy peanut butter topping)!   The three of us had 2 "The Jive Turkey Burgers, a White Trash Burger and a Reuben Hot Dog (minus 1000 Island dressing & swiss cheese) and Sweet Potato Fries. It was $5 ABSOLUTE Night, so we had a few alcohol drinks too. The food was good tasting and we were pleased, but the best was saved for last....the dessert. We chosed the Banana Pudding over the "Cherry Lemon Sundrop, Almond Confettie or Chocolate Swirl Cupcakes" and we were DELIGHTED!!! The pudding was great and had a very homemade cold pudding taste (made with whopped cream) served in a stryfoam bowl.  Oh, I forgot to mention that all the plates, utensils or cups were either paper, stryfoam or plastic. No diswasher needed at this place, well at least not for the food unless it for the pots and pans!! Lol  I would come back, if only for the "Banana Pudding"!!! Smh/lol

cPOhDqR9s2Zc9xBUWajIqw.text: Food is excellent.. would definitely come back.. had the Korean taco and the burger very good... we had a few Mojito perfect

QXtJ6A01Y35kkY5Et7_nFw.text: Pinky's is a great, family friendly restaurant with cheap food that is unique and delicious. The burgers are the stars of the show here, especially the Ding Dong Burger which is a 5oz patty topped with peanut butter, sriracha and honey cilantro slaw. They quite possibly could have the best fried pickles in the Queen City. The atmosphere is eclectic and fun and the service was fast.  Definitely a must for any Foodie visiting Charlotte!

Rbh7JbBoZYMpMm1ewbikBw.text: Holy shit, the food is freaking awesome!  First time here, everything looks so good when looking at other table's food. My burger was great, waffle fries were perfect. Coming back to try it all.

j3s_xHbZrhc5oNI4tVDzSw.text: Pinky's had a good atmosphere and great food. It had elevated bar food- good but not knock your socks off good. We got the crab hush puppies which were delicious. The corn dog shrimp and Korean BBQ pork tacos were also great.

k4BzXDnMap9BehEBarG9Yg.text: If you want good old American food, this is the place. Don't come here if you're on a diet. The drinks are awesome and the food is great, heavy, but super yummy. It's also a great value for what you get

XHgTjPZNtLZBEDzqPdDI6Q.text: The best word to describe Pinky's is eclectic....from the patrons, to the staff, to the food, to the music, to the decor, the place is just one big melting pot of awesome.  I'm pretty sure that I was waited on by every server working tonight, and each one was efficient and friendly.  The service was awesome.  My fitbit exploded as I finished my meal, since I picked probably the least healthy (but most delicious) options.  I had what was supposed to be a bakers dozen crab fritters, but there were 15 total.  I ate every one.  The crab was sweet, and the fritters a perfect golden color.  The tartar sauce they came with for dunking was more than mayo and relish...it had a vinegary bite that was an awesome compliment to the sweet.  Then I had ginormous corn bread shrimp.  The batter was thick, but not greasy.  Again, the bite of some cocktail sauce perfectly offset the sweet of the corn batter.  I don't like fries, and usually skip them, but the waffle fries that came with the shrimp were crispy, and had the right amount of salt.  The only reason I didn't eat them all was because I was stuffed.  I'll be back.

FJdp75sPPG09Y7XzXlUnQA.text: Awesome atmosphere and loved the decorations. I enjoyed the outrageous items on the menu such as the Ding Dong Chicken  (chicken sandwich with slaw, peanut butter and hot sauce). Some of the other items were not as tasty (Patty's melt and popcorn chicken).

AbgGIDWTpIgYjd7Nz_YOqg.text: Still trying to figure out what the rave is about. Everything is either fried or not really that good. We live fairly close so we keep trying new things. Great bar...

T8ld30HdLqGvf62co68uXA.text: Great food. Highly recommend the white trash burger. Well priced and nice outdoor patio area. Def will be coming back.

draZzkqlJekP1SlRJVH9sA.text: Gotta hand it to someone who takes a old service station and turn it into a burger gold mine! These are the things you've gotta love about cities like Charlotte! Hardly any parking, but if you determine to get inside somehow, you're gonna love it! We started with the waffle fries that comes with pimento cheese and added bacon to that for a scrumptious result! The fries were crispy, the pimento cheese was excellent, and the bacon was real! Next, I got the White Trash Burger that was simply amazing! A nicely cooked burger with cheese, fried pickles, fried onion strings, and a spicy ranch mayo! Seems as though they have a very creative drink menu with specials every day! What kept me from giving them a five star rating was simply, the service! The servers all seemed disinterested. We struggled to get refills, waited nearly 10 minutes for a glass of wine, and the ticket was just kinda tossed on the table! This southern gentleman will certainly be back, at least for the food.

8H9hojdQYQQB_lRE4QK2PA.text: Went here and tried a bunch of menu items. Was pleasantly surprised with the ding dong chicken which is a grilled chicken sandwich with peanut sauce. Also good was the pimento cheese fries and the crab puppies

3LhduT5Qn3hT3N-9556Bcw.text: Went with a group of classmates, tried the crab puppies and inspite of the rave reviews they were not good. Heavily breaded, and not much crab really not what I expected.  Mixed reviews from the others that were a part of the group as well. Maybe I will give them another try at a later time. Servers were nice, and attentive.

2J2GYrN4hQgsSVNhEevQHg.text: This is your local bar. Come bring your dog and kids and get one of Pinky's great white trash burgers and fries. Service was great and so friendly. This is my local bar even without food

382rl_8oSPwgOCFAjgLbCA.text: Very good burgers. A great menu and a very hip staff. If you want an off the wall yet delicious burger, this place is for you.

tQZlMgYMZbGHkTFJVjURng.text: For a burger joint we love this place.  The service is great.  You have multiple wait staff checking on you.  The pimento cheese waffle fries are a must have if you are into that.  The white trash burger is my favorite.  We get chicken wings as take out at least 2 times a month.  We have been going here for over 8 years.  If we have friends from out of town we more often then not end up here.  Price is super reasonable and will shock you.  Leave room for the banana pudding!

-iufRTDnNl5Q-Sa-07I0BA.text: Great local spot. I get the white trash burger every single time...love it. Guys fiery been here and you call tell why. Highly recommended.

n6sax_Ce3wJffGUXNX80GQ.text: Corn dog shrimp basket....heaven. But what I'm really mad about is that I completely missed the drink menu so I have to go back just for that. The rest of the menu looked completely appetizing but I couldn't order everything.  plus they have turkey burgers and vegetarian food options

5u2h-8NzGuTowDcjq-GKBw.text: If you have ever seen Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives, then you probably will recognize this little joint. Pinky's Westside Grill is located in Charlotte and Huntersville. We ended up stopping at an off time so we could make sure we got a table. When we walked in, the atmosphere was so fun and casual. They have so many cool things on the walls that you could probably go 100 times and find a new thing every time.  It was so hard to choose because everything looked so amazing, most of the items on the menu were very interesting because its hard to imagine what a corndog shrimp looks like. We ended up ordering a bunch of things; we got the Pinky Dog, Pimp'N Fries, and the White Trash Burger. If you couldn't tell we got a little excited about Chili. The White Trash Burger was probably my favorite because I loved the fried pickles on top. The drink I had was the Wedding punch, it had Absolut Citron, Amaretto, Melon Liquor, House Made Sour & Pineapple Juice. It was a very light refreshing drink to go with all that heavy Chili. I recommend if you are ever in the area to try out Pinky's. It will definitely be a place I will go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

PaoYYK686ecK7S4abXPPdw.text: Food is good. The customer service is exceptionally good. The staff works as a team to satisfy you. They are attentive to your drink refill, clearing your table of things you are no longer eating, etc.... It is rare to see it at the level that they do it. Only downside is parking. It is very tight and skimpy.   And not really a downside, I'm just into heavy metal music. It was constant and loud the whole time we were there. It was difficult to hold a conversation with the people you are enjoying your meal with.

MCtNpUClFF3DDj_KTUVpYA.text: Definitely one of the most fun places in the QC. Great service and food with an even more entertaining music selection. They have a decently diverse beer selection as well. Try the White Trash burger if you're feeling adventurous and hungry.

vRztR8bgCQqIF3n6Jnblqg.text: I came here while visiting Charlotte on the suggestion of my sister, who went to school in the area. Pinky's was one of her favorite go-to spots to eat. She always raves about the food here! So when I was planning my trip here, she insisted on me making Pinky's one of my stops.  The food was pretty good. I love any place that actually serves good fried pickles. I ordered the buffalo chicken salad as my meal, though I'm not quite sure why as I'm not a big fan of spicy food at all. But aside from that, the food was really good. I would have wished I ordered something else just because it was very spicy.  It's a small restaurant, and you're in very close proximity with your table neighbors. You can hear a lot of conversations outside of your own this way.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo chicken salad.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles.

4GCBAh5ZBK6p4l83V1XEvA.text: Went for lunch and was as good as always. Very good food - pretty much what you expect: huge, juicy burgers, awesome French fries, fun, lively, funky decor and friendly staff. Only complaint is that the fried squash is too thin cut and tasted mostly of the breading. Not bad but far from the best. I love going there and enjoying the atmosphere more than anything. Wasn't crowded for a Monday lunch and would've stayed there all day if I could've.

IZffKnoasXoW1JxO_1UW3g.text: UPDATE - So I get a message in my inbox from the owner (Andy C.) and he sends me a link (youtu.be/kRRK4loO6xQ) to a Anthony Bourdain interview where they mention the word Yelp and he says "F em". Nothing worse than an elite Yelper? Pardon me, but is this the way a manager should respond to a customer's problem? I think not. The message was very passive-aggressive and I expected more from the top of the company. Really liked your establishment. Seriously. Ruined it for me,man. Integrity shot. Didn't deserve this treatment. Terrible manager - Ran into manager on duty who was terrible at customer service. Came to hang a poster for a show and get a bite to eat. While this might have been the first time I did not have tape on me to hang the poster, usually I do have it. I asked a server on hand if they might have some tape. The server tells the manager who comes out and tells me "Sorry you can't hang your poster. We don't sell supplies we sell burgers". Thing is I always come here so I'm well aware of what they sell there. Let her know it's not ever cool to talk to a customer the way she did and she tells me she thought what she said was funny. No remorse and no apology. Gotta do better on the front,Pinky's.

XPBVurmekI2fOKQCnEgfZg.text: There is no place to park in their small lot, but other than that I had a great experience. I got an order to go. Vegan: The Nature Boy (no pepper jack cheese, no chipotle mayo, on a gluten-free bun) with a side of Black Eye Pea Salad. Everything was delicious, prepared as requested, ready when I arrived at the specified time, and was a good price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black Eye Pea Salad (Vegan as is)
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Nature Boy (vegan-ized: no pepper jack cheese, no chipotle mayo, on a gluten-free bun).

DDXg4Ih-yPJTNFTTf6lhdg.text: I think everyone knows about Pinky's by now. The burgers are simple, inexpensive and very good. Actually, everything on the menu is good. Definitely try the crab puppies.

U48uBry91qWesp8WyKWRXg.text: Quite the place.  Went for the Asian Pork burger.  Unfortunately that is only a special item.  Went with the Triple D instead.  Will definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

JlWIeHi9znFBoC_bjLFg_w.text: Yuck! Never been impressed! The burger was greasy.  The service was lacking. The atmosphere was a turn off too.

eKbvKkIgmmDTP0XLXzWglQ.text: Delicious little dive right outside of Uptown Charlotte! Their crab cake hush puppies are to die for and the sauces are phenomenal too. I had their korean bbq tacos and was not disappointed in the slightest! They were perfectly seasoned and I really enjoyed them. We also ordered a burger with pimento cheese and the cheese was melting off of the bun. It was so good. I had never been here and was extremely happy with the food, service and the unique atmosphere! They have a huge patio as well and I am really looking forward to going out there and enjoying the food and beautiful charlotte weather once it cools down!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean BBQ tacos! They were so good, I wanted more!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious pimento cheese burger!

QsJzPCDPaokKjDaynAsyKw.text: A fun diner with great atmosphere. Food was good, but not quite the "Triple D" experience I was thinking it would be. None the less I can't wait to get back with the grandkids. They'll love the dinosaur out front and the VW on the roof.

GHQpG_WgJaftwHIG1jdb_g.text: Heard about Pinkys thru a good friend, who saw this on t.v from Food Network with Guy.  Not a lot of parking in the front of the building, so we had to park in the back (very muddy, and in need of repairs).  The wait was 45 mins...and was every bit of 45 minutes.  The hostess was really friendly, but the rest of the staff was OK.  I understand it was Friday around 8ish or 9ish and they were slammed.  Loved the set up of this little spot.  Got the crab puppies and they were Fantastic.  The white trash burger was okay, just need some season on the patty.  Overall it was good.  Not from Charlotte, but will come back for those crabpuppies.

0Juep7FJ9Ni108HTMUt92Q.text: This place is the best for some fast/casual dining. The staff is very attentive and friendly. They won't seat you until your whole party is there because they turn tables very quickly. All the burgers are great go-tos for me but definitely try the tacos too because they are delicious. On warm days they have an excellent patio where you can have one of their amazing signature cocktails.

ANGnzXZpw9IL7jClLgk-kQ.text: Had the WhiteTrash Burger with Tots. Order of Wings Barbalo Style.  Great food and will certainly be going back to try a lot more.   Will update with new dishes.

b0OjdzjTVRr78iVbp_jtLw.text: I've heard great things about Pinkys and decided it was finally time to try it out. We arrived and we're seated immediately. I appreciated the very quick and collective service that Pinkys provides, in which  all servers take care of all tables. The only issue I had with this is at one point I wasn't quite sure which person to track down to receive a fork for my food.   We ordered the crab puppies for an appetizer and man oh man oh man we're they good. I think I ate half of them instead of my meal. The tartar sauce that came with them was very rich and sour creamy which was a different but delicious offering. For dinner, I got the pinky dog which was very good but heavy and kind of hard to eat with it being topped so heavily with chili and cheese. My boyfriend had the Korean pork tacos which were really good and we shared a side of waffle fries that were cooked perfectly. Everything was really good but I still left a little disappointed. Maybe everyone has just talked it up way too much.   I did really really enjoy the atmosphere and decor in the restaurant and would recommend their very quick service! I would come back but try something new (except for the crab puppies, I will need those again)

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front of the menu
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Back of the menu
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab puppies with tartar sauce

KzcJJhCYdZ8FVFICNvsWOA.text: Today I gave Pinky's another try thank you Andy for your help and making it worth trying again was running short on time got it to go food was good it just wasn't hat it looked like on the photos but other than that we will visit to dine back in

C0KTAh7lJb3VIwArJ8_pZg.text: Love this place! The Wasabi Ranch is by far my favorite part of any meal. The atmosphere is great, the food is creative and amazing.  Highly recommended

hdpsBWp5Sm3RKOP7jGY-UQ.text: This place is sooooo good. It's a really chill environment. Bad ass music, awesome staff with really cool tattoos and just an overall awesome atmosphere. First of all, there's not gonna be any parking so just go ahead and pull around back there's a ton of parking around the corner! White trash burger is legit and my favorite. Get an extra side of spicy ranch on the side because you're gonna love it. Staff is super friendly and knows the menu well. They have a really good drink menu, so if you like alcohol be sure to order something! Your bill will be super cheap because it's not expensive at all. Food comes out quickly. Give this place a try!

qkWesHcug9Kwi1oxjpghig.text: I just left here and am very disappointed.  The food was good.  What I am upset about  is my friend and I sat at the bar during lunch.   As the bartender poured a beer for another table it sprayed all on me.  My face,down my shirt all over me.   She was apologetic and felt bad.  It was an accident......but that was it.  I couldn't believe she didn't offer to pay for my drinks or offer me one.   I actually asked jokingly and she was like oh ok I guess you can have a free drink.   I was like can you take one off that was on my tab.   She said ok.   She then took my friends drinks off that were on special for $3 not mine!!   I was the one sprayed!!!!!    I smelled like beer and have to go home and change so I can go back out.    I feel like this is horrible customer service and won't be back.    I order food for clients here regularly.  That will stop.

ltFyXh3IVgFkwpJ4T7CzlQ.text: Wow!  So many good choices on the menu it was hard to choose. Awesome vibe. We had a variety and shared. Highly recommend. Great service.  Loved it

5G8ExvZJHWLdzRPKYL-KXQ.text: Would LOVE to write a review on the food but I cannot.  Why?  Well, after parking in a very muddy, rut-filled gravel/mud parking lot, we walked in and stood at the hostess stand...  After five minutes of being ignored, seeing the hostess walk by us three times, ignoring us to help others, we left!   Pinky's - you've gotten too big for your britches.  Sheesh.  You lost out on some really hungry folks - oh well.   And to the people who we heard were waiting an hour to eat at Pinky's...wow.  There are other places to eat, folks.

ceV3GFt6DUJF2Swh9e04Kw.text: Last time I went there was decent friendly staff. I order a burger and fries it was good decent burger but the fries tasted like it was fry in fish oil.

YHjRA4pqRnNt7DkgDrE9bA.text: We were in the mood for burgers and fries so my friend suggested we go to Pinky's (so he could get a vegan chili hotdog). Great suggestion especially since this is another spot that has been featured on one of my favorite food show Diners Drive Inn and Dives.  The place is a great dive bar with a really cool patio! There are all types of cool artifacts on the walls. Are bartender also was really great and made sure my friends and I got our orders in before the kitchen closed!  I got the 5 ounce PTERODACTYL burger with everything on it. All burgers are cooked medium well and my burger was juicy something I look for when eating a good burger. Unfortunately the burgers don't come with fries so I had to order them as a side. They give you a good amount of waffle fries which was a good thing because u shared them with my friend.  I had my burger prepared with everything on it just one of the various ways you can get. They also have other menu items including crab puppies (hush puppies with crab in them) and corn dog shrimp! Can't wait to go back and try both of them on my next visit. They have a great drink menu and even a section for those who don't drink alcohol. Make sure you check the pinks painted Volkswagen bug!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

FB8zWfvl2GcjaZ41-tPWQg.text: First time going was this past weekend. Walking in, it was super packed so I didn't expect to get seated quickly, but we waited for only 10 minutes!  We had burgers, a hot dog, drinks, the southern coleslaw, and the pimento cheese fries.   All were very good in their own right. I wouldn't say spectacular, but the atmosphere and very kind staff definitely made up for it.  I WILL say though, their pimento cheese fries I could eat all day, every day and not get tired of it. You don't just get a small glob of cheese that only touches a few fries. This thing COVERS EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THOSE PRECIOUS WAFFLE FRY ANGELS - and that cheese leaves such a great twang at the back of your tongue that you just want more.   Also...we had the wedding cake cocktail and the white chocolate cocktail. YES LAWD. So good!  We'll be back for the drinks & fries for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

iVj6QdmfJXBO31bRRgjCKg.text: Went to pinky's with the family after reading some great reviews and reading what they had in the menu.   My family made it to the restaurant first and already was seated when we arrived. We came in sat down and just a short time later we were greeted and had our drink orders were taken.   We initially ordered the crab puppies and Greg's fried pickles. Those came out and the pickles were just ok but the crab puppies were awesome!!! For our main meal I ordered the mammoth burger with everything. A short time later it arrived and it was truly mammoth! See attached picture.   Beer selection was good. I would have liked to see some more IPA's but what they had was ok.   Overall I gave Pinky's 5 stars for the overall atmosphere, food, and drinks. Parking is ok just have to walk around the front, which was needed after eating all that food.  We will definitely go back next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer menu
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside

S5s0vBjPPSMMqfIyjJE_GQ.text: Only came back for the banana pudding... and my husband wanted to eat here.   Too loud.  Too greasy.  Too dark.

Ep7NJkaLosC7Zqa_TmwDoA.text: This is a Charlotte staple. If you haven't been--GO! The food is super good and unbelievably underpriced for the quality, there are always cheap drink specials on the full bar and the service is fantastic.  Do expect a wait during the busier times, they will not seat you until your full party is there. Trust me, the wait is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

kbSeCE7PeQKBVC_q18PAvQ.text: So pleasantly surprised! Very friendly crew! So surprised how many vegan and gluten free options they had! My new favorite spot!  Update: Call the police, the pimento fries have crack! So damn good!

-FMUjFggC6E4ZLb6SUH9Ag.text: I am a little confused about the continued rave of this place.  While I remember visiting Pinky's quite a while ago and getting a good burger, my recent visits have been pretty boring.  The service is slow, and while people will try to explain that "it's worth the wait!"  I have not found that to be True.    Waiting 20 minutes to sit down at a table at 1pm seemed crazy when I saw open tables inside and out.  My last waitress seemed too busy for us, and just hurried to get our order.  Our burgers looked like they came from Five Guys - they were fine, just nothing to write home about, nor were they worth the wait.  It was a medium sized patty, plenty greasy, and a cheap bun.  The price is OK - total cost was only a few dollars lower than getting a cheeseburger from Firebirds though - and took just as long without the flavor and ability to order it Medium versus Pinky's standard Medium-well ONLY.    I won't go out of my way to go here.

hUMvhlsad1PKvCD7cjT7pQ.text: I ordered a spinach salad with grilled chicken and the garlic and parsley dressing. Overall it was really good. It was so much haha I couldn't even finish the salad. Granted I did have a few crab hush puppies too. Those were delicious as well. And the prices for this menu is really good for the quality and the quantity. Definitely a must-try!

VJOPVKfhtukGJjCHEaWzIw.text: New to the city and I haven't tried a lot of burgers but come on, this burger can't be the best?  It was ok but couldn't cook or order, no seasoning at all, veggies were not fresh to me etc.  Excited to try maybe the corn dog or hotdog next time.  I'll give it another chance

DCbHd-njeGx-Br5N4NDQxg.text: Came here a few weeks ago but forgot to make a review. I took my parents and my husband for an early dinner. We decided to go early as the place fills up pretty quick. We did have to wait approximately 15 minutes before we got a table. The atmosphere is super relaxed but not so much that you are ignored and the service lacks. I was super thrown back by the taste of the ancho wings. Those things were amazing with some blue cheese dressing. My husband had the pinky dog sub vegetarian dog (doesn't eat pork). I had the big John which was super big and enough food to feed two people. I had a side of onion rings and my husband had fries. Everything was great. I have also ordered pick up before and they were quick and everything was hot. I will continue to come here and so should you.

ZwmVDwExFJcUWfn84GnDOA.text: Oh eM Gee what can I say. I fell in love, my 6 year old fell in love! Visiting Pinkys was the best decision of our spontaneous road trip to Charlotte, NC.  Recently, becoming a vegetarian in the past year (May 2017) it has been so annoying trying to eat out without eating the same stuff over and over and over again. There are not many restaurants that go out of there way to get creative and serve awesome and delicious food like Pinkys. They sure know how to make a carnivore and a vegetarian/ vegan happy while eating out together. My vegan chili dog was amazing its been three weeks and I still can taste it! It taste just like any other chili dog! I promise, I know this. The hush puppies are so good and they serve a ton! The beer selection was very good too! Very disappointed I was too stuffed to try dessert. But, when in Charlotte I will make sure to always stop at Pinkys.   Awesome decor and music selection by the way! Hey, would you consider opening a location in Atlanta, GA? ( Very big smile)

4ZJQUAbthD5PzjwuVPsdEA.text: This was my first visit to Pinky's and they didn't disappoint!   I ordered the veggie burger - white trash style. This is one good handmade veggie patty! Just keep in mind it's going to be a messy sandwich, but it's worth it for all that goodness.  I also sampled the waffle fries, sweet potato fries and crab puppies. They were all yummy! Especially the crab puppies! If you're on the fence about what to try...get these! I also really enjoy all the sauces that came with the food. I can't remember them all but I know they were yummy!   I see why it's a local favorite and constantly stays busy!   See ya soon Pinky's!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie Burger - White Trash Style
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Puppies

6DBKCEgqLW31tqJz9sNyjw.text: Fried pickles. White trash burger.  Perfection.  Pinky's has a really cool, fun vibe to it. There's a dinosaur on the front lawn, and friendly, tattooed staff inside.  I brought my mom here on her visit to Charlotte, as I had never tried it before.   Let's talk about fried pickles. I don't like pickles. But if you slice them like chips, and fry them, somehow I've found love.  These were perfectly done and crispy. And they came with a side of ranch.  The small is plenty for 2 people, trust me.  I got the pterodactyl burger with pimento cheese and my mom got the white trash burger.  Everything was fresh, quick and delicious. I'll definitely come back here. Probably sooner than my waistline would like.

B1Oiv742FS3rWYbAUcLlrg.text: This is a good little spot to come to after kickball games, not my usual type of restaurant but definitely fun to come to with a group, I believe they have corn hole too.

EmdsvI3epxbICDhozPNKxQ.text: So I went here awhile back ago for the first time as a recommendation of my good friend Mike...after my first visit I wondered as to why I never had went to this place before. I drive past it all the time when I leave Uptown from work! Well I must say that I am glad that I have been there. The atmosphere is very unique. Its got an awesme raw kinda egde to it I think. The employees were very cool, and very helpful on the menu. I've had many things on there menu, but the best things I've had was the white trash burger! Nothing beats a juicey burger with provalone, fried pickles (YES FRIED PICKLES), crispy onion straws and spicey ranch! It was one of the tastiest burgers I've had. And I switched it up the last time that I was there...I got a white trash hot dog!!! Which was great too. Try it out....you'll love it! -SK

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. White Trash dog!!!!

NNL7HSec81FdO6zCld_YEg.text: Dear God, please help subdue my cravings for Pinky's vegetarian corn dog. They really have gotten in the way of my daily thinking routine and basic problem solving skills.   I've been back here at least 4 times for the said "one and only" and it's on point perfect every single time!  Recently, I have re-tried the Pimpin' Fries (waffle fries smothered in pimento cheese) and I loved them.  My boyfriend and I ordered the White Bean & Rosemary Hummus appetizer last week. This app is a steal for $6.75! The basket they bring it in is chocked full of fresh goodies. An ample scoop of the creamy, yummy hummus; nestled by artichokes, tomatoes, chopped calamata olives, red onion, and plenty of fresh pita.  Boyfriend ordered the Uptown Tuna Melt, which he liked, but said it paled in comparison to the hummus and my veggie corn dog, ha!   Also, I give Da PImp grilled pimento cheese 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The One and Only
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Uptown Tuna Melt
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. White Bean &amp; Rosemary Hummus

c3UxcGbRBqtHFV0zIAgSDA.text: Oh, the joy of fried food!  Pinky's delivers taste in a big way in a cool and funky package.  We decided to try them one Saturday evening.  About parking...don't even try to park in the small lot in front of the restaurant.  Head across the street to the larger lot available for Pinky's customers.   The decor in this place is funky and cool.  Similar to Bad Daddy's, Pinky's plays awesome music and has neat stuff all over the walls.  Even at only 6pm, this place was in full swing.  We (luckily) got a small booth near the bar and proceeded to salivate over the menu, trying to pick the best options.  Since we had heard so many good things about the crab pups, it was no question we had to try them as our appetizer.  For our entrees, my hubby got the mammoth burger - basically a double cheeseburger - with waffle fries on the side.  I got the pinky dog, topped with melty pimento cheese and chili, and homemade chips on the side.  As everyone else has stated, the pups are the BOMB.  Crispy on the outside, with a soft, crabby puppy center.  I'm not usually a fan of tartar sauce, but theirs is worth a try.  While we were initially disappointed they only cook burgers well done, my hubby's burger was pretty darned good.  Juicy, plenty of cheese, and just the right amount of toppings.  Yum!  The waffle fries could have been cooked a tad longer for added crispiness, and they needed a little salt.  My hot dog packed a punch.  It was so tasty!  And I honestly think their dogs are better than Bad Daddy's, even though they are smaller.  The homemade chips were good, but I would have liked them a little crispier, too.  The ranch dip they serve with them is divine though!  Service was really quick, even though they were slammed.  I liked that multiple servers assisted with our table, like they all pitch in to help each other filling drinks, clearing empty plates, etc.    Their prices are really reasonable, too.  We can afford to come back often!  In a nutshell, there's a lot to love about Pinky's, and we will absolutely be back.

9W6cObyuWWH6eI4vvAKDKA.text: If you come here, absolutely get the crab hush puppies, totally worth it. Great music, service is solid and a fun patio, although it's right by the road so traffic is a little noisy. Had a mammoth burger which was the perfect amount of food with the crab puppies shared with someone. Would definitely come here again.

qEeZQ47L8h7o-LG_98Hi0Q.text: Can't believe it took me this long to make it into Pinky's! The crown jewel of biker bar/dive bars on the west side of Charlotte. Packed full of personalities, tattoos, the beer flows like wine, and tons of cardiac inducing treasures to be had.   The small parking lot directly in front of the restaurant can be a bit wonky. Especially if traffic is bad. There is additional parking across the street, so keep that in mind.   I'm a huge proponent of a great greasy burger, baskets o' fries, and an ice cold PBR. Pinky's delivered on multiple fronts and the 5 stars goes to show for a slew of positives.   Vegetarian options. Holy crap, this place has it all. Veggie chili, veggie burgers, dogs....They know how to make it on the map with Charlotte's veggie pride. I was blown away by Ding Dong style. Peanut butter (crunchy), sriracha and honey-cilantro slaw? Might as well be a bulls eye. The textures and flavors make it into a faux Indian/Thai wonderland of flavor. Each bite was better than the last.   Pimp'n Fries. Whoa. You can customize these in so many ways. The ubiquitous pimento cheese reigns supreme on these bad boys. Pimpin my taste buds like it's their job.   White Trash Burger. Duuuuude. Onion rings on a burger? Sign me up. Messy, greasy, piping hot and perfect rep for the dive bar world. I'm going for the double next time.   Tons of goofy stuff on the walls, awesome booths for two, plenty of space and a vast menu of dive-y greatness. What more could a hipster ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie chili fries
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie Burger Ding Dong Style
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

SgOzfPgPgvdG14mSxzFi_Q.text: I like that it's cheap. I like that the food names are kind of cute in a hardcore rock way. I don't generally love the food, but what do you want--it's fun, and it's cheap. A good place to meet up with people and not spend a ton on the tab. Only downside is that now the place is packed--all the time. Westside is still coming around, and right now they've pretty much cornered the market. As the area continues growing, I think the crowds will even out.

jfM4-Px23QqJfGy0MFYiYQ.text: The white trash burger was off the hook. First rate service and atmosphere with plenty of parking around the corner.

IPD8uKT_Yw8mZTSjoLtvWA.text: Such a great atmosphere, food and drink selection!! We went on a Friday evening and there a short wait but it well worth it!! Great price for what you get as well. Looking forward to going back and trying more of their delicious menu options!!

Tn3LeuWvtjt11ToPHKwjmw.text: I can't get enough of this place. There is so much spunk at this location- down to earth, quirky decor, and the best music. Pretty sure they have 100 Pandora stations on shuffle.  Now the most important part: the food. Their burgers are amazing. After all, this is a burger joint. Greasy food. All delicious.  I haven't ordered anything I didn't like.

J0u1lnVxZ5kW3Pqjkv_cWQ.text: What a gem! My boyfriend took me here for the first time the other day and I'm wondering how I've gone all these years and never made it in there! It has the feel of a restaurant/bar you would see in a movie but also makes you feel at home right away too. It has fun decor and the service was prompt even though they were really busy. Parking is limited so it seems a lot of people walk to get there. The white trash burger was delicious and so was my boyfriends jive turkey sandwich. They have a veggie burger option which is next on my list for sure. They also have great weekly drink specials and patio seating although I'm not sure if it was dog friendly or not. Great experience would definitely recommend it and will be back soon myself!

Wp058T4leShZN62hmPJklw.text: This quaint restaurant at the corner of Morehead and Freedom Drive appears to be a dive bar that caters to the "non dive bar" crowd.  Littered with bumper stickers on the ice cooler, kitchen door, and beverage cooler is home to an energy-filled staff dressed in Pinky's t-shirts but showing off their individual style south of the t-shirt.  The restaurant has posters and signs from local events covering every open space of wall real estate and the wooden furniture proves to be an inviting touch.  In here you can yell, laugh, and order filling portions of bar food designed to intrigue you enough so that you read every description on the menu (i.e White Trash burger, Pterodactyl burger, Camp Green House Salad).   Because I love seafood, I went with the Corn Dog Shrimp.  Although I usually don't have any expectations, I was surprised when my meal choice did not work out.  As I waited for my order to come to the table, I observed many plates of food passing me on middle school plastic cafeteria trays (another cool and funky style of Pinky's).  The burgers were huge, smelled sinful, and the hot dogs, corn dogs, soups, and salads I saw made me want to eat everything that passed me.    I munched down on my Shrimp Corn Dogs and realized the combination was a bad mix. The sweet corn dog batter wrapped around shrimp did not work.  I did not know if the honey mustard worked best or the tarter sauce, so I used both.  I ended up removing the bread from the shrimp and eating them separately with the condiments (shrimp and tater sauce, bread and honey mustard).  Needless to say, it left a harsh after taste in my mouth and the potato salad was not my friend.  It has a gritty look to it and an herbal taste.  If you are looking for something with crunch (red onions or celery) and herbs, try the potato salad.    Will I eat here again?  Yes, but I have to try their burgers and leave the cute, unconventional food parings listed on the menu to the more daring crowd.   BTW:  I will sit outside next time.

lyg95jC7ojugDvLtpOfY4w.text: What a fun place. Quirky and cute. Really inexpensive. College kids could fill up here  not fine dining but good dogs and burgers. Salads for the healthy eaters

lPiY3FRwqQnjP_jpVmMu7Q.text: Awesome place for vegans too! I got the falafel wrap and it was delicious. Definitely will come back

QfEufy_2jVYt6FFMUS4wIg.text: Let me begin by saying that I intend to visit again and amend my review thusly.  I dropped into Pinky's for the first time today around 3:45pm with my wife. I ordered the Southern 500 and she ordered The Stray Dog with the slaw on the side and cheddar cheese added. We also got an order of waffle fries and onion rings.  Ok. They were SLAMMED. It was truly unbelievable. Totally understandable to expect slower service, but even still we were waiting for food until 4:36pm. To me, it seemed there was a shift change which perhaps contributed to the delay. The kitchen guys were busting their humps and the hard-working wait staff seemed unable to keep up completely. Not their fault, really, it just seems like they could have used several more hands.  The food: My wife's soy dog was the most revolting "hotdog" either of us have ever tasted. I mean honestly. Barfaroni. Her slaw was forgotten and the cheddar they added was laughable. Not enough to justify asking.  The waffle fries and onion rings are awesome. Waffle fries could come in a larger portion for cost, but the same cannot be said of the onion rings. Plenty of them and deliciously fried.  My dog was awesome. Truly delicious from start to finish. The slaw is reminiscent of tartar sauce, which isn't necessarily a bad thing but definitely not what I expected.  The place has an amazing ambience. Powered by a jukebox, we were treated to lots of Slayer, Jay-Z and The Cure to name a few. Oh, and Kiss pinball. It's pretty loud inside which doesn't bother me, but you will want to speak loud and clear to be sure your unsweet tea doesn't get mixed up with sweet as mine did.  Again, I'll be back. Lots of menu items to check out. With a congenial staff and great atmosphere, it's most definitely worth a return visit.

WAIP74j6axsZ-77UOSBe8A.text: All we had here was the banana pudding. It was delish. But must get it to share. The helping is huge!!! Just pure insanity. It was very tasty though. I would've willing to go back and try real food so my rating is based solely on the pudding.  I will have to add to this review if I go back and try anything off the real menu.

1iWmSbJIJh9DEnUz5_C9Kg.text: Great food!!! Hip atmosphere.. It's definitely laid back. Parking can be a challenge at times.

K9WxhGq7A3j1eF8WwmCeYg.text: When I moved here a couple of months ago, I was told to try The Penguin. I went and had a horrible experience, and the reason is that many of those people who'd made the Penguin what it was are no longer there, but at this awesome place instead.   As we drove up to street and heard our GPS yelling at us, "location is on the left!" we started looking around because we didn't know what to expect. I can honestly tell you, I loved it as soon as I saw it. There is an old VW Beetle parked, on the roof. Naturally, and a concrete Triceratops waiting to greet you as you park.   I gave it cool points as soon as we got parked and I could see all the small little rubber dinosaurs standing on or under Mr.Concrete Dino in the grass. Yeah I'm like a short big kid, so what??? At least I admit it. :P  We walk in to the place and it's broken into two sections. The main section is a bunch of booths and the bar, and the other side is like a tiki room of sorts with a large garage door that opens to the outside. I bet that's awesome on a nice cool day. I ordered the Herb Roasted Turkey sandwich, and I cannot remember the real name of it now dangit!! But OMG was it DELICIOUS!!!  Our waitress was very prompt, and the staff were all running around helping each other out. The food came out in no time flat, and when they brought it over my eyes had to be the size of saucers. That turkey sandwich was GIGANTIC!!! Maybe that's why the dinosaur is outside. It represents the size of the portions?   When I took that first bite I was in L-O-V-E. So, now I can't even say I like Pinky's. I have to say LOVE because anything less would be lying. I also got a Shirley Temple...short big kid, I told ya... and it too was amazing. They put a spin on it, and make it look all pretty. It's got the standard sprite and grenadine but they add in pineapple juice! YUMMO!!!  My only complaint is the parking. We got lucky and were able to grab a spot in the lot, but if we weren't that fortunate I think there is extra parking across the street? I want to go back again very soon. Or right now.. I could probably run out of work unnoticed temporarily to go there.... hmmmm....  ;P

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. My new friend.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. They have a car on their roof, that right there says awesomeness to me :p
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Come on in! :)

FKTMMfKOEo8RmUdmnT9KHA.text: The bacon is unlimited! I had a salad and a burger which were both delicious! Casual vibe and quick service!

4Iv-wcsyvUpUJM1DUm9LeA.text: Really great food - I would highly recommend the crab puppies and the white trash burger, but I'm sure you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab puppies, white trash burger and fries.

Fzqr4tgBWfqdE7rtlcpd8w.text: I travel a lot . This place was recommended to me from The bar tender at Blue Blaze Brewery. She said to get the white trash  burger .. I did .. it was great!i really don't know how they cook it so fast .. but it was fast and hot and good!

geQcOslWYbq7SLYQ2J6I8A.text: Great little burger joint I love the names of the hamburgers. I had the white trash burger very good tasting the atmosphere was pretty cool it was pretty crowded also I would definitely go again

SAFxTR8qycnxXJ8PqybTog.text: The vegan corn dog + hot sauce is pretty good - I couldn't finish the entire dog it was quite large! The falafels are not bad either but would've rather had tried some banana pudding which was highly recommended! I took this to go but the ambience of the restaurant seemed pretty cool - next time I'll go enjoy the environment! Service was kind and quick which I liked.

zHakLY7h1eQguu4LupPX4Q.text: Man what!?  Git you life, if you do not fool with Pinky's,,, I get a mammoth waffle fries and maybe a jam session and call it a wrap.  For real tho I haven't tried anything else.     O yeah service is always great.   Thanks,  C.

qXDlEX1OOD0pqgTF3rpLCg.text: Check it out! Funky crazy delicious! Fish Tacos and Crab Puppies were excellent. Wait staff is friendly. Parking is tight. This is one of those places that has such a personality and it is so worth going!

yNW1TxS3bCJX60uHqASnUA.text: We loved this place! Ordered the corn dog shrimp because it was on DDD! It was amazing!!!!! Also the fried pickles were wonderful! Try the wasabi ranch!!  Friendly staff that checked on us every couple of minutes!   Just couldn't have asked for better service or food!

huPJr3YEwo9gs_KWsVht8w.text: Food choices  are awesome. Kid friendly. Great music!!!!

Uwws_N8y-atRYkf6ukeVXA.text: Awesome eclectic atmosphere, bomb.com burger and good drink specials. We went for lunch and got a table right away. I will def be going back soon!

Cim2gh55G25WmjY849ns2g.text: Place is always packed, which sometimes makes it hard to get a table and it's always loud.  Food is great though.  Last time there got the fried pickles and the big John chicken sandwich.  Both were awesome and huge.  Sauce on the big john is plentiful and tasty.  Next time I'm getting a burger, and the dessserts are not to be passed up.

LjCDh9M9hm5swaNYo8_L5A.text: Food and service are good. It's a little noisy for my taste and the parking situation could be greatly improved. Recommend going during off peak times.

Zn_EzsH4dMTUf_GmwX4YxA.text: After hearing so much about Pinkys from different locals and seeing it on triple d, we were in the mood for some thick juicy burgers and we're headed to another spot but we finally decided to give Pinkys a try.  We were not disappointed at all, there's very limited parking in the front so we had to park in the overflow lot just up the street. It was really loud and crowded but in a good way. The one major thing I liked is how cool the hostess, the waiters and waitresses are. It's funny because one server gave us the menu, another server took our order and a completely different server bought our food, whilst a different server refilled our drinks. The same with the cleanup, To me that just showed teamwork.. Now the food, ordered the Crabmeat hushpuppies since they came highly recommended, those are by far the absolute best hushppies I've eaten. Sweet, crunchy and golden with hints of crabmeat throughout each one. I really only wanted a simple burger with globs of onion (yeah I know), so that's what I opted for, with provolone cheese. Needless to say the burger was darn near perfect. They do have several different burger choices though. My son had the patty melt he says it was extremely good and for him to say that, it had to be good.  Overall I'd give this place a 10 and would recommend coming with your girls or a cute and wild lil date night for something different. This is not the spot if you're trying to be romantic and go home and listen to some Luther Vandross or Marvin Gay....sorry Again, I'd give it a 10 and will be back again!

6Y4Y7lX3iFKNytONZyq6Bg.text: When we travel, we like visiting local dives, so when my husband and I were in Charlotte for the Thunder Road Marathon, we hit Pinky's for some pre-race grub. I asked a bunch of friends where to eat locally, and whoever suggested Pinky's had the right idea. We usually don't go for big chains, etc.   Plus, it was convenient to downtown and had a parking lot- plus very little wait. Score!   I had the Nature Boy, which was a veggie burger. The burger was topped with cheese and roasted red peppers (interesting burger topping), and I got them to add spinach as well instead of iceberg lettuce. It was served on a sesame seed bun and pretty delicious- very large burger and filling, but I didn't leave overly stuffed.   There is an entirely vegetarian and vegan menu, you may need to ask for it, but it's *huge*. Anyone from a vegan to a carnivore can find something to eat at Pinky's and enjoy it.   Hubs had some wings and the "white trash burger" and seemed to enjoy it. Make sure to try the sirarcha ranch sauce- it's great. Also the prices here are incredibly cheap. It's really a steal, both of us ate for just over $20 and that almost never happens. The entrees do not come with sides but you can easily order and split some.   My only gripe was that everything was disposable, not the best for the environment. I'm sort of a hippie, but I really wish I had my burger on a plate rather than in a disposable basket. The cups/bar glasses were the only non-disposable things.   Pinky's decor is pretty amazing too- a fun VW bug outside and one on the roof, plus neat stickers and signs inside. All your senses get fed here, not just your tastebuds. Definitely check it out if you're in Downtown Charlotte.

yQ_AFNA6REtlxOsG0RR3eg.text: My wife's idea to check this place out today after she saw it on an episode of Diner's, Drive-ins, and Dives and she had been there before during work but not in a long time. 8mxxhf2_9wFz2AbaBzPtnw.text: To the server with the red hair and bow tie tattoos: you're the worst server I have ever met in my life and I hope you quit your job and go work something else, because you're not going to cut it in the food industry. The fact that You took my order and my appetizer came out but my BOTTLED COORS LIGHT never came out really bothers me. It took me 38 minutes of sitting there just to finally get up and say something to a manager about how terrible you are. The bartender decided to walk over and tell me how she ran out of paper and never got the ticket. Lies. The manager told me the reason my food still hadn't come out was because you were down a cook. More lies. The final straw was when I informed the manager that you haven't been to my table since you took the order 38 minutes ago and she said "Well we all work as a team here so it's everyone responsibility." Guess what! I'm a server! Guess what else! I work in a tip share restaurant where we ALSO TAKE CARE OF EVERYONES TABLES.  If I ever took someone's order and didn't check on them in 38 minutes, I would have been lit up by every other server on the floor + the manager. Wait wait wait, cook didn't show up and/or you ran out of printer paper? Don't give bs excuses to someone that has heard them all. It wasn't until after I said something to the manager about waiting for 38 minutes for a single beer and a burger that my stuff finally came out. Guess what! No cheese on my girlfriends "cheeseburger", no 3rd party on my "Triple g", And my waffle fries came out as an app and not my entree. Oh, and to top it all off: MY SERVER NEVER CAME BACK TO THE TABLE SINCE SHE TOOK MY ORDER AND I WAS THERE OVER AN HOUR AND A HALF! Terrible service, and terrible excuses by terrible managers for a restaurant that I went to solely based off of Yelp reviews.

o3HC6u9EE5xYq_loELBJyA.text: If I could give a 3.5, I would, but since I'm an optimist, I gave 4 stars. :)  Pros: Great atmosphere, interesting menu of items, and really good as far as price goes.   Cons: Nothing too negative - food was alright.   We had the White Trash Burger, which was alright, but I was expecting something a little more "wow" worthy from the reviews. The pimp'n fries were a treat especially with some ranch, and I do want to come back to try the Ding Dong Chicken Sandwich! It sounds delicious!  I'll give it another shot, but I have plenty more places I want to check out in Charlotte before I make my way back.

RROukVRXjJc2CSyjnlECPQ.text: The burgers and cocktails here are truly great! I highly recommend checking this place out, especially considering the very reasonable pricing. 1lLFKZm5Q3suDANoQpTo7A.text: Visited last evening, crowded as expected for Friday night, but we were seated quickly. Music was good but a little loud for conversation. Our party had onion rings, waffle fries, sweet potato fries and hush puppies, agreed these were all okay but nothing special. Staff was nice. Would visit again

HqgqPz8VGTkeh5ayfvY66w.text: Pinky's Westside Grill opened a little over a year ago just outside of Uptown Charlotte.  This is a fun and casual bar and grill that occupies the former space of a Volkswagen garage on the corner of Freedom and Morehead.  The old "Triple 'G' Automotive" sign remains outside and the owners left an old school VW Beetle on the roof of the building.  The Beetle has been painted over with a design of the American flag.  Pinky's serves bar food (hamburgers, hot dogs, salads, sandwiches, etc.) with a creative flair.  For example, you can order a burger "Ding Dong Style" with crunchy peanut butter, honey-cilantro slaw, and spicy Sriracha sauce.  They've also got "Crab Puppies" (like hush puppies, except made out of crab) and a falafel wrap, so there's some variety.  Prices are very reasonable here with most entrees under $8 each.  I tried one of Pinky's most popular burgers, the White Trash Burger ($4.50).  It comes with a 5 oz. patty topped with provolone cheese, fried pickles, onion rings, and spicy ranch.  While the burger is not ginormous, it is pretty satisfying.  I noticed the server didn't ask me how I'd like my burger cooked, just like my experience at Kickstand earlier this year.  I guess it's a Charlotte thing.  Regardless, the beef is good.  The bun is flat and small.  The waffle fries, onion rings, and sweet potato fries are Pinky's most popular sides.  I tried an order of their onion rings plus an order of their honey-cilantro slaw.  The rings and slaw are served in BBQ take-out-style paper trays.  The onion rings are long and stringy.  The batter is a little inconsistent throughout (both crisp and soggy).  When you get to the end of the tray, it's mostly large crumbs of batter.  The honey-cilantro slaw is very good.  While there isn't as much cilantro as I like (I *love* cilantro), the slaw is fresh and crisp.  The lettuce, onion, etc. are cut shredded into several long strands and the honey-mayo (or whatever sauce they use) is applied in just the right amount so the side isn't too strong.  I'd like to try this with a hot dog next time.  While I haven't had them, my friends really like the crab puppies, falafel wrap, and "Stray Dog" (vegetarian hot dog), so those are other dishes that have a seal of approval.  Inside the restaurant, many tall windows give you a nice view of the Uptown skyline.  The decor is an entertaining mishmash of all sorts of things including a Ms. Pac-Man arcade cabinet.  The servers are cool, the food comes out fast, and service is great.  When the check comes, they have no problems separating the bill between couples and singles.  There is limited parking available in front of the restaurant.  Your best bet is to park in the free lot across Morehead St.

si4ZYCFRIC0GUqmtCGhyBw.text: "If it's funky, I'll find it", says Guy Fieri. Well this place is funky and triple D found it.   Definitely one of the most unique restaurants in the Charlotte area. You'll definitely find originality here whether it be from the eclectic decor, oddly creative menu, or highly attentive staff.   Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, whether you chose a burger, app, or something as odd as corn dog shrimp? Trust me, it works. And the service here is always great. Gotta love an establishment that puts customers first!

PZtCp1Hb8I6hYD8ISabK-g.text: Well, I heard this place was good, but I honestly hated it, so disappointed   The service was great, but felt like they were rushing us to hurry up, you didn't have one waiter, they all were helping all tables, which I thought was a little weird, but anyways. I got a cheeseburger, with fries, got a side of fried pickles. The hamburger wasn't even hot, had no flavor, the bun was falling apart stale, the fries weren't cooked raw. Pickles were good, but greasy ! I'll never go back! I after I left there, I had severe stomach pain, something made me sick?

u5vf5eJELvuWsmkr0nFzaA.text: This place was fun. I ordered a sandwich called the Green Chile Pork and it was interestingly good. Felt like a luau on a bun - despite the classic DDD setting rock n roll themed decor. It was packed and people seemed to also be having a blast. Since it was a DDD location - in typical fashion - I ordered the fried pickles, of which Guy had on the show. Another interesting item was the corn dog battered shrimp. I think anything battered like a corn dog can get a thumbs-up.

iVlw2YCocruAt3XYj-pJpQ.text: I'd heard a lot about this place prior to visiting. I can only speak to what I had, which was a hot dog and sweet potato fries, but neither were that great. My fries weren't cooked well and the small hotdog was saturated with chili and slaw.  Those with burgers said they were good.

fVrQbKhS4pKVzwGC0-8O7Q.text: Very cool funky style atmosphere! Delicious food, full bar and televisions. A great family style place - I saw one kid with a corn dog, no joke - bigger that his head - over a foot long!! _dcL1KJTR4zQ6XvQhnaVgA.text: This food was soooo good. I like the relaxed atmosphere. I work in a restaurant, so I did find the concept of everyone being your waiter, a little unique but great. I thought that it may get a little annoying because that means that you would constantly have someone interrupting, right? Well they did an amazing job of giving us our distance as well as making sure that we had everything that we needed. I truly appreciate the service, the uniqueness of the menu, and the reasonable prices.

gtqqksX02rxZj2NK0Xa3Ug.text: I think I may have had unrealistically high expectations when going to Pinky's Westside Grill due to the seemingly unanimous praise that it gets, but suffice to say it didn't quite meet my expectations.  Upon walking in, we were greeted and seated in a pretty quick turnaround, with minimal wait.  The parking was extremely limited, but there's a lot nearby that expands it to a few more spaces.  I went with the crowd and ordered the White Trash burger with the sweet potato fries.  The burger was flavorful, but was underwhelming in terms of portion and really, flavor.  It was good, but certainly not the knockout I had read about.  The sweet potato fries were served with a wasabi-ranch that was incredibly watery, and really was offputting in terms of consistency.  The entire meal was sort of lukewarm and just....not outstanding.    Overall, I had a good dining experience at Pinky's, but for the price charged and the outstanding reviews, came away expecting more.  Maybe worth a try to see what it's all about, but not somewhere I'd go again.

KR0kdZsPnLMgGzvokXLWCA.text: Honestly I went in not knowing what to expect because of the mixed reviews. But I absolutely loved this restaurant the vibe that you get when you walk in is super welcoming. I love the fact that you have multiple waiters for the simple fact that they all make the experience a great one. I ordered the white trash burger which was super juicy & cooked to perfection. The waffle fries are good also but next time I will skip them just for the simple fact that I was full from the  Burger & ended up leaving them behind. I also ordered a banana pudding to go which is super delicious, is not overly sweet which I personally prefer it not be. If you're just visiting Charlotte or live in the area you definitely should go try them out!

eHPF7CuWjQHyTQRLBU_Llw.text: Location: 3/5 Parking: 3/5 Outside appearance: 2/5 Inside appearance: 1/5 Hospitality: 4/5 Food: 3/5 Price: 3/5  My friend said they saw this place on Diners, Drive In's & Dives so they dragged me along with them to try it out. Parking is very limited in front but there's a parking lot up the block. It was an unpaved gravel lot that was packed with cars. So first thoughts, this place must be good! Small waiting area but plenty of seating inside, outside partially covered, and patio. They maximize space by sitting you fairly close together. We ate at the bar to limit our wait time. I offered the chicken cheesesteak & waffle fries. Fries were hot & crispy! But I wasn't impressed by the chicken cheesesteak. It was OVERLY loaded with onions, peppers, and mushrooms. The bread was saggy so I couldn't pick it up to be a handheld sub. I had to use a fork. And the chicken was large chunks & not shredded. Ordered the crab hush puppies & they were good. My friend had the shrimp corn dogs were ok. There were flies but the door to the outside section was constantly being opened/closed. Maybe I'll try it again & order something different. Oh ... their alcoholic drinks looked good but I didn't partake.

hVRdFSfJGVGFr6Ny8YTYjg.text: Great food, great service and great drinks! I asked several locals to name the one spot if they could only eat one meal in Charlotte... and over and over I heard Pinky's Westside Grill.  Well they were all right on. The food was outstanding, we had corn dog shrimp as an appetizer, white Trash Burger, Ding Dong Chicken, a Viking corn Dog and a Everything Burger.  Everything was cooked to perfection. All the servers help each other out which we found cool, and they all did a great job and were very friendly. Great beer selection and a great mixed drink menu, we had a couple of local beers but they mixed drinks we saw served to other tables looking awesome.  Definitely would recommend you stop at Pinky's Westside Grill!!

EVBItS8OHNxScYKFXvUVNw.text: The best burger in Charlotte I ate so far... You gotta try mammoth and the burger of the month. They are awesome!

p77Msa0GVUygxZZ5dewUxw.text: I get that it's a popular place, and I have not eating anything BAD here at all. Yet I'm still trying to find a menu item that is 'quintessential Pinky's' for me. I had a great local beer, and some 'skrimps' ( fried shrimp) on my last visit. I've had the banana pudding before on another visit, but wasn't able to finish all of it, they do give you a lot. Will continue to read the reviews. What is your favorite item at Pinky's?

lra3Ny1oIxXyxrHxbY0Cmw.text: I really wanted to love this place, but it just didn't live up to the hype.   Service: Stopped in on a Saturday evening and was seated quickly. Our waiter was attentive, but almost gave the impression that we were being rushed so the table could be flipped. All-in-all, I guess I would rather feel a little rushed than be forgotten about, so I don't hold this against them.   The food was a bit disappointing. The pimp'n fries (waffle fries covered in pimento cheese and I added chili) were the star of the meal. One of the better iterations of chili cheese fries I've ever had. After this, the meal went downhill. I got the white trash burger and felt that it was dry and lacked flavor. The waiter emphatically recommended sweet potato fries, which I felt were average at best.   The restaurant decor is eclectic and unique. There's plenty of parking around back, which is nice. It is a little loud, but not unbearable.   Overall, it wasn't necessarily a bad experience, but I doubt I will go back.

U1y3GN5Dyi5HC0Y4OXmkPQ.text: I'm a huge fan of Pinky's and usually eat here every week or so with a bunch of friends. What I witnessed today was a complete sh%t show and disrespectful service towards customers. No hostess at the front (I waited 10 minutes before going to the to go area), the to go pick area had numerous staff members arguing at the stand, and to top it all off I saw a customer get up from their table and request their check after being visibly frustrated (as were other tables) after the check was printed the waitress walked away. The customer could not believe what was going on and took her check from the printer  to the table signed it then exited.   I have no idea what's going on here but I won't be back after the way I saw the staff treat their team and customers.

4n7BzKOY_VyEpJN5eZsjeA.text: I don't know what the deal was with service tonight. The guy who seated us looked sullen and angry. We asked to sit outside where there were plenty of empty tables yet we had to wait for one to be cleaned off. After sitting down, we were never acknowledged. We watched other groups get seated and then orders taken. Two waiters glumly walked around and cleaned tables, never glancing at us. The table next to us had to ask for their bill. When the waiter handed it to them, he didn't even glance at us. After 15+ minutes, we tried to catch someone's attention and were unsuccessful. We left without anyone noticing.

7-tlQekQIF1NojCQaAlOng.text: What can I say, This place is great. A Charlotte staple food off the chart the service is great you need something ask anyone working and they are happy to bring to ya. Put phone down if you want service to came to your table LOL the White Trash Burger will leave you Smiling ear to ear!!!!

o8MBOK4R-nIcY77tKH9Guw.text: I called and inquired about vegan options here and was so excited to come and try.. but when I spoke with Meredith on the phone she was very rude when answering my questions and laughed at me when I asked if you guys served vegan ranch with the fried pickles. She just rudely said no and laughed then hung up the phone.... I don't know why dairy allergies are taken as a joke..

-XSU6XhW-Rjk8UKLv5dyoQ.text: I come here often for lunch and have not had a bad meal. Prices are reasonable and the service staff is great. The place is a landmark and it's worth the wait. Because you will wait!  UPDATE: 12/17/18- stopped in for lunch today. Had the korean burger today. IT WAS AWESOME! A grilled korean sausage patty with cabbage and sauce. Best fusion version of a korean food I ever had! Must try!!
