DGDAvrff71yt3vD5k-s2RA.text: Great things were said about this small quirky moms and pops style diner. I have bypassed this place for years and never thought not even once to step foot in.Yesterday myself and some friends wen't here for a quick bite to eat for lunch. The menu itself was very interesting catchy and funny style names of the burgers and meals,as well everything was super cheap. I was going to be extra and order the nature boy just because im a fan of the great Rick Flair. But instead i ordered the ding dong chicken which i was a little skeptical of ordering when i noticed a crunchy peanut butter spread present on the sandwich, but then i said to myself what the hay YOLO (you only live once) and decided i was going to take a chance if i die i die! To my surprise the burger was tasty and not at all what i was expecting and it was a nice touch with the honey cilantro slaw. My friends ordered the white trash burger, fried squash, and the highly recommended corn dog shrimp with waffle fries. Of coarse i had to taste test their food since this was  my first time and they both been before. Everything was definitely very consistent and up to par in my opinion. If you just want a cheat day and just want something out of control good with everything you can imagine,well Pinky's is the place to be.Oh how can i forget that banana pudding all i going to say is its sinful you don't want to visit and not get any point,blank,period.

BDM-fyGLyazno_8OfQ-f-A.text: It's a diner.  You get diner food.  When my friend suggested it, I was hesitant.  Diners don't tend to be vegetarian friendly.  (Especially in the South?)   This one is.  When I checked the menu, I was delighted to find that it is vast and full of vegetarian choices. No veggie ghetto, here.  Everything was tasty and portions were substantial. Servers were friendly and attentive without hovering.    I look forward to going again.

qPnrJr1UNd1UpuF3b7Uz9Q.text: Well I had the "Mammoth" burger (2 patties) , "West side style " (Onions, chili, mustard and slaw).  I substituted sauerkraut for slaw. I also added pepper jack cheese.  The butger was good but I didn't like the chili so thats the only reason I didn't give them 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Above the food pickup window

3BRTMw30nMzBN9pDKwG7rw.text: This place is the bomb!  I got the white trash burger (provolone cheese, fried pickles, onion rings, ranch dressing) and it was SO good!  My boyfriend got the mammoth burger and loved it too.  Fried pickles and crab puppies appetizers were tasty as were accompanying sauces.  Cool place with lots of different options and a big mixed drink menu too.  Guy Fieri praised it on Diners, Drive-In's and Dives, and now we know why.   We will be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The mammoth burger (with everything)

vfuPtpOgSnZwLXwASv0pPQ.text: Pinkys is an all around great place if you dont care about your health. Pimento cheese waffle fries topped with fresh hot bacon. Say no more fam. Recommend the white trash burger, but if you're looking out for your figure the Turkey burger is also a fantastic choice. Groovy vibe. Check it out.

c1ta14N_12DJJfMVTDnTgw.text: First time there for dinner, did not disappoint. Enjoyed the "beer roulette" Friday night deal - great deal! Burgers were delicious and the crab "hush puppies" were sooooo good! Sat at the bar and enjoyed chatting with the bar tenders, will be back soon!

UnWZx0HCHki0-9zMr5XB9A.text: Started with a OMG Captain Jack Pilsner and a Crab HushPuppies. Beer is good but the puppies are fantastic! A crispy cornmeal batter surrounding creamy crab. A order of 12 deep fried Buffalo Wings( are favorite kind) , the Corndog Shrimp and a White Trash Burger. Order was partially taken by 3 different girls as they work in a "team" Now I'm waiting here for ANYBODY to bring the check now that we've been done for 15 minutes. Wings were not what we thought. Cooked the same way everyone else cooks them. Skin was not crispy at all. The corndog shrimp was pretty good. Nice big shrimp in a corndog crust but the batter wasn't too heavy. Burger was cooked medium well( no other option) I like mine medium rare but it was delicious with a nice grilled over charcoal taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

rzfBj595R4xdqgTtd0tS5g.text: Is "posh dive" a thing? If it is, Pinky's is the poster child for the concept. The first thing that strikes you about Pinky's is the incredibly funky atmosphere. This is the most laid back you can possibly be without grabbing a pillow. The servers share the load, so you get fantastically attentive service since you won't get ignored by someone walking by just because they aren't invested in trying to get a good tip from you. The food is deceptively high quality. This is a book you can't judge by the cover. The menu items sound like typical bar food fare, but when you take your first bite you realize that what they're serving up is undeniably gourmet. Try the Asian Pork BBQ Tacos, and get some sweet potato fries while you're at it. The honey mustard they serve with the fries is stupid good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Asian Pork BBQ Tacos

yfHQSHSzAJO2rjNs0ofi-g.text: This is a fun little place in Charlotte. The atmosphere is fun and a little loud, but pleasant. The food is very well priced.  We sat on the outside patio. I ordered a corn dog and my SO had the Reuben Hot Dog with the chips. My corn dog was dynamite, and he loved his hot dog. The chips were good too. We had a few beers each as we were waiting to check in to our Airbnb.  The staff here is great. They are very efficient and all tend to each other's tables. This is a great place to pregame a night out or have a boozy Friday lunch, or recover after a night out. I would come back in a heartbeat. Great food at a great price. If you haven't been, GO!

gAkbSIJz-F6H3p2M0N_3CQ.text: I do not understand why this place has the hype it has.  Maybe its the irreverent titling of their menu items or maybe its the stickers (which are pretty cool)   IDK-  The food is just MEH and the wait times are not worth it. I thought I was going to have this amazing experience and eat some delicious southern diner food. I could not have been more wrong.  Everything is ala carte and the selections seem cheap.   The "redneck" hot dog was horrible- the burger was worst. The fries were cold. The service was literally deplorable. Inattentive and uninterested. The waiter we had really made the experience worst.

Bt7DzQU-mUDRwffD8gGE1g.text: O M G.  The triple G with everything could possibly be one of the best burgers I have ever had...... and I eat a lot of burgers so that's a huge statement! Lol. I don't know if I will be able to venture out and try something else here, I'm going back and getting that burger EVERY SINGLE TIME.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

gYYHDLH79GnGFWRlNo6MYQ.text: Yep worth a visit. Really fun place. Molly our waitress is a 10 Star. She should get a raise.   Had the White Trash burger. Excellent.   Corn dog very good.   Good beer selection.   Fun place. A must visit.  Located just outside of downtown- extra parking down the street. This is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fries.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. White trash burger.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love this logo.

jjLl3HBwVQgYkA1Zf5ziHw.text: Very laid back atmosphere.  Nice and quick bar staff. I came on a Saturday night it was quite packed and sat at the bar after a sit became available. Prices are very reasonable.  Best onion straws ever. I had the Turkey burger at first it was seasoned well but dry so I swiped out for a regular cheeseburger. The staff had no issues changing it out either.  I was glad I did switch. The regular cheeseburger was very juicy and seasoned well. A great burger. I had a drink too that was very delicious and  not skimpy on alcohol and was only 6.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Onion straws
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey burger

X1Z0LQM68Fiv9u8henCmUg.text: Pinky's is a bit of a local legend. Having been featured on DDD, it is now a "must visit" spot in Charlotte.    Ambience: It's a restaurant with a dive feel. Tons of quirky memorabilia lining the walls. The music goes from 90s R&B to punk real quick. The servers are casual and eclectic.   Food: I've been here 3 times now, the food is a solid 3, when cooked right. They're known for the pimento cheese fries, burgers and dogs.  I settled on the chicken philly, sub shrimp. Along with the infamous cheese fries.  It took 3 attempts to get hot food. The mgr got so mad he comp'd the bill, and apologized.   Service: This is the kinda place where everyone is your server. They'll stop by and check on you, you can grab anyone for help. Service is average, nothing to rave or complain about.  All in all, can't say I'll be back. I'm over the hype and the half cooked, cold food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp philly with pimento cheese fries

JRMNllUu4b7A6AFoNCKA4g.text: You can't really go wrong with pinky's. I adore their veggie burger, it's so filling and flavorful. I was on a bit of a meatless/dairy free kick, so I ordered mine white trash style without the ranch and it was everything I needed. I always get the sweet potato fries. It seems that they have some type of holy oil that they use in the kitchen to fry everything extra crispy. If you ever need an easy environment with great simple food, this is the place to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hipster chic

ezi4Gpkby3Oh9I7yqokPYA.text: This restaurant is located in one of the areas I have hardly visited in Charlotte. It was really creepy driving there but got normal after looking at the bright neon lights and the crazy VW ladybird parked on top of the neon sign.  Don't be let down by the limited parking infront of the store. Those are just for the pickup customers. There is a huge parking behind the restaurant and you would find no problem finding a parking spot. And hey it's free parking!  The restaurant has a lot of hand made arts hanging all around. You can keep your eyes busy by looking at the various paintings, art work and light bulbs hanging around. The menu is quite something. It has lots of options. Beware that this is a single dollar budget restaurant- so make sure you order yourself sides and other dishes apart from your burger.  We got the popcorn chicken which was a wonderful start. They came in paper plates. For the main course ordered the soup of the day - crab bisque. And of course it came in a paper bowl. Got the white trash double patty burger. It was delicious! My friends got the ding dong chicken and the phily chicken. Both were not hugely satisfied in how their food looked or was presented.  I see it as a kind of restaurant you don't want to come in and dine at. It's a place for quick weekday lunch or dinner. The paper plates especially the paper soup bowl threw me off. Certainly the restaurant could do better in terms of utensils especially considering the huge crowd it gets.   I would recommend fellow yelpers to visit this restaurant! The restaurant has a cool vibe to it, the food tastes great and the food is cheap! You won't be disappointed if you choose to turn a blind eye at the paper utensils!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Phily
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s an attractive board but it badly needs repainting..
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. White Trash Burger

_q1TiR1MTcDNqAv35J4gVQ.text: Pinky's is a Charlotte staple to me. Not too flashy, but big on flavor.  Let's be honest, flavor should win every time; you are talking about food. When it comes to taste, Pinky's has never let me down. I love their bologna sandwich. The only thing is that I recommended you add cheese. Melted cheese on your bologna sandwich is nostalgia. We have also eaten their cheese fries, buffalo shrimp tacos, chicken bites, and white trash burger.  Everything is on point. Decadent, messy and delicious.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  The come as you are quality of the staff, makes me feel comfortable pigging out. My wife says their veggie burger is the best one she has had.  If you find yourself looking for a casual dinner or lunch option, please do yourself a favor and visit Pinky's.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

GWKqLUIP5g6SdN1xO5A2Ww.text: Holy moly this place is bad a**, am I allowed to say that because it's True. This is a gem of a restaurant, the food was delicious, and when I say delicious... I am mean it's off the hook!  The service was great, everybody is was warm and friendly, the atmosphere was awesome; but truly can we go back to the food. I had pimento cheese fries and the almost fried turkey sandwich and neither disappointed. I am drooling even now thinking about it, it's really a unique place in the Charlotte food scene.

4gU2rUnFa5RMB4UGwCFNbA.text: Needless to say I was just disappointed in the food and experience.   I love the show Diners, Drive ins and Dives so when I knew we would be in the area I picked this restaurant out specifically because of the show and all the reviews about how great the place was. My husband and I went on a Friday at lunch time. We knew it would be busy so we weren't shocked by our wait. While we waited we were able to watch the episode of DDD where the restaurant aired.   When our names were finally called, we were seated at a very small dinky table in the middle of other small dinky tables. Our table itself was a two seater and the other two tables that were seated next to us (one on either side) were so close that we were unable to easily get to one of our seats. When I passed by the tables beside us to get to my seat my butt literally touched the chairs where people were seated. It almost seems the restaurant has grown too busy and they have tried to fix the problem by adding tables when they have no space for them. Also, the music is so loud in the restaurant that I couldn't hear my husband across the table and as previously mentioned my table is super small. This may be the experience that others are talking about but it wasn't an experience I enjoyed.  The food itself was nothing special. My husband ordered the mammoth and I ordered the corndog shrimp. The burger was greasy and I would have actually preferred a Five Guys burger. The shrimp themselves were okay. The corndog batter was sweet and the shrimp were fried nicely; however when I bit into my shrimp I could tell they weren't cleaned before fried (devained).   Unfortunately, I do not believe we will be back to this restaurant. It might have been a bad day for them, but it makes me upset as it seems so many people love this place. It might just not be for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn dog shrimp

a9H8LavPizHMOZa50JdW3Q.text: I'm not sure how I have not reviewed Pinky's yet! This restaurant is like your quirky dive bar with yummy greasy food and great drink specials. Only downfall is that the service is a tad slow, but it's easy to get over when you're not in a rush.   As you walk up, you will see an antique car stationed on the roof, and the outdoor seating section. I am not typically one to choose outdoor seating, but at this restaurant - I don't mind.   The wait is usually long on the weekend so mentally prepare yourself. Longest I've ever waited was 50 min but that was on a Friday night when they were slammed - but it is worth the wait. Once seated, any server can help you even though you will have 1-2 main servers.   Now to the good stuff- everything at pinky's is good if you like hot, greasy food. The crab puppies, popcorn chicken tossed in buffalo sauce and the white trash burger are among my favorites.   Drinks- I get the $15 pitcher almost every time. It actually creates about 5-6 glasses so you can never go wrong. Impossible to find more bang for your buck.    Pinky's also sells apparel for those who are into that. That's never been my things but the designs are pretty cool!  Tip for parking: don't even bother turning into the restaurant just keep on going down Morehead and park in the lot behind the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger of the month and waffle fries

acq-2wzmDTp1ib9G_iGkEQ.text: Overall a pretty good experience again this time. I will say, if you come during lunch with a big group, you probably will have to split up if you want to get seated in a reasonable amount of time.   I wasn't quite as impressed with my food this time as what I've gotten in the past. I got the Reuben Dog which was good but very heavy on the sauerkraut and didn't have enough thousand island dressing. I also got the white trash burger which was incredibly dry. It was supposed to come with a ranch sauce but there was almost none on it. I had to add ketchup it was so dry.   I got my husband the Asian Burger to go and he loved it. I considered getting it myself, so I'm definitely disappointed that I went with something else.   Still a great local diner that's worth checking out, I just think the food was a little off for my order today.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. White trash burger
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Reuben dog

U0iQrBrR3lgmZsNczPrt4g.text: Did not go in but we were at the bark and brew down the street. They would not do uber eats :( but we went to pick it up anyway. Great fried pickles. Will have to stop again to try the rest

4_XjfBj2YGVO7I-OzSLSdQ.text: Cheap and delicious foods!  This is actually my 2nd time at Pinky's, however, finally at normal hours (The first time was at 11 pm). I came to Pinky's this past Sunday with 5 others around 7 pm and we waited for about 35 mins. After we were called, we were seated outside which was amazing because the weather was beautiful.   Their vegetarian menu items are super super limited which kinda sucks, but they are happy to substitute any items in/out. The first time I came to Pinky's, I ordered their veggie hot dog which I did not like (not a fan of veggie dogs). So, I learned from my mistake, and ordered the Chicken Tacos WITHOUT the chicken. The tacos came with black beans, lettuce, pico de gallo, and sauce. There could have been more toppings like onions, cheese, sour cream, etc. I asked for spicy ranch on the side as well as waffle fries. The spicy ranch is soooo tasty. Definitely recommend for 'bar-like' food!  @Pinky's - Please add at least one vegetarian item to all of your food categories, it would be VERY appreciated.

T3d1gmZr1zzoKLHexPwncw.text: Pinky's was on my "Foodie Tour" list and I finally made it while in CLT for the Christmas holidays. I went around 5pm and it wasn't too packed. Since the 3rd person in my party hadn't arrived, my other guest and I were told that we could not have a seat at a table and start to order, that they only seat people when the entire party is there.  My guest and I sat at the bar and ordered drinks until my other guest arrived. The bartender was friendly and got us drinks promptly. We were finally seated at a table and then ordered appetizers and more drinks. Our waiters were very nice and upbeat. They were even helpful when we asked for their suggestions on menu items.  We ordered the Crabby hush puppies, Pimpin Fries with bacon, and fried pickles for appetizers. My favorite were the Pimpin Fries which had homemade pimento cheese on top and a load of delicious bacon. My next favorite were the fried pickles with Ranch, and my least favorite were the Crabby Hush puppies. After we finished the appetizers, we ordered entrees.  One of my guest ordered the Corndog Shrimp, which came with coleslaw, and waffle fries. She loved it! I tasted the shrimp and coleslaw and agreed that it was delicious. For my entree, I ordered 3 buffalo shrimp tacos which came with a side of very flavorful black beans. This was delicious as well and I didn't share.  The women's bathroom was very clean and smelled very fresh compared to other restaurant bathrooms I've been in. As the night progressed, Pinky's got really crowded.   Overall, Pinky's was a great choice and was featured on Dinners, Drive-Ins, and Dives on The Food Network. I can say, it lived up to the mark, and Guy Fieri's picture and signature on the wall, sealed the deal.  I'd visit again and make sure to have the Pimpin Fries add bacon, Tacate beer, and Shrimp Tacos. The burgers looked amazing coming out of the kitchen, so I'll definitely grab a loaded burger next time too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside of Pinky&#39;s
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizers- Pimpin Fries with bacon, crab hush puppies, and fried pickles

qdWN3uE689yWNOKKvl4eyQ.text: Pinky's was such a fun experience! We decided to check it out since Guy Fieri came here to do Diners Drove in and Dives. Their menu has enough fun, unique items and of course the staple items. I had the corn dog shrimp and they were so tasty! It was a little difficult to taste the shrimp with all the breading but that's not to say I wouldn't order it again. My Moscow mule was fine but nothing to rave about. Additionally, this restaurant is very open to all kinds of different individuals. I felt welcomed and unjudged.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Storefront

fRjLcijuYQC1r6neupBkMA.text: Lunch on the way to great wolf lodge. Probably will need to purge before getting into my bathing suit #notbeachbod. However, totally worth it. Atmosphere was nice. Service was friendly and quick. I had the white trash burger with waffle fries. My wife had the korean pork tacos. My kids had viking dogs and we shared some fried pickles. I'm not a big fan of provolone but the burger was delicious. The meat had a great flavor.  Shout out to those black beans that can with the tacos. Yum!  We had a hard time with dessert. We took a banana puddin to go but the cake du jours looked fantastic.   Protip#1 There's not a lot of parking in front of Pinkys. There is parking behind though.  Protip#2 When choosing a burger dont be afraid of the double

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffle fries
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black beans

pOGrgI5z0W6lB6qcGvSo-A.text: The burgers  here are awesome! The service, not so much. Got here at 9pm (they closed at 10pm) and they rushed me at every turn. It's never fun to be rushed through a meal. They were so focused on cleaning up and getting out that it made me wish I had ordered to go.   They also brought out cold waffle fries. I told the waitress and she brought me fresh ones right away, so kudos to her for that.   If you're looking for a tasty burger on the west side this is your spot. Don't go looking for great service though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside shot of the restaurant
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pinky&#39;s sign.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Artwork on the walls was cool.

DwSIxFTquFAPoTRW_RNlvQ.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte. Don't be scared away by the exterior or the neighborhood. The food and drinks are awesome. The burgers are amazing and so are most of the fried items. Get one of the uniquely named mixed drinks as you wait. Definitely worth checking out. Not the best place for healthy eaters and/or vegans/vegetarians.

Rq0u3gfnaYOs-fgpi64Kaw.text: Fried, greasy, comfort food at it's best.  Vegetarian friendly!  The service is great, because the servers will all help any table.  The atmosphere is fun - divey.  Even when there is a wait, I've never waited more than 10-15 minutes.   The VEGETARIAN CHILI is a bit sweet for my taste, so I'm not a huge fan of eating a bowl of it, but it's great on a hot dog, burger or fries.    Speaking of hot dogs and burgers, they have vegetarian versions of both, so you don't have to miss out on any of the fun burger combos or corn dogs.  Vegetarian corn dogs!  The breading on the CORN DOG is sweet and corn bread-ish, but lighter and fried.     I had the VEGGIE DOG with CHILI and PIMENTO CHEESE.  Everything about it worked for me.  The dog itself probably isn't that great, but smothered in chili and cheese, it's delicious.    The FRIED PICKLES have a basic flour breading (which I prefer over cornmeal, but not as good as tempura batter).  They were crispy and served with a thick creamy ranch dipping sauce.    My sister enjoyed the SWEET POTATO FRIES.  I'm never a fan, so I'm not a good judge, but I found them to be sweet and limp, not at all what I want from a fry.    The DING DONG STYLE BURGER is weird but everyone at my table enjoyed it (to varying degrees).  The peanut butter flavor was a bit too strong, so we countered with loads of sriracha.  But the honey slaw on top was a nice touch.    NOT QUITE FRIED TURKEY SANDWICH is not at all fried, for those who are wondering.  It's a baked turkey that has been sliced and layered on a bun with bacon, fresh basil, tomato, mayo and cheese.  Husband found it to be an acceptable healthier alternative to what the rest of us ordered (minus the cheese and mayo).    The baked PIMENTO CHEESE WAFFLE FRIES with BACON = the piece de resistance for us.  They are careful to layer the pimento cheese inside the fries so it's not just on top.  The bacon is perfectly crispy, and while this might have been the most decadent dish, it's definitely the most delicious.  Add sriracha for more amazing-ness.    I did not get the bill, so I have no idea how much the BANANA PUDDING cost, but it was too much for 4 of us to split (so whatever the cost, probably worth it).  It's messy looking, slopped into a bowl with a couple of spoons stuck into the top, and it's nothing gourmet or interesting.  But it nicely satisfied all of our sweet cravings at the end of a gluttonous meal.    Only come here if you don't care about fat or calories.  It's a cheat meal, for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn dog... Excellent (almost sweet) corn bread-ish batter
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese waffle fries with bacon

cPrcZJbFccHc0_zV1C9pKA.text: I am so beyond glad that I finally made it to Pinky's to eat. I will be going back for sure. It's definitely bar type food, things like burgers and wings and fries. No complaints from me though.  I was surprised by the number of vegetarian options they had on the menu, not only do they have a veggie burger but also veggie hotdogs and corndogs! I had the corndog and was super happy with it. My husband had the veggie dog with vegetarian chili and was over the moon. We started off with the fried pickles for the table as well and they are chips which I always enjoy. All in all I can't wait for my next visit, I feel that they will be satisfying a lot of my cravings here!

_rb-QHsyixdk7sCTXlLCfw.text: I live really close by and initially became a patron due to the proximity but since then I've become a regular because of the great food, super staff and the cool decor.  The restaurant is in an oddball location with some goofy parking options but when you get inside you're seated fairly fast and the food comes in fast as well since they don't use fancy plates or cups.   Always some drink specials, cheap beer options available. And the food comes in ballpark style paper containers. The pimento cheese fries, the nature boy white trash style and the shrimp tacos as my favorite!   Go check it out you won't be disappointed!

AOJ9AaGMftk-faGyc2CUgw.text: Amazing.  My husband took me there for lunch during the week.  Fast service and the staff was friendly.  The food was amazing and also had vegetarian option.

VLr5SvynqHoBh4mnHkN3qw.text: The first time we came to Pinkies was almost an accident. We had planed to be at Food Truck Friday but were rained out.   So, group of 16 people, Friday night, and no reservations anywhere. Crap!  Somehow we ended up at Pinkies. If you've ever passed this place then you know it's impossible to miss. The giant VW Beetle painted with Stars and Stripes on the roof is hard to ignore.   We shuffled in and luckily we are all friends because the waiting area it kitchy and fun, but also small! Thankfully none of us had B.O. and impressively we were all seated in less that 15 minutes!  Now the menu! Pinkies is like no place I've been before. There are some "normal" choices but most of the menu is a hodge podge of odd combinations most with interesting names.   Things like Wasabi Ranch Dressing are available and leave you in a strange place of excitement to try something unusual and fear of having no idea what anything will taste like because its all so different!  I can't remember what I got but I ordered the strangest thing I could find on the menu and it was amazing!   I've been back three times and ordered different items and found them all somewhere on the scale of decent-to-great. Nothing has bombed yet!  The food is interesting and they do a great job of combining odd things and making them work. The prices are fantastic, especially for the adventurous menu, which is further encouragement to try new things!  Service is hit or miss like many places. It really depends on the night and the server but if you come with a group of friends and share a beer or two, you'll probably not even notice.   Overall, Pinkies is a great place for "Foodies" and budget minded people alike.

JN7D4UYT1BB-rilXn1Cy2Q.text: On December 14th I visited this restaurant with my best friend before traveling for my birthday. She had her great things about the atmosphere so we decided to check it out. From the time of walking in the door we were encouraged not to sit outside because it would be too much for the the staff to have to come out there(the weather was in the high 60s low 70s). Our serving staff consisted of a gentleman and a young lady by the name of Sara. Sara was awesome she checked on my friend and I several times to ensure our satisfaction, but the gentleman appeared to be annoyed. We asked questions about items on the menu and is response was "I dont know," and "It depends on what you like." He was very dry. He did not ask how the food was and never refilled our drinks. With that being said a group of gentlemen walked in and the same server went over specials with them, and gave them his preferences. He even brought them a picture to refill their drinks before they finished their food. Over all our experience would have been a total bust if not for Sara. Have a blessed day!

y9mEPZBOJ99VhIpi9LF3fw.text: What a great spot for good burgers and dog. We enjoyed both & they were served quickly and cheap prices. We also ordered a side of sweet potato fries, hot & cooked to perfection. I am a ketchup girl, but they served them with a creamy mustard dipping sauce that was a great second option.

vLjf0uXDUWpOPgtNsw6OPA.text: Three words: Ding Dong Burger. One of the best things about Pinky's is the opportunity to order a 5 oz burger a la carte for under $5. The Ding Dong Burger is by far the best of the lot: slathered with peanut butter, honey cilantro slaw, and Sriracha, it is a wonderful expression of Asian-inspired flavor. You may ask yourself, "That title, though... am I eating a racist burger?" The answer, as it turns out, is no: thai-language.com/forums... Anyway, Pinky's is a gem of a place. Divey, cheap, fun, and delicious. The beer and drink specials will treat your wallet with kid gloves while the food, most of it heavily fried, will make your waistline expand. But, the flavors are worth it, goddammit. They have these awesome crab hush puppies of which you can't just eat one. They serve delicious local dishes, like fried squash and fried pickles. They have some awesome all-beef hot dogs. They feature a variety of local beers for next to no money. AND! They're open till 11 pm on a Sunday! Perfect for late eaters like me.

fSJIqBigIFbFrepVW5EQUQ.text: Had the Big John with chipotle mayo and substituted the swiss cheese with pimiento.  AMAZING trust me this is the best way to have Big John!!!!  Best chicken sandwich ever!!!!!

FtzIDO_4o3a0d3k8DOG5VQ.text: Clutch spot. Staff was so helpful & nice. Chicken tacos, fried pickles & burgers were awesome!!!!

AEHRqFjdsfUYTgXdu7UN6w.text: Went back this time know the policy of having all guest there before getting a table. Which the host didn't tell us about until we were there for 20 min, but I digress. I went back to try the food at this location. The service was okay a little bit of an attitude from the employees but nothing horrible. The food wasn't as good as the huntersville location. The food was subpar at this location.

6Z6F21zcR9aDhbTxsPz_XQ.text: Patty melt burger was great, beer was cold and the service was excellent.  Avoid the onion rings, they're a pathetic basket full of salad toppings, waffle fries are super good.

e82CXhhQtgoISiHTWMGcyA.text: We were really excited to try this place out after reading great reviews.  However after trying it out, we will probably not be returning.  I had the ding dong chicken ( dont care for the name) it was pretty bad. I was expecting some awesome tasty chicken sandwich but it just tasted like a peanut butter sandwich with chicken in it. blah. I can make this at home.   My husband had the white trash burger and he also thought his was whatever. Considering that there are so many burger joints around Charlotte, we will probably not be returning.

4xeIzxxb5_rUMCr7-OX-cw.text: Got the Jiving Turkey Burger Westside style and it was delicious! So many drinks to choose from it was difficult to decide and they all had a different twist. I'll be back next week, lol

Zk5QAmROcV7_vZNcIO9pFg.text: Pinky's rocks. Definitely recommend the Nature Boy (veganized = no cheese, no mayo, on pita). But i also recommend the veggie chili (vegan) and red potato salad (also vegan). The falafel ain't too shabby either.   Might as well come on a Tuesday night because all of their drafts are $2.50 and I believe they were all local Charlotte drafts to boot. Had a Lennyboy Burn Down Brown and Birdsong Higher Ground for $2.50 each. A steal. On Friday night, they do craft beer roulette. For $3, they bring you whatever craft bottle they want which is kind of fun.   With Wesley Heights being my future hood, Pinky's will likely be seeing me much more frequently.

FPYRnMQjaEgD4K7ly7fVtA.text: Great location and atmosphere and an above average beer selection. Salad seemed to be made fresh, wings were okay, but if you are looking for a wildly addictive appetizer...try the corndog shrimp, if it sounds good to you (and maybe even if not) just do it, seriously!

vvj4TXP81eoFCYGH-KPRxQ.text: Best rated burger joint with price and quality hands-down. It may not look like a whole lot from the outside, but you should be able to tell my the locals mixed with visitors it's a hot-spot.  - Friendly servers and atmosphere - Quality food - Can be a bit messy, careful! - Reasonably priced - Parking can be tricky - Check the photos!  You can easily get lunch for two under $20 with drinks and starter.  I finished up a Spartan Race and headed over to Pinky's to recoup. I needed a massive amount of protein and some potassium for my aching body.  I ordered up some some fried pickles because they usually hit the spot when your starving and don't take long to get to your table. Greg's pickles ($3.95 small) were tasty but not my favorite part of the meal, just too greasy.  I love the whole concept of ordering burgers here, basically you pick 1-3 5oz patties and choose from three styles and can add any additions. EVERYTHING includes mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion & dill pickles. I ordered the WESTSIDE which comes with mustard, chili, slaw & onion. You can also pick DING DONG STYLE with crunchy peanut butter, honey-cilantro slaw and hot sriracha sauce. Whatever floats your boat!  The Mammoth westside style ($5.75) was such a beast. It wasn't very wide but was quite the skyscraper. Can you say jaw fatigue? It really hit the spot.   My wife picked up the Green Chile Pork ($6.25) and we both loved it. You can't go wrong with marinated pork grilled with pineapple slices, melted swiss cheese, arugula and jamaican mayonnaise on a seeded bun. The sauce had so much flavor and pineapple added such a boost.  I loved this place, although I could have went without the pickles. This will be a place I stop at often when in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork sandwich, with pineapple.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mammoth west side style $5.75
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greg&#39;s pickles small $3.95

zSquRqsv08Z3c3Z5YDDE-w.text: Pinky's is a favorite! I was introduced to Pinky's when I asked around for different restaurants in the Charlotte area. I went once or twice and enjoyed it. My fiance loves this place so when we began dating it became a regular for us. A good selection of burgers with different taste from simple to pimento cheese and fried pickles to peanut butter (it's good trust me!). Get the fried pickles if that's your thing...really good. Word of advice though they will not seat you until your whole party is there. That's never really an issue as I think the longest I've waited on a Friday Saturday or Sunday night was 15-20 minutes but if you have a large party it's just something to consider. Really love this place and consider it a must visit for friends and family when they come to Charlotte!

GVtX4X4UoLAjVKsh7tNyaQ.text: My boyfriend had a work celebration at Pinky's this afternoon and offered to bring me home dinner because I've been wanting to try it since Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives a few weeks ago. (He's sweet like that.) I looked through the menu online and had a tough time narrowing it down because so many things looked good or fairly interesting and unique. I ended up requesting the Kinda Fried Turkey Sandwich because I remember it being featured on the DD&D episode. Something about the turkey breast being enclosed in some wrapping and then deep-fried in oil... like poached, but in grease at a high heat. Needless to say, I was intrigued.  I must say this sandwich did not disappoint! And I ate it after it had been brought home to sit in our fridge for several hours, keep in mind. It held up beautifully! Sturdy, tasty bun. The turkey really was wonderfully moist and flavorful. Slathered with some kind of garlic sauce with hearty basil leaves topped on. And provolone with a nice bite, toasted to perfection. I am so impressed with this sandwich that I seriously cannot wait to visit Pinky's in person and try something fresh outta the kitchen!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kinda Fried Turkey Sandwich

tTCnvhZlOaXppfJnpOsjFQ.text: Great burger! I had the mammoth white trash burger... Massive size and massive flavor! I want to lick the paper it came on but there weren't any juices to slobber up...

X8M6DGF4Hbolz87OUC5PqQ.text: Best turkey burger in town!! Full bar, great beer selection, and very casual.  Consistently good service and food.  Don't leave without getting a homemade dessert! There is usually a wait, but the tables turn fairly quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Z

on8BEFUJ37fLjzGKlWgyKA.text: Cool vibe. Waffle fries with housemade pimento cheese and a ton of bacon are amazing. Good local beer.

nZXUnoJeagPZamFX5A_iHQ.text: It was a nice place in the middle of almost no where. Freedom dr doesn't have many places to sit and eat. The music was loud and the place itself was different. Not in a bad way at all. The food was good too. Very different and yummy. The serves could of been better. But I did go on a Saturday night when it was super busy. Their parking sucks. Very limited. You have to park across the street or behind the place itself. I would go again. Probably if I was in the area. I wouldn't make it a point to just drive there tho.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

t--Xb51mlPX-ma2j3Xe2Sg.text: Could be 5 and will be back again. Fantastic funky decor, friendly staff and constant soda refills were great. Burger and roll were just slightly uninspired. Tried "white trash", good but slightly overlooked, wanted more spice. Service 10 Atmosphere 10 Burger 8 Salad 9

tAQP41i512RuIksmwFuCXA.text: Great hot dogs and drinks. Scene more for the biker crowd. Lunch crowd is rather large for get there early.

z2Caktt_kaTUOTiIMCTuKQ.text: Great lunch locations with a hip vibe! The burgers and Tater tots are my favorite, more specifically the White Trash Burger. Service is ok - definitely not the best since your waiter seems to switch so you never know who is responsible for your table. The location is a little tight but still comfortable for a small groups of no more than 5. Parking is limited in front of the restaurant. You must park in the lot right before the restaurant.

bCZRCDkap1oN14Opt1orLw.text: Always good. Service is always spectacular. Keep in mind the servers share tables so you probably won't see the same one twice, but they have a system for it and it works. Get the pimento cheese fries with bacon added. Drink specials are always on point. Oh and the blue cheese here is like crack, I can't tell you why.

FmTFM9POnI4imqO2v_Z3vw.text: Fried Pickles, white trash burger and Bananna pudding the size of your head . The Kiss Pinball Machine pushes it over the top

lD9icghAEohW7ANkRyJiWw.text: Awesome! Sat at the bar Jeska was fabulous.  Service was fast, drinks were wet and tasty.  Order pimp-n-fries very good. Slight kick which was great most places are scared to add it. Todays special Salmon tacos YUM couldn't finish them they were a huge portion. Side of black beans wow great taste nobody does it better.  Custom margaritas...watermelon and then Malibu red so good!  WILL come back

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh onion rings great. Salmon tacos and black beans awesome!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimpnfries very good

hnxHLTV3VScyttKeZQyJ4w.text: Really enjoyed everything I ate,  burger,  wings,  and chips.   All fresh and good quality.   Service was great.    Have some really unique menu items.   High class bar food would be how I'd describe it.  I'd go back!

fjYbtE2UNE1LUBFtAV6cGQ.text: Amazing all way around. The white trash burger was unbelievable.  The bartenders are very friendly and its a wonderful atmosphere.

WazZC2Y_LPX5_cDkG5SAlQ.text: They push themselves as a place with vegan options, yet anything marked with a "V" on the menu is vegetarian and not vegan-friendly. Please make a clear indication as to which dishes are vegan-friendly or create more vegan options. My visit was extremely stressful because of this and I've been apprehensive about returning.

65gVZ6dVjxMdFmbJtpDYpg.text: The staff are so laid back in personality, but in service they're 100%. I love this place. I'm not hip to the music but this place has a great atmosphere.

PvSzKX91olGM9j1Kq_rDOg.text: I've been to Pinky's before and always had solid food with good service, but never gotten around to writing a review... I checked out a tip from a fellow Yelper the other day and decided to swing by for lunch pick up since options are pretty scarce around my office...   I was able to place a to-go order over the phone fairly easily without a long hold time at all... Upon arriving, I had to park across the street which I kind of expected... If you haven't been, the parking lot is probably about 10 spaces, if that... Across the street, there are marked spaces in the Dunkin Donuts parking lot... Make sure to use those... I don't know if they tow, but who wants to find out?  I arrived about 10 minutes after placing my order and my food was all ready to go... Definite plus... When you're working with limited time, not having to stand around waiting for food you called in is absolutely awesome... As usual, the servers were quick and very friendly...   I ordered the Ding Dong Chicken Sandwich as tacos and it was amazing... I don't typically like crunchy peanut butter, but I barely even noticed those peanuts...  Between the honey-cilantro slaw and the yum yum sriracha, it had a great Thai-like flavor... I decided to be healthy and ordered the fried squash as well... The breading was light and crispy... A great crunch without completely taking over the flavor or overpowering the veggie...   One of the most important parts for a to-go order is food temperature and Pinky's really held up in that aspect... By the time I got back to my office, the food was still piping hot and delish...  I finally have another lunch place! Yes!

JCVXtD_mJ0TgGzSyIQZ3ag.text: Was visiting Charlotte and was told this place was a must go to. Food was amazing and service was top notch. We ordered the popcorn chicken buffalo style, white trash burger and the bacon cheese fries. Very tasty food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

51jMsoYWch7UHfQhngxmfw.text: Came here with the fiance for the first time in many years.  Our waitress came by and took our shortly after we were seated.  While taking our order, I began to request that we get fried pickles instead of onion rings as one of our side.  Before I could finish explaining I wanted a substitution the waitress just walked off.  Shortly after, my fiance finished her drink.  We waited for our waitress, but did not see her at all inside the restaurant for close to ten minutes, another waitress (of the table next to us) noticed her empty cup and filled it up.  Later, another waitress dropped off our food, and as I expected, we received two sides of onion rings and fried pickles rather than just one order of onion rings and fried pickles since our waitress didn't let me finish placing my order.  My burger did not have any cheese on it, so I decided to wait and ask our waitress for a slice of cheese from the kitchen. She never came by, I had to wave down another waitress, who ended up being nice and helpful.  The fried pickles were indeed still good, however, both my fiance and I agreed that the burgers were not good.  They had the texture and look of burgers that had been kept in a steam warmer or container of beef brother, there was not any searing from griddle or chargrilling. It was not what I remembered of Pinky's years ago (or the Penguin for that matter).  Neither of us could finish our burgers due to the odd texture or lack of apparent grilling / cooking so we decided to get the bill.  Again we could not find our waitress, so I asked the other waitress that helped us out earlier for the bill. Then for the first time since we were seated, our waitress came by and snagged the bill with my credit card.  Overall, the service was bad and the burgers were no good, don't see us coming back again.

nNFqkjVC9w5IK3KDH5L7yw.text: I love this place. Great food, great atmosphere, great beer. Some of my favorites are the corndog shrimp and the white trash burger. I tried this place because it was on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives from the Food Network and I was not disappointed.  This is a great local diner. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because there's no convenient parking, it can get too crowded and loud, and I feel like while they have some great craft beer, there could be more variety to it, especially better supporting the local breweries. With that said, I'll be eating here over and over again.

_z2LxowOL5rfOWjYgVx7eg.text: The food here is amazing! It's so different and unique which goes with the theme of the restaurant. All the staff are super friendly. This is one of my favorite places to eat. I highly recommend trying the ding dong chicken. But I'm giving this 4 stars, because it took so long to get seated and even longer to get our food.

qKVMDUl0zWqJYP0-YdEatw.text: Who doesn't love Pinky's?? Everything is amazing and the decor is super artsy, super funky, it honestly just makes my heart happy! I haven't had a bad meal and I don't think I could pick out my favorite, so I'll tell you a couple of yummy things you should try. Appetizers: The homemade veggie chili is really good (I could use a bowl right now, it's so cold outside). Pimp'N fries, no you read that right, fresh waffle fries topped with melted pimento cheesey goodness. Greg's pickles, deep fried pickles with ranch. The portions are huge. AND my favorite, the crab puppies, they look just like a hush puppy but have crab inside, they're served with tarter sauce. I'm not a huge fan of tarter sauce but I'm a fan of this awesome combination! Burgers: my husband loves the white trash burger (burger with provolone,fried pickles, and onion rings and spicy ranch sauce) If I order a burger, I usually just get the Pterodactyl with cheese and pick my own toppings! I've tried the ding dong chicken sandwich once, the crunchy peanut butter, sriracha hot sauce and honey cilantro sounds like a weird combo and it was but it was also a weird/delicious combination. When I want to feel healthy, I get the Falafel with hummus or the grilled Pita. Even the Uptown Tuna Melt is really good. They literally have anything for everyone! As for drinks, they have a great selection of beer and my two favorite cocktails are the Unicorn tears and the Poinsetta which is like a mimosa except with cranberry juice! Okay, I've literally written a book but this restaurant has been my go-to since moving to Charlotte!!

Y6cWP_ZPRmlgOco1813UJw.text: Words can't express how I love this restaurant! Atmosphere is fun and friendly. Staff is ALWAYS nice. Parking can be tough to find but we always get lucky and happen to find parking in their actual lot. You can also park across the street where Dunkin Donuts is. I have tried their double chili cheeseburger and it was so good and juicy. I got it with a side of potato salad and it was good. I also tried their waffle fries and they were crispy. Tried the wings too and they were delicious. Boyfriend said they were one of the best he's ever had. Ranch dressing is so good with it. My favorite item on the menu is their chili dog with pimento cheese and I add onions to it. The chili is sooo good but the pimento cheese on it really gives the flavor a kick. Food is so good here but their prices are even better.

DaP_rFkxACipe5wVQWI-gw.text: Pimpin Fries and all burger options are great!  Especially the Nature Boy!  Friendly service with a  feel-good environment.  Good local beer options as well.

EardjWZ1almNIYq7-Lsa3Q.text: I'm sorry to be the Debbie Downer here, but Pinky's was just very overwhelming in atmosphere and underwhelming in food. It was not only recommended by Yelpers but a good friend who is a Charlotte native.   Starting with the parking lot, the experience was frustrating at times. The lot is TINY and cramped and if you aren't a local and don't know all the good side streets, you can feel a little lost trying to park. The bright spot was walking in: there's a super fun photo booth that is a cheap and interesting way to pass some time while waiting for food. The eclectic beer list should please pretty much anyone. The service was a little lacking for me. I understand I came with a pretty straight-laced party with kids, but the young hipster that served us seemed pretty unnecessarily annoyed by having to serve us. He wasn't rude or slow, just seemed to have a permanent scowl and seemed "above it all". I started looking around for signs that the restaurant's "schtick" was overly-bored staff. It was also SUPER loud...not a great atmosphere for a family meal or book club, or even people that want to hear themselves talk. Great for a party of loud rambunctious people, though.  The food was really the disappointing part to me. After seeing the DDD episode I was excited for innovative food and tried the veggie burger. Um...there was SO MUCH GREASE that my bun was pretty much useless. Between the fried appetizer and "veggie" burger, I used so many napkins that I was probably the reason our server was annoyed. My parents seemed pretty lackluster about their burgers, too. I expect that from my dad, who hates restaurants, but my mom is usually pretty easy going and she didn't have much to say about her food. Or if she did, I couldn't hear it. My hubs liked whatever he got, I'm pretty sure it was a sandwich with a rare tuna steak. So there's a food bright spot.  All in all, we don't visit Charlotte very often but there will definitely be other places I want to try rather than returning to Pinky's.

82vi-S5Pz6tOevw-771QmA.text: If you are looking for a semi-grungy (but in a cool dive-y way, not dirty) place to eat on the Westside of Charlotte, Pinky's Westside Grill is the way to go. Owned by one of the former owners of The Penguin during that restaurant's renaissance, what was supposed to become The Penguin 2 ended up changing it's name to Pinky's but still featuring the same great burgers, chili, sandwiches and other great items. Little portions on big plates does not happen here. Here, you get more than you can eat at a very fair price, whether it's burgers, sandwiches or anything else they serve. For your health's sake, you may want to make it a treat instead of a staple, but it's still some of the best food in Charlotte and possibly some of the best burgers in the area!

-_LxqquG50NLJJ_VJmMgdw.text: First time.visitor to this location.  I used to frequent this area of Charlotte on a daily basis as part of my job.32 years ago this lot was actually a parking lot  shared with a car body shop. This was a quick seating at 5:30 on a Saturday afternoon.  The wait service was attentive and timely. The food came out really quickly and was very good.  The fare is mostly burgers and crafted sandwiches.All good and I ll definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pterodactyl Burger with Bacon and waffel fries. Good Stuff...
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The iconic Pinky&#39;s sign....

fofPeBp_HdNS-5_zuCodUQ.text: Noisy, lively, rambunctious, divey, eclectic atmosphere. From the servers, to the crowd--you never know what you're gunna get.   I live and work about a mile a way and frequent Pinky's. Very diverse menu from salads, to dogs, to tacos, and burgers. You can be as healthy or unhealthy as you want and trust it will be a good meal. Decent prices, but they are one of those places that charge you for everything...Fries? That'll be extra. Toppings? That'll be extra. You get the point.  Parking is kind of a pain, but there are lots across the street and adjacent. This place gets busy during peak hours so expect a wait. They also have great food and drink specials daily.  Ding dong sandwich is sort of a "pad thai" take on a chicken sandwich, different and pretty good...I'd recommend it if that;s your kind of thing. The turkey burgers are impressive for this type of joint. Fish tacos, fresh and delicious.  The downside... service is a little odd. It's an "everyone is your server" type of place which makes it confusing and a bit awkward.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome fried pickles

q296ChW9a--8uuFyTqE2_Q.text: This place is awesome.  Extremely cheap and tons of amazing options  My favorite items:   Korean tacos - just amazing.  Best taco in CLT and this is from a guy who loves Cabo Fish Taco Pimping fries - forget the bacon just stick to the pimento cheese - these are to die for Falafel sandwich - can be a bit dry for some, needs hot sauce, but it's really good with that The burgers are awesome.  The garbage burger is a personal favorite. The crab cake hushpuppies are perfect. The banana pudding is top notch as well.  The only thing I have ever had there I didn't like was the corn dog shrimp.

i0uH2HQXIDnOn975l8CmJg.text: I tried to visit this place yesterday (Sat).  Drove from Monroe to find out that Woodland Road was under construction so we drove around a few blocks.  We finally made it to the Restaurant (so we thought) coming from the other direction on Woodland.  If you are coming from Woodland and you are trying to find a parking space you maybe surprise to find out that there is about 7 parking spaces in front of Pinky's and by that time it is a little too late to make any turns because you are now facing Freedom Dr and you can only make a right, taking you away from the restaurant.  This is one of those place without a parking lot so you have to park in places nearby so make sure you look up the address in Google Maps..... location...location...location...

zdj2nqJ8J4SoMbrz5cFAXg.text: Awesome and affordable food with phenomenal service! Definitely recommending Pinky's to all my friends and family! If you haven't been, GO! You won't regret it! It's a little loud but the service here is absolutely amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding mountain = happiness! Seriously phenomenal!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Patsy!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Onion rings!

DtvQG2UWZpfYrXDJlCPD2Q.text: Great atmosphere, great food, awesome customer service. Marney (sp?) was our waitress. If you can get put in her area, you won't be disappointed with your experience. The manager even came out to check on our experience as first timers. Definitely recommend

l5SmMqJcOaDQ9MxcebVV5Q.text: My personal favorite burger place in Charlotte. My order always seems to be the same when I go or I order take out. Always go for the white trash burger, add sour kraut and it's perfectly delicious! The chili cheese waffle fries, fried pickles, crab puppies and veggie burgers are a must try too! My fav time to visit is on Friday's for craft beer roulette. Bring a few friends so you guys can swap out beers if you get one you don't like ;)

PVXiFiDGqUKF_VdFsPcyiQ.text: This place is eclectic and fabulous. Orders were veggie burger white trash style (bun doesn't hold up, but that never surprises me), Fish fry, Crab cakes, falafel salad, cheerwine pound cake, banana pudding. few others, but all things ordered got rave reviews. The tahini dressing for the falafel salad was amazing, though the falafel themselves were a little over done. The tartar sauce was incredibly well spiced (reports, I'm allergic to shell fish so after the crab cakes I was out). The banana pudding was the best I've ever tasted. The honey version of cole slaw was incredible and I could not stop stealing someones red potato salad. So much garlic that I didn't know red potato salad needed. I so wanted to get the veggie hot dogs with stuff all over them.

7WcWaf41N-EzYCB_WsnVbg.text: I urge you NOT to eat here. Somehow the crabpuppies were either prepared incorrectly or cross contaminated, and resulted in an immediate stomachache followed by stomach pain all night, and this went for everyone in our party who had them (those who didn't were fine afterwards).  Service was not the best, and one server we had was very impatient and uncomfortable, making our experience the same.   Overall, food was cheap but not great for the very cheap price, the Matty patty melt was very dry and after a few bites I couldn't force myself to finish it. Absolutely one of the WORST dining experiences I've had in Charlotte, and I hope this was just a bad experience and not a typical one.

Qbo-RCiz_jbhALXHo_5Nfw.text: This was such a cool little spot ! The setting is  casual and has a fun vibe . I ordered the White Trash Burger ( fun names always a plus ) it was so delicious . It had fried pickles , onion rings and a beef patty super good . The bun was simple which really made the burger .   I also tried the hot wings . Excellent , asked for them extra crispy and they were    I will return and definitely a place to try out .

fKumT0-eOuuRjlLmNb6OCw.text: My boyfriend and I went to Pinky's because of their feature on Triple D. The food was delicious as expected. Good atmosphere and friendly staff. We recommend the popcorn shrimp!

koo1cBZNYi1NNzAGo_rHOw.text: We found this through an app as it appeared on Diners, Drive in's and Dives. The atmosphere was loud but fun. The server work as a team so you get help from everyone. We ordered chili fries, chicken tacos and a patty melt. The patty melt was dry but the other food was delicious. I'd go back and would recommend this place to others.

pcAoXohH-3qP_BFoA3kGWA.text: Finally got a chance to check this place out.  The food was really good. It was hot and I liked the dipping sauces. Perfect for a Saturday summer lunch. It's heavy food though so it's not a health spot folks. Loved the corn dog shrimp. Yes that's right Corn Dog Shrimp.

8jvMZ_NcdqhAsnEhvzvWJg.text: I get to do the 500th review of Pinky's?!  Not sure if there is much to add that the other 499 reviews haven't covered.   The fried pickles are amazing. The burgers are decent considering they're cooked well done.  You're not stopping here on your health food pilgrimage, but for some classic american greasy spoon cooking you can't do much better in Charlotte.

XIz3cxfq79kANF6Z0SwlCA.text: If you are looking to fat boy it up- this is the spot to go!  Great atmosphere, burgers, fried food and a surprising (in a good way) amount of vegetarian options (veggie hot dog w/veggie chili is good even to meat lovers).  Everything is served al la carte and the prices encourage you to order a lot!  I def recommend the crab puppies (hushpuppies with crab) and the shrimp dog basket (jumbo shrimp fried like a corn dog).  If you are looking to go on the lighter side- the Ginger Tuna Salad has a fun Asian twist.  Added bonus- the drinks are dirt cheap.  Easy to see how this became a Charlotte staple!

xM9gFn445ngNpOktKjKPRw.text: The menu is great if you want cheap eats. It was very affordable  yummy bar food. There are also great vegetarian options. It is a very fun environment with a lot of decor to Look at. The pimpn fries were great and so were the burgers. Also had a good pita with cheese spinach basil etc forget the name but it was great. Drink specials as well. I want to get the white trash burger and fried pickles next time as I've heard great things. Highly recommend! Especially if you're on a budget but are tired of fast food. Good food at fast food prices

pINwnoqwEGddiJ4jfTlhgA.text: I had heard great things about Pinky's from a friend.  I had the Ding Dong Style Burger. I had not had a burger with peanut butter on it before and was nervous to try. But this Thai style burger was Excellent. We also shared an order of crab puppies. They were wonderful. Don't overlook this restaurant. You will not be disappointed.

2Sx4CxMN2pRB4sILfWuBAg.text: For this review its actually 4.5 stars.  Service was great!  This place had a great vibe. At 3pm on a Saturday afternoon there was a wait but we were lucky and found two great spots at the bar.  I ordered the strawberry basil lemonade made with gin and my husband got a beer. My drink 5/5 perfect for the hot humid day.  We preceded with the burger featured on diners drive ins and dives...forget the name but Asian pork burger with Asian sweet sauce and cole slaw. I gave it a 4/5 but my husband gave it 3/5. It had a unique flavor and definitely wasn't traditional. Fried pickles 5/5 yummy!!!!!! Pimp'n fries with added bacon 4/5 I wish they had more cheese. As stated before service was great! We actually saw the owner present recognized him from the TV show diners drive ins and dives. All staff seem to actually enjoy their jobs which in my opinion sets the tone for the dining experience.  Wish we had something like this in Las Vegas!  Recommend this place to others for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Finally got a double for the third round 5/5!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Special of the day pork Asian burger 4/5 yummy
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizer greg&#39;s pickles small shown small $3.95 large $5.95.   5/5 delicious!

lIGj1sNe-cb64NS191c14g.text: Food was great. Had the White Trash Burger, Hush Puppies and Corn Dog Shrimp. Also tried the Squirrelly Temple. I was NOT disappointed. The atmosphere is totally relaxed. Staff was awesome, as was the music. When I go back to NC, I'm definitely coming back to Pinky's!

8tJN-hi9S2V89c9zE8h3sQ.text: Nothing but love for Pinky's. I've been back many times since having the gross shrimp and everything I've had has been delicious. This place will always be a top 5.

0NkWNbEoxTzJB-lIMYI_tw.text: Intended to go to the original but it was packed so we end to the huntersville location and it did not disappoint. We were not able to sit on their patio due to a recent incident with dogs but they were willing to bring out our food to a table in front of another establishment. Awesome food

5PpLPz-HAYw1Phb25aXfbA.text: Went here for a lunch with the kiddos and hubby while passing through the Charlotte area. I didn't have any expectations but was pleasantly surprised by this quirky little place.   We were seated quickly and our drink orders were taken. Saw fried pickles on the menu and quickly put in an order for those bad boys. Served with homemade ranch dressing, they were very tasty. The 4 year old got the pterodactyl burger. He thought it was made of actual Dino meat and scarfed it down. Score! 2 year old got a corn dog and ate almost half which in toddler land is a win. The hubs and I both got the pinky dog. It's a hot dog smothered in homemade pimento cheese and chili. It was pretty darn tasty. For sides we had the waffle fries (standard) and the southern slaw (meh). Being 7 months preggo I did not have a chance to enjoy a cocktail though I did read longingly through the menu which featured many delish sounding drinks with fun names. Unicorn tears anyone?!?  All in all a good place with a fun and funky atmosphere.  The prices aren't too bad either.

PTgQPCoMfgTwcBPkoDnAbA.text: This place is amazing! Clean, food is out of this world and  waiting times are slim to none. The staff very friendly , which makes that experience even better. I love it!!!  Prices are very affordable!!

lneY16YnX6Q765bxXiieoA.text: Tried one of their burgers with the chili and it was amazing! It was happy hour so house margaritas were $3 . Went with a friend and got 4 drinks and appetizer and two burgers for 30! Amazing!

3xMmQN-pQqIPcallo4UHXA.text: This place serves a really good burger. It can be made to order. You can choose fried pickle chips, onion rings, lettuce, beef steak tomotoes, name it, it is included. I could not have enjoyed it more.    I ordered the waffle fries, they came to the table cold and dry. I had to send them back. They still were a not so great when I got a new order.  I should have tried the cheese fries. They looked really good. The onion rings were delicious. Greasy goodness.   The waitresses were very friendly and helpful with menu selections honestly. There are so many drink specials it was hard for me to choose. The parking situation is clumsy.  Very little parking by the grill. There is parking around the corner with ominous warnings to take all of your belongings and no guarantee of safety at all. Park at your own risk.   I had patio dining on a wonderful day. A breeze came along and knocked the umbrella on my head. I was stunned and a bit dazed. This was an easily preventable accident.   The base of the umbrella was not weighted. The umbrella had a flimsy zip cord keeping it attached to the railing. It was not safe. It was mere inches from my eyes l was lucky my head took most of the brunt and less of my face. I had some swelling on the right side of my face and headache that night. I was sorry to see managment was not extremely concerned by this error.  My bill was deducted by a few dollars. The price of my mediocre tasting waffle fries. In an accident of this nature it would have been better to not bill my party at all. A more litigious patron would have called their lawyer from the table. I would have loved to give more stars, however getting hit in the head  while eating dry waffle fries was a serious offense that was taken much too lightly by management.

cvD_32uihQwHzW3FG-h67A.text: One my favorite places to grub down! From the Pimpin Fries to the burgers, this place nails it every time!! Cannot go wrong with this one!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimpin&#39; Fries!!!

6kxAtQqPOLSVA689fZk0gQ.text: Service was phenomenal food was excellent. Need I say more... but I will! I'm a manager at a popular busy restaurant, been in the industry for 27 years I loved it! Well done guys.

jdQ0VxqLWnTz02J3pK0Pkw.text: Went for lunch on a Sunday. Was quite crowded but my friend and I were able to get a small table pretty quickly. Ordered the white trash burger (5.95; comes with fried onions and fried pickles) with a side of waffle fries (2.50 iirc). Meal took a bit longer to come out but that's totally understandable given the busyness of the time. Food was fantastic. Service was subpar but nothing crazy or anything. Definitely recommend

fAcJZz3LivLBnpJoImvprA.text: Interesting place, in an unexpected location. I agree with the other reviews, so let me summarize...  Pros: Great atmosphere, good choice of drinks (drafts and cocktails), and some good food options (Greg's Fried Pickles, Pimp'n Fries, Corn Dog Shrimp).  Cons: Parking, some food options are a bit tired (White Trash Burger, Spaugh Buffalo Wings).

IKBPNjxdMT5nZ9TQquRZCQ.text: Had I been a visitor to Charlotte for the first time and had this meal, I would have rated Pinky's 1 star, never to return.  It was the service and vibe that pushes me to an otherwise generous second star.  The meal was just that freakin' bad.  I know, shame on me for not sending it back immediately.  I was hungry, in a hurry, and had places to be.  My bad!   There were probably four other choices I could have made to let this be a strong 4 star rating.  I had to pick, at my waiters assurance, the Fish Tacos (three $10.25).  The Gorton's Fisherman has served me better "beer battered tilapia"!    The menu described it as having honey-cilantro slaw, spicy ranch, and served with a side of black beans.  Apparently they were out of honey, cilantro, and spicy ranch.  At least none of those flavors found their way to my plate.  Had I gone to a supermarket, found the cheapest can of black beans, and heated them up in a microwave adding nothing else for flavoring, they would have been better tasting than the black beans that were part of my meal.  I really wanted to love this place!  Maybe another time I will....

7F96xWL47jqM-8sYKHkqYw.text: I can't express the joy I felt when I found out there's a restaurant in Charlotte at which I can actually BUY a vegetarian chili dog and corn dog. I love it! The food is predominantly fried and greasy, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. I wouldn't go here if I were on a diet, or super often, but once in a while I need to get my greasy junk food on and my god do I love a good corndog.  Also, the coconut sake is SO YUM!

gw_tjWMmInjQPN1QczggnA.text: The only thing keeping me from giving this place 5 stars is the parking... even though I know I will not find a spot up front and have to walk up from the back dirt lot, I still drive through and get my hopes up! Aside from that, everything else is amazing. The staff takes care of everyone - it's definitely a team effort and it works well. The crab puppies are delicious and so are the burgers and the buffalo chicken. On Saturdays, the liquor is 1/2 off and the wedding punch and white gummy bear drinks are dangerously good. Oh and they have a cement triceratops out front.

7g-wTg7Yds-s5NIqAxIxGg.text: Fantastic spot! Recommend the fried pickles and tuna melt... Amazing! Service could be a bit more professional in front of customers, but overall efficient.

ERuFUeuH8y3UOkBK0Lniyg.text: Service was great! Multiple servers checked on us and service was quick! We had the fried pickle chips for an appetizer and  White Trash burger and waffle fries. Good, not spectacular, but definitely didn't leave hungry. I had the Cheerwine 21 cocktail as well that was good. Will definitely come back if in the area.

i652nfkC4W5PEeAEirKt4A.text: Phenomenal food!  Definitely not your ordinary restaurant. Great combinations and excellent appetizers!  Try the crab puppies. My table ordered the pimpin fries and fried pickles. Extremely good!  We tried the white trash burger, redneck parm, and Pinky dog. All of them were excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheerwine pound cake

qYuVED41wGk3aXo774H1Iw.text: I loved it , will be back for more ! Great food , fast service , good prices , interesting menu !!!

H5r058kk1syKtQrYmLTu6w.text: Pinky's is fye! The only drawbacks I have is the wait time... on 2 separate occasions, I entered and stood at the door area for 10 & 13 minutes: I wasn't greeted or anything. They're busy pretty much every visit so I don't complain about small stuff but if I'm standing their that long then I already know my food is gonna take forever so I leave. The other drawback is some of the names had my friends looking at me differently as if I was trying to be prejudice or something lmaooo no biggie tho

qCLoib_CxoJVo_dDspvDYQ.text: Pinky's serves what I would consider comfort, delicious bar food all for a very affordable price. It is amazing how little you spend here to get a massive amount of food. If you need to cure a hangover or are out late at night and need quick bite, Pinky's is a must try. We ordered the pimpin' fries as one of the appetizers, and it was awesome. Don't think twice and order these perfectly seasoned, crispy waffle fries covered in melty pimento cheese and huge, crunchy pieces of bacon. The waffle fries were crispy down to the last bite even though they were covered in cheese and bacon. We also had the crab hush puppies, and it comes with thirteen big hush puppy balls with good lumps of crab meat cooked throughout. They were very filling and were delicious with the tarter sauce to dip.  For my entree, I ordered the Pinky Dog, which was a hot dog with pimento cheese and chili. The hot dog was a decent size and along with two appetizers, was plenty of food for me. The chili was meaty and hot, really giving the hot dog some great flavor. The pimento cheese wasn't as prominent in flavor because of the chili, but you did get some melty gooieness underneath from it. Overall, I had a great lunch at Pinky's and really enjoyed there awesome food all for a very reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimpin fries - waffle fries with pimento cheese and bacon
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab hush puppies
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Pinky Dog with pimento cheese and chili

CoPxIr--v9UoYJVdc3uf2A.text: So I'm picking my wife up at the airport and remember she's been planing around for 6 hours and will probably be way hungry and I don't know where to get good food near here. so I ask the lady at hourly parking: Pinky's she says, 10 minutes away she says, does great burgers she says... so I get there and ask what's the two most popular burgers they sell. "White Trash burger" and "Patsy Melt" - 'Oy! cute names,' I think and prepare to be underwhelmed, but the place smells good, and there's pin ball, and I'm already here, so one of each plus onion things. Got back to CLT on time to meet my wife at baggage claim and we thoroughly enjoyed the simple goodness of onion strings and fried pickles on a cheese burger plus more onion strings... Had that P-melt cold for breakfast with a coke- oh yeah!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well... Pinball with pins and balls...

IYHu44VfqSIIFJvhxzIkvA.text: This place lives up to the hype. After seeing this location on diners dive-ins and dives I had to check it out only because it was owned by the former penguin restaurant owner, and that place was great (they still have that famous pamemto cheese). One thing I love is that they have a variety of menu items food and drink. When I sat down there were multiple pages of drinks. The food menu is impressive too it's robust take your time. So for my drink I had the strawberry basil lemonade. It's fresh, but basil makes drinks taste that way. For the food I had the "Nature Boy" veggie burger. It's base is a black bean burger with a lot of veggie ingredients. It's  huge the sandwich is very filling in itself, if you can finish. The onion rings are thin rings which makes for a lot when you get small. Fried pickles are good, a little greasy but that's the point. Its not a game here they have absolutely great  food and  drinks.  To really enjoy this place you need to come here twice. One down for me.

FKLl-UUO-Hzptl7ah6Ywgg.text: Good has been good every time I've been I do not like the server sharing tables, it gets confusing and annoying to have someone ask if you are ready to order every 2 seconds.

wiUjqW_b1ahLg-DjU-AzZA.text: Hello Friday! It's lunch hour. My CoWorkers and I decided to check this place out.   My first time visiting!   Let's start with parking. Non existent. Your subjected to parking behind the building then walking up. Trust me you'll need the exercise after eating here. The inside is relatively small, we had a party of 8, decided to split up into 2 groups.   I wouldn't advise coming here during the busy lunch traffic. The wait time is between 15-25mins which is expected.   After being seated, we quickly ordered. I had the White Trash Burger and the Crab Hushpuppies. The White Trash burger lacked flavor. I added sriracha thinking this would help.... Nope! Felt like I was eating Wonder Bread with sriracha....But hell I was hungry so I ate it. Now the Crab Hushpuppies were AMAZING! I saw heaven with every bite! I spent about $12 on my meal.  Not bad!  Yes, I'm willing to try this place again. The grill grilled cheese is next on my list! Until next time ...
