Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese fries.

CT6xEHtPpyrfzvXt7y9_pA.text: I had corn dog shrimp with a crab puppy appetizer. Everything was delicious. The hubmachine had 2 pinky dogs and they were also really good. Gotta love homemade pimento cheese. We also had banana pudding and it was out of this world. We will definitely be back as often as possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best banana pudding ever!!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cornbread shrimp
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pinky Dog

VjmQSQ_IZdtT3RnWQRjSbw.text: I have to say that this was a great stop in an area I was about to give up on. The food was excellent! The portions were more than enough but watch out for desert, they've got grams outback making her famous pudding. Not kidding it tasted just like I remember from my childhood and the portion was out of this world. I could have fed a table of 4 on my portion alone.   Most importantly the waitstaff was off the chart. The place was packed yet every time I looked up from the table there was a friendly smile just checking up on how things were. Not in the overbearing way when you know they're pushing a table to get the next group in but actually caring about you. Five stars is a first for me. I will return here.

6428fh4p0hDNCznRqPsdxw.text: This is the best priced food you'll find in charlotte without contest. Comes in big portions and tastes great. The service is fast and it is a cool little atmosphere too. The only downside is it is pretty loud inside.

E4r1sKSqlgwYjg-fktqFqQ.text: Pinky's is a hidden gem if you ask me! As many times as I've seen the building I didn't realize it was a restaurant haha. The car on the building is sweet. I got the chicken platter with the buffalo sauce?? Excellent stuff indeed. I look forward to my next visit!

n8O0PGVqcXiMnUuG0BTeiw.text: Really cool vibe that's fun to be around. You'll never leave hungry as most options are full of flavor and generally pretty heavy. The fried pickles, pimento cheese fries are great appetizers. The white trash burger is also a solid go to

q3zCUDqDrL0xFCQPpitD2g.text: I truly love Pinkys! Everytime I go, wheat her it's with friends, solo or for take out the service is great, food is amazing and the atmosphere is trendy. I truly love Pinky's

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. A gift from food heaven
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kinda Friend Turkey Sandwich with Pimento Cheese {$7}

RCgzq-cod9xPENS8rJlDUg.text: My first visit to Pinky's did not disappoint. The food was fantastic; I had the White Trash burger, hush pups, waffle fries, and fried pickles, along with a vanilla Sparkle Pony. Although it was extremely busy, the food came fairly quick, and the staff was super friendly. The inside of the place was super cool and unique, too, and I couldn't help but snap a bunch of photos while I was there. If I lived closer to Charlotte, there's no doubt I would be eating here ALL the time, but until then, I look forward to my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. White Trash burger. Yummy.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parking.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu.

zQeR-_wjQgjCl6LgI8wXxQ.text: Who doesn't LOVE Pinky's??? Yeah, I can't think of anyone either! The food here is so good.  Love both locations.  (My go to is the salads.. Their ranch is to die for!!!) Staff is awesome and you definitely get fairly quick service here.

RG3iavSd1chJP8-tj4MuMQ.text: My new favorite spot to visit when I come to this city!! Everything was amazing. We sat outside and ate, I felt like we was in LA lol

bg6ivX4G9zc-U7vx1fptLA.text: Great service and food, this was my first time, prices so cheap and flavors uniques.  Green chile pork is amazing with gluten free bun.  And the baked wings are my favorites!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious ancho barbecue wings

Ll_2T_xisX-FezLeo8eQMQ.text: I love, love, love the food here. The parking lot is HORRIBLE. If you're closer to Huntersville, go to that location - ample parking. I get that this ambiance is loud and trendy.. but there should be levels of acceptable noise.

wo93pnE7CKVolNJXej0G9A.text: Friendly note: if you've never been here before, there is plenty of parking in the back. I would not even attempt parking in front (there are only a handful of spaces).  SERVICE: I have noticed that a lot of local places, especially the ones that have enjoyed some fame from being on a Food Network show, coast on their reputation and do not pay much attention to service. Pinky's is not like that. The server was friendly, the food came out quickly, my glass was refilled promptly, and it really seemed like the people working here enjoy it.  PRICE: I would say the prices here are about average. Don't expect to pay McDonald's prices (don't expect McDonald's food either), but you also won't be asked to spend an arm and a leg. Burgers and fries will set you back around $10.  FOOD: The menu is fairly diverse, while not being so large that newcomers have no idea what to order. There are plenty of burger options, plenty of side options, and plenty of other menu items for those not wanting a burger or wanting to change it up. I would highly suggest ordering an appetizer of fried pickles- they really are like nothing you've had before. The only menu item that I've had that I do not care for are the onion rings. They are very thin ("horseshoe" onion rings), which I do not care for. Everything else is great.  Pinky's is one of my go-to places for late night food in Charlotte. It's a Charlotte staple, and I would recommend it to everyone.

Yrz_g1zcfO2PHK2vHhwOAg.text: Awesome restaurant that was converted from a old auto garage & featured on DDD -- there is a lot more parking down Morehead (past Pinky's into a gravel area) but watch out for those potholes!  I got a Shirley Temple and the Corn Dog Shrimp basket -- there is a plentiful amount of salty waffle fries in the basket, and it's topped with amazing corn dog battered shrimp. Try the wasabi ranch -- it was pretty light and gave the fries and the shrimp a good spicy kick. The Shirley Temple was a good complement to the food -- sweet with a good pineapple taste.  The service was quick and easy and the food was amazing! I'm definitely putting this place on my rotation.

f2Y8he6B1z2mMt5drp9tbw.text: I have eaten here many times.  It is my girlfriend and I's go to spot.  It's very affordable and it's good food.  Now it's fried food but there are some healthy options, although I would suggest the corn dog shrimp and popcorn chicken buffalo style.  The music's a little loud and the wait staff are hipsters.  I wouldn't take my parents here because I feel they would be annoyed by the loudness.  But, if you don't mind loud music and want a good affordable meal this is the place.  A PBR pitcher is like $5 which is awesome!  Good selection of North Carolina brews.  They have wine and liquor drinks as well as daily drink specials.  So, if you haven't been, give it a shot!

-jIcfzSLl4_daEO1jeiijA.text: Ok,  From Orlando, lived in Charlotte in 2000 and 2001, when the Penquin opened, grew to love the Penquin and the trio! Miss you guys, and good luck with Pinky's, still need to find out WTF, but that'll come, Until next time! Rev IT!

PScfxtjfuTeQZ-XIUVFxpw.text: Literally the best burger we have ever had. My husband had the mammoth with everything on it and was more than impressed (which is hard to do). Their fried pickles and hush puppies are light years above any others we have tried. Their prices are more than fair, for both my husband and I, the bill came too $22.00 before tip. This will certainly be our date night hang out!!!!!!!!

Zt01FO3Jve9sQPaXbcy_qQ.text: The portions are big, so get ready to share!!  I had the fried pickles, the burger melt, and the crab balls. They were all amazing.

yoRqgriZB0kXEJoXTJFdZg.text: Yummmm! So good.  Cheap food, great specials and a good atmosphere.

ota9aCJqCV-75IwmbN-SxA.text: Best place in Charlotte I'very found for burgers & I've looked all over.  A lot of the other highly rated burger places have decent burgers but are more of a hangout spot & thus highly rated. Pinky's is a quaint little spot where you go for the food & drinks, not because you know all your friends will be there on a saturday night.  All the components on the burger are excellent, fresh jalapenos,  leaf lettuce, ripe tomato,  soft bun, tender good quality beef, nice size patty & excellent value!!!  This is one of those places that a keen eye can discern that a lot of work went into every ingredient that goes into their menu items.  I don't believe it gets the credit it deserves due to the fact that the burgers are only $4-5!  Great waffle fries & lots of other great options for meat eaters & vegetarians alike.  Atmosphere & service have always been very good as well.  FYI....I wrote this review after going there about 10 times & always enjoying the food but the last time I went I felt inclined to write a review (which I never do) because I got the white trash burger with everything on it, simply put, the best burger I've ever had in Charlotte.  One more thing....to the person below that claims to have gotten sick from Pinky's, maybe check your medications because getting food poisoning twice from the same place is extremely unlikely especially if your visits aren't close together & I've been here about 10 times without any issues & my team goes there every week after our game without issues so I'm to assume it's you & not the establishment.

YgIak_xNHlbJtuvTpH-yew.text: Had the White Trash Burger (burger, onion rings, fried pickles & sauce) with a side of sweet potatoe fries and tall glass of sweet tea! DELICIOUS! Kinda small and could pose difficulties parking if it was a full house but the decor was chill (used to be an old mechanics shop) and beer selection seems just fine. There's a good assortment of meat-lover's and veggie-lover's grub. Sandwiches are served al a carte but really is enough even when you're super hungry. None-the-less I got some perfectly cooked sweet potatoe fries. From what I saw of the place, I wouldn't recommend it for large groups so have no more than 4 ppl in the group. Just a suggestion. Otherwise, friendly people, good food and good atmosphere!

30tMWGNESqEK_Bl7JyoiOQ.text: We definitely enjoyed this place.  The service was incredibly fast and reasonably friendly.  The food was good.  Nothing spectacular, but exactly what we were looking for.  I had a basic burger and fries and my wife got the white trash burger w/ the fried pickles on it.  Great sweet tea.  I'd definitely recommend it if you're looking for a good quick burger fix.

Yzmz2sd5M6ueI-x2Cy_TFw.text: Awesome food. The place is filled with funky decor and a juke box that has great music. Friendly and great service.

wLUH1DB7sbEhNmB5_XHvtg.text: PInky's is one of the best things to happen on the West side of Charlotte. Great service, great food, great bar. Try the White Trash Burger!

nxsWjiP9isnnibzecBy5pg.text: The Kinda Fried Turkey sandwich is amazing! Enough said.  In a city where you can find pimento cheese everywhere, theirs stands out because they melt it over super yummy waffle fries. Oh, and brown the top for texture and extra flavor.  Pickles were just OK and super greasy, so just go with the pimento cheese fries instead.

X2tzD7ZjdAFvNcnk3UioCA.text: I went three times in one week. It's just really good, casual food. The service is great, people are fun and Pinky's draws up the most diverse demography of people.

7rET-RjlogkIxlP7liDnbg.text: Great food, unique names on the menu, great options,have been here a handful of times.

bSutKpgbtGPb5RjNnDMYbA.text: Pretty much no parking. Literally 7 spots.  Good food but the wait can be really long during prime time.

LTcyxFTi83Rg3ZPvvRV75A.text: i like pinkys, i sit down and order food and it gets to me. eventually. well, sort of. one time i ordered a grilled cheese and soup and they brought me a turkey burger. im extremely patient so for some people this might be a deal breaker, but it was okay. then it took a while for me to get that grilled cheese sandwich. in fact, it seemed like it was really hard for them to understand that on that day, with my tomato soup, i wanted a grilled cheese sandwich.   in the end they only charged me for the soup and my glass of water. i never asked them to do that, so it was pretty surprising to see it on my bill.   other than that, pinkys is alright. you get some food and you eat it and if you're there with a few people just make sure to have a lot of conversation topics because you'll be there for a while. seriously.

iWduS-ccF02CHau_cY_qCw.text: Great food awesome service ask for daisy she's a gem

OV7QJLLwGERdxOBHK1oiBA.text: I had high hopes after hearing that one of the former owners of the Penguin ran this restaurant, but my trip there on Sunday, 1/29/12, was incredibly disgusting and disappointing.  Our table ordered a variety of appetizers to share, included the felafel balls, Pimp'n Fries, and hushpuppies.  The felafel was tasteless and overcooked, the fries were soft and greasy, and the hushpuppies were just ok.  Nothing to brag about, but certainly the better order.   My lunch order was a Pterodactyl burger with everything.  Not a bad price, but having to pay extra for a side of fries made the price misleading.  I opted to share fries with someone else.  The burger was greasy, literally dripping with grease, and completely covered in mayonnaise.  I scraped the majority of the mayo off, but after that I couldn't get over the amount of grease.    I also had a few fried pickles, but at glancing the bottom of the container which was holding a standing level of grease, I was disgusted.  Of all the fried items, we reached a consensus that either the oil is old or was not hot enough.  Everything was soaked in oil and overcooked.  I can appreciate a good burger joint, but this was beyond terrible.  It's possible to have fried food that doesn't drip with oil.  Even the sweet potato fries were soaked in it.  I will never return.    I also had a horrible bout of food poisoning that night.  I won't be so quick to blame this particular restaurant, but it was the only thing I ate out of the ordinary that day, so make your own judgment.

FERdQbHKZOcIGPcB7NYzTQ.text: Great diner. Fast service.  Atmosphere is cool.  Best in area . . . Just wish late night service was an option.

DK6CLP5YmJ9s5EUzwToGkw.text: Green chile pork and fish tacos are delicious. Cool place, good prices.

HYIsioBo_RWbSXqQoEqXqQ.text: This is my favorite burger joint in Charlotte.  I used to hit up the Penguin practically every week before it closed (and then reopened under new mgmt).  The guy who use to run the kitchen at Penguin when it was on 'Diners, Drive Ins & Dives' owns this place, so there are some similarities.  The menu is much more diverse though.  They DO have healthier options.  My girlfriend and I were turned on to the Kinda Fried Turkey sandwich by the bartender one night.  We never really considered it because I just never felt compelled to order a turkey sandwich at a place known for burgers.  Boy, did my opinion change quickly.  That sandwich is amazing.  The meat is so juicy, it's pure bliss.  She usually orders that and I always get the burger, westside style (chili, coleslaw, mustard) and add pimiento cheese and bacon.  BEST BURGER EVER.  The chili, cheddar, and pimiento cheese waffle fries are also one of our favorites.  Pair all of this up with a tall boy of Genesee cream ale and you're set.  We can usually get out of Pinky's with a meal and drinks for 2 around $30.  In other words, a steal.

54g1if4ZY8V-RPVeHiN4hw.text: Enjoy the margarita pitchers and the fried pickles! The corn dog shrimp is good as well

vDvu15D2cJtrufzpMhCJIA.text: When I want to grub some good old American fare (and when I get a hankering for a hot dog) this is where I go. White trash style is the only style. Drinks are good and fried pickles can't be stopped from going in my belly. Good service. Their falafel is pretty delish as well.

D6NgpQPvdo-J56A4rJaTYA.text: Honestly there is nothing not to like.  First time here.  I ordered the white trash burger.  It was delicious.  Corn bread popcorn shrimp was also a winner.

8TbVnJ82donN_fCCVB-DCA.text: I had the Chili Cheese waffle fries. This is a meal in itself. I love the eclectic atmosphere and the service was top notch.

tHHvGer6mJF9Lw8TJlQYMA.text: Wow.  First time eating at a DDD restaurant and holy cow is it impressive.  Crab chowder was outstanding and packed with crab, Korean tacos were fantastic, and even the fried pickles were great.  The parking is a bit farther than I'd prefer and the music a little louder than I'm used to, but when the food is this good it just doesn't matter.  Will definitely come back here when we visit again!

Kf9k_Rew4UV5LxemHAJ7yA.text: What can you say=Pinky's is very good.Greg makes sure "everybody", is taken care of.I have tried quite a few, of the menu item's.All were excellent.I also have to say-the desert's are the bomb!I had this chocolate-caramel cake that was so good!I go here and the one in Huntersville too-I also take out of town visitor's here-and when they return-they want to go back to Pinky's.

FB-fNLex08QA_3zIdif0IQ.text: An informal place to get something to eat. Great view of the Charlotte skyline. A lot of options, but I was never too impressed with the food here.

eeGPIxutOqtfZXPFTRB9Gg.text: My friends and i go here atleast twice a month. I always get the same thing white trash burger, but the last time 2 times ive went i got the speicals which was fried green tomato on texas toast and the pulled pork cuban. The fried green tomato sandwich was one of the best sandwhichs I've had. It was so great so if you see it on the menu order it if you like to try new things. I love the staff always nice and very friendly.

_czpsFP7aO6bTe4vSF3mpA.text: This place could have 5 star rating from me, the only reason it doesn't its because of some disgruntle employees that unfortunately still work there. Anyways, the food its great, and if you don't get to order the fried pickles or the sweet potatoes chips or the pimp'n fries you are not  fully enjoying the place.   On a side note, they have 2 locations. Their location in Uptown(Downtown) its usually crowded and maybe that is why some of the staff is less friendly. But good news!, their second location with the same food and better service, plus is less crowded. Is just a bit off north (i77 exit 23). Go there and enjoy it.

42p2_BwMKzlzbvZmTy2bWQ.text: Pinky's is a fun little place that has a wide, varied menu that tries to be different and pretty much succeeds.  I've eaten there about 6 times in the last year, most recently last Saturday and although they are almost always busy they do a great job of getting you a table quickly, usualy end up waiting 5-10 minutes or sit at the bar.  Started with the Pimpn Fries, I recommend adding the bacon...everything is better with bacon.  Had the fish tacos and they were lightly battered and perfectly crispy.    Overall it's a fun place for a quick out of the ordinary lunch.  Highly recommended.

VDwMzs-Bal3eBBVCkjuyrw.text: Go this place for the ambience, service and fine cocktails. Pub style/diner food too. My hubby thought the food overly greasy but I enjoyed the buffalo shrimp tacos. Waitress recommended the nature boy burger and I would try that next time. I had an excellent absolut cocktail - ginger hibiscus. It was the most interesting cocktail I've had, in a good way! Hubby disappointed with white trash burger and ditto daughter with veggie hot dog, but we all agreed the fried pickles and fried squash were excellent. Wonderful batter. Go!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Try the hibiscus ginger!

Ekhmp4iMvM-4c5jh6DPNMQ.text: Great place to eat!! The service and food were outstanding!!! I would highly recommend eating here. Our large group was catered to like we own the place. Great music and atmosphere.

8gMvn2c6PqA8VaNdhZ3_2g.text: Pinky's is a very interesting place with a very diverse menu. There is plenty of neat art/graphic things too look at. They even have KISS pinball! All around there is a very comfortable dinner atmosphere.  My favorite thing about Pinky's is there drink menu. They have a good verity of beer and liquor. Not to mention, so far, they make the best Manhattan in town and it's relatively cheap. They all kinds of different and good drinks, along with specials every night of the week.  The food is good quality for a dinner. They even have a vegetarian menu with vegan items listed, which is always appreciated by me. My favorite item so far is the tahini salad, mostly because of the falafels, they are very good though a little greasy, but isn't that what dinner food is about?

ySWi4SBH85GqH6wMaucKrw.text: Pinky's is everything I could hope for in a diner. Cheap beer, awesome burgers, and enough for leftovers. I've ate here several times, got something different each time and I've always left euphoric. I usually start with their crab hushpuppies; crunchy, slightly sweet, and perfectly complemented by spicy ranch sauce. Their burgers are good quality and very flavorful too. I tried the ding dong style, and the eclectic mix of sweet peanut butter and spicy sriracha do wonders. I was skeptical beforehand but they've made a believer out of me.   Great value, excellent food, and relatively close to BoA Stadium have made Pinky's one of my new favorite burger joints. Well worth the five minute drive from uptown.

E1NgVZ2hboGZAkgTJgtINw.text: I can't get the pimento cheese chili fries out of my head.   Seriously, and I ate lunch an hour ago. They're floating around my food brain, winking and smiling at me. Come get us, they're saying. Quick, before we get soggy.  So, what is it that makes the place so good? Consistency. It isn't the quality of food - which at Pinky's is obviously artery-clogging. It isn't anything cutting edge or challenging, introducing you to new, wondrous flava combos. It's the fact that every time, every time I order those damn fries, they're a teetering, steaming mound of volcanic-hot waffles covered with perfectly browned cheese, a precisely-measured dollop of chili almost-omg-almost spilling past the wax paper keeping it all contained for the walk from the window to the table. 5 times now. A piece of food sculpture, almost. I stare at them for just a sec, enjoying them as an object, before diving in, forks flying. Recent discovery - yellow mustard is killer as a dip.  They set a high bar, only to be approached by the corn dog and pickles. Falafel's getting better, but is still eh. Burger, pasty, good. Salads are totally edible, if you must, but not impressive. But the pickles, those gonna-be-the-huge-gut-of-me fries, and the corndog, at least one of the three has to head down my esophagus weekly or this happens - craving to the point of distraction.  You win, Pinky's. You win.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

1_B-4qywtvkKXXRgnjdlLQ.text: I am a HUGE fan of Pinky's. It's definitely one of my go-to lunch/low-key dinner places.   The fried pickles are absolutely a must. I'd rather get them on the side of my burger than fries - they're that good. They're exactly the right ratio of salty pickle to crisp breading.   You also have to try at least one thing "Ding Dong Style." I would never have thought of putting peanut butter and saracha on a sandwich, but as a combo, it can't be beat! The Ding Dong Chicken is one of my favorites.  The wait staff is always fast, friendly and helpful, too, so it's a pleasure to grab a bite here.

fuzVtiAr_r5OnM3UfLiidQ.text: This place definitely has its own unique vibe going on. I think a horror movie of some kind was playing at the bar. The food was mediocre at best. My husband order the pork tacos and liked them pretty well. I order a hamburger and it was very well done. Dry really. My margarita was also pretty bitter. I think the batch of limes was a little off because the wedge on my glass tasted pretty unusual. We both agreed the hush puppies were amazing though. All in all I would say this place is okay depending on what you order. It isn't all great.

aEgpMTKIHPrRK_LI4ZCh9A.text: The best thing about this place is the atmosphere.  It's loud and fun, plenty of people that are tatted up.  Great burgers, great onion rings and great fried pickles. If your looking for good food and a place with personality this is it.

BGsmQ-FmZHOywJIv2Q4MKg.text: Been to Pinky's twice. 2 stars is an average of both visits. First visit was good. Burgers are great.. very juicy and homemade like. Fries were a little lukewarm, but they remade them for me. all in all very good ( 4 star) experience. Second visit went like this. Was meeting my gf there for a late lunch. Told seater I had a part of 2, do you have a table available. He told me they do but since my full party was not present, they couldn't sit me. I responded that she was parking. He said still he could not. So i said, well do you have a table for one, he said yes but you are a party of 2 and have to wait.  Now I can see if I was a party of 5 and we was waiting on 3 or 4 of the group... but any table that seats one, seats 2... WHATS THE BIG DEAL. Need less to say, I said no thank you and left and ate at The Burger Company. I am very picky about some things. Won't be going there again.

hL9l3FIEBvslhi1Ir1DfVg.text: We just saw this placed featured in Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and was in Charlotte for the day. The food was reasonably priced and the burgers were great. We had the corn dog shrimp which were featured on the show. Lots of breading, but good size shrimp in it too. The Asian pork burger, which was featured on the show was no longer on the menu. So I was a bit disappointed.

_KtULxYa5jBO0EWxmO_NbA.text: A friend and I met at Pinky's for lunch. It was a Thursday and the special was the Philly Cheese Steak. I must admit that it will become a Thursday must! It was tender and so delicious! We shared a order of waffle fries and I'm glad we did. I took half my sandwich home and ate it for lunch the best day and I had a happy mouth! I like the teamwork and loved they suggested the Philly.

bpZuwheQCFE9GegHOFJrkw.text: Great prices!  Large, eclectic menu and super fast and friendly service.  We sat on the patio and enjoyed the tiki bar type setting.  So many unusual decorative items they are a conversation piece in themselves. Fun drink coasters with brain teasers.  No fun details were overlooked.    The waitstaff tag teams all the tables so patrons have everything they need and there is a fantastic team environment.    I had the white trash turkey burger with onion rings.  The next time I will order something different.  I couldn't taste the provolone cheese, and the turkey burger tasted just like beef.  So much so, I needed to double check!  The onion rings are a huge portion...  Don't even attempt to eat it alone.  The entire family can eat here without breaking the budget.  Parking is way on the other side of the restaurant. On Friday there is an evening rush that starts around seven.  Make sure you get there before then.  An umbrella fell on my sisters head and they deducted $3.75  from our check, which is the reason this place didn't earn four stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. None of us could figure this out.
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fun riddles on their coasters and waitresses in short shorts (if you like that sort of thing).
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Unusual decor on the patio section.  You may not like it, but you can&#39;t easily ignore it.

QGogMOuFdL7HAAOXbUg17g.text: Have never had anything bad here! Crab Puppies (hushpuppies made with crab) are a must for us. Burgers are probably the best choice because they are SO good. White Trash burger is the way to go (comes with fried pickles on it). They do different drink specials every night of the week (like craft beer roulette on Fridays which is fun), and their drink menu is overwhelmingly long. Only downfall is no matter when you go, this place is always packed. But if you have to wait, it typically doesn't take too long because the servers all split tables. One of the best spots (if not the best) is Wesley Heights!

FXA8QB7an8dMBMqHqyYIqw.text: Amazing experience, good vibes with the food. Always a really good place to go and bring friends from out of town. And do you and Greg really know how to do it!

23F8xKmTVATILiThJ4qDZQ.text: This is always going to be my late-night go to spot. The food always arrives fast and whenever I get in a mood for a corndog... I can order as many as I want without judgement!   AND the Banana Pudding will have you checking the kitchen for your grandma/auntie!! Lol

pdU0Dbm-7Kj19L3cN19JZw.text: Today was my first visit to Pinky's Westside grill and it won't be my last. We arrived just before the lunch time rush, so we were seated fairly quickly. The service was wonderful. We had several of the waitstaff who came and checked on us throughout our visit. My wife ordered the patty melt and i had the mammoth burger with cheese. We did not have to wait very long before our food was brought out. My burger was cooked to perfection; not over done and had a delicious flavor. My wife enjoyed her patty melt, as well. If you're ever on the west side, don't miss the opportunity to check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Patty melt and mammoth burger.

pAMQ0e4lO6aKiC4qQOdYkw.text: Great food, fun atmosphere! So happy they had the vegan Beyond Burger on the menu. My parents and boyfriend were able to enjoy some True grill food and I still got to enjoy a burger as well. We also got the fries with vegan chili on it - they were a hit all around.

nZ674nyyiRvYy0dtstD2DA.text: Giving 5 stars for the chicken philly and the spicy shrimp tacos!!! Place is always busy. Friendly staff. Sides are sold separately

dv6uH6BcZdUfE9rfU-ZiyA.text: This is a nice place. I want to love it but its just missing a few things. The gravel and dirt parking lot for starters. And then when you walk in you'll see its pretty small and cramped. The pictures and stuff hanging on the wall also make it feel more cramped. Its not a dinner place, so don't look for fancy decor and  stuff. The food is good. Nothing spectacular, but it's still really good. I suggest that you go there and see for yourself. It really depends on what king of person you are. I recommend sitting outside, but not if you're allergic to/ scared of bees. I think there might be a beehive somewhere in the plants or on the building. They may have gotten that resolved but it wasn't much of a problem. It wasn't a bad problem. About 4 bees, just annoying. The area is nice though and its still a pretty cool place to get lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

KK_1F8ssZlqu48Xxu8tLPQ.text: Ate their tonite and was not disappointed at all. Saw on Diners, Drive Ins and dives and wife wanted to give it a try. We had the fried pickles for appetizer and they were very good. I had the corn dog shrimp and wife had the corn dog. Both were awesome and very filling. Price was very reasonable for the amount of food. We will definitely go back on our next trip to Charlotte.

9C4MUOJ988oXpNIfvftG3g.text: This funky place is not just great diner food, it's a whole experience! There is so much to look at! It's creative, offbeat and has really delicious food! The servers are so cool, lots of tatoos and personality. We've been a few times, taking friends with us, and we all had a ball! If you have an out of town friend, take them here for the funky, fun vibe.

IJJsGzaA0Z2vg6hTgm1-GA.text: There is certainly nothing fancy about this place and I appreciate that. Its exactly the type of place Guy Fieri would hang out-- and in fact, he had. You're going to be served on a paper plate and eating with a plastic fork. The decor is very eclectic.   Went between lunch and dinner on a Saturday afternoon and it was still slammed. We sat at the bar, and I didn't expect them to have such a good drink/beer selection.   Started with the pimpin fries-- a must order. Waffle fries covered in pimento cheese. What more could you ever want in life.   I ordered the Big John Chicken Sandwich and it was very good. Boyfriend got a burger that was almost too huge to eat. We shared a side of the homemade chips. Next time I am definitely getting the Reuben Dog. Really want to try their homemade veggie burger as well!   You really get a lot for the money here. Great spot for when you are looking for something casual or are *cough* hungover *cough*.   Park in the Pinkys spaces at Dunkin Donuts across the street!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimpin fries

C5mT_bsKC7nMWOz3bU1XDA.text: I heard really great things about Pinky's and decided to try it out with three of my friends. I was not disappointed! The service was great! Our waitress was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered a pitcher of the house margaritas ( which were not watered down so that's a plus ), crab hushpuppies - absolutely delicious, and the corn dog shrimp - I was skeptical about trying but Pinky's surely delivered and I enjoyed every bite. Our food came out in a timely manner and everything was delicious.

lWchnznlM1RQjQCaYIuoUg.text: Was in the area and wanted to try something new and different, and heard that triple D had come to this place and so had to give them a try out. One thing that was really confusing was the amount of different waitresses coming up to our table taking our drink order to food. Was told that they work as a team, yet when it came time to where we where ready to leave not one came up to the table.  The food was really good the crab hush puppies where out of this world, and so where the corndog shrimp.

Gmg-wz6yINv0JjtvOyaYRQ.text: I was there yesterday had a double cheese burger it was fresh and juicy. Banana putting off the chain.And nice looking girls work there.

8IgcNwuJIrT1nMftLvwdzA.text: I love Pinkys! They have quite a variety on the menu, burger is definitely what they are known for though. They offer a build your own burger if you don't like the preset burger choices. It's always super packed at lunch because it's so close to uptown. The only negative I can say is that the burgers aren't cooked to order because they are the super think burger patties. I think this place would be my favorite burger joint if they cooked to order!   ProTip: try the Pimp Fries that are covered in Pimento Cheese :)

XwSW_RI1jd2TNCCHAzUJdw.text: This place is consistently good. They have a great drink list (although I often opt for the classic shirley temple). We normally share the pimento cheese fries, which are delicious and totally worth the lactose induced stomachache that follows for me. My go to here is the veggie burger, white trash style. It is so delicious and eventhough I eat meat, this is my favorite item here and I would venture to say that it is my favorite veggie burger. My boyfriend has tried the fish, the burgers, the hotdogs, etc. and has yet to have anything he doesn't like. Overall, this is a great local spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie burger, white trash style

joN_i-IVJ0BAlVV7qzjdEw.text: ONE OF MY FAVORITE RESTAURANTS IN CLT!   So many vegetarian options, price is on point, and the atmosphere is great.

s7eHJWN5nZSB4XnVis9L7w.text: I was excited to try Pinky's after seeing the restaurant on Diners Drive In and Dives. The Crab Balls, Fried Pickles and the Ding Dong Shrimp were very good. The table service was very good.   The turn off was the table next to us where the people had a dog sitting on their table drinking from a water glass. Not appetizing at all. And, when we were leaving we wanted to purchase a couple t-shirts. The hostess has just one party of 2 waiting for a table   She was less than helpful when it came to assisting with the purchase. Needless to say, no purchase was made.   I travel to Charlotte quite frequently, just not sure if I will return.

cPB0ZvrTOvByB8t0YS00FQ.text: Pinky's is this little festive dinner on the corner of. The only downside to this place is parking, the lot is tiny. Luckily we came here right after work today and found a spot. Pinky's has its own random quirk which is apparent when you walk in the door, there are so many things to stare at.   My boyfriend and I have been dying to come here so we already knew what we wanted to attack. What really surprised me here, were the prices!! My god it was such a cheap meal and needless to say guilty satisfying too! We ordered the pimp'n fries with vegetarian chili to start...SO GOOD. The pimento cheese really made this app, the chili though is not as flavorful as the Chili Man's vegan chili (hollaaa!) I couldn't get enough and they were huge...I was basically full before even ordering the entree.   I got the corn dog jumbo shrimp while my bf ordered the white trash style chicken sandwich. I wish I would have replaced the fries my entree came with for something else like the black eyed pea salad..I can't believe I'm saying this, but I was all fryed out...ME..fryed out. Pinky's accomplished that. The corn dog shrimp themselves were AMAZING..the corn dog batter was almost sweet and cooked to a perfect crunch. The shrimp was huge and juicy. The buckets also come with amazing and flavorful  dipping sauces, they are huge. I got the spicy ranch, nomz, creamy deliciousness. The coleslaw that came with the chicken sandwich was really good too, I'm not a fan of coleslaw normally. Had minimal mayonnaise and I could feel the texture and taste the cabbage and other veggies. We waddled out of there  Our servers were great! Very nice and attentive. Banana pudding, we are coming back for you. And basically everything else. They have great drink specials too, Tuesdays are $2.50 drafts. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento Cheese fries with vegetarian chili!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn dog shrimp!
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. White trash style grilled chicken burger

_YYEC-a7iKEmvScr-EKNog.text: The other and I came here for a late lunch and a couple of beers and overall I liked it! The food was nice and cheap and delicious. We sat at the bar and though there were only four people sitting there, the service wasn't the greatest and you had to almost flag someone down in order to be served. Overall we were happy with our experience and plan on coming back.

vIH-nOHpkZw1BgTFCXpNoQ.text: First time going to Pinky's and I fell in love with the location besides the parking but my best friend and I lucked up and found a great park !  I ordered the chili fries vegan style and it was sooooo bomb also the black bean burger white boy style !

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

uebvfeYf6ywUFER6FtbYOQ.text: The food is alway great and it Comes out fast... however, the customer service SUCKS.. I understand the "free to be you" vibe going on with the staff, but, that doesn't mean you need to be nasty with customers.. they need a new hiring process for sure.

xH-I77m-C7gObOvjSKx4iQ.text: Pros: Fast service Lots of menu choices Quite a bit of parking   Cons: It's very popular and can get pretty busy, so you may have to wait a bit.   This is a lunch spot staple for me. There are so many options and the food is great and consistent. It's great for a quick and casual lunch. No frills.

c5ODVqrZOLZRExoiAXRf6w.text: This bar was absolutely the bomb. I stay in Raleigh but I guarantee every show I catch in Charlotte, I'm gonna catch some Pinkys too! The popcorn chicken, fries and spicy ranch are on my mind day and night. The others got burgers and loved them as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

lDdLj45XWHRewDSuB8zWxQ.text: The food it's really good in there, on the weekends it's pack and there's a wait list, but it's worth it. The only thing is that they have really load music.

EYMUC6Em9V6FOTltZb0pGQ.text: We love visiting Triple D places, but this one disappointed us.  First so nosiy and loud we couldn't talk to each other. Second, the fried items were soaked in grease- the fries, hush puppies, shrimp.  When you touched them the grease oozed out.  And they were so dark, the grease may be old, heaven forbid they double dipped them... The buffalo shrimp tacos had too much blue cheese crumbles that it over powered the buffalo sauce, had I to scrape some of them off. The black beans that accompanied the tacos were just ok.  My date had the white trash burger. It's a mess, so be sure to have plenty of napkins if you get it with double patties.

j80QJL9_qHe2u1a_eTc44A.text: Atmosphere was very trendy and cool. We got seated right away. We were asked if we had any questions and was sure to take our order as soon as it was ready. The food came out quick and hot! There are many different options. The coolest part Guy Fieri has been here on his show. Try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZT3ci4oq6hP0lSVvV3QaWw.text: Had a great time here! Food and service was good! The banana pudding was . Will try another dessert next time!

5v2LnysRQd1ZsWaqcZhA9w.text: I love Pinky's! They have so many great items and I must say that I specifically go there for the their veggie burger! I went with my mom and niece (3 years old)! I loved that she just naturally assisted without being asked! Our food was great per usual and I love their fried pickles!2 of the attached photos taken by my niece!

YXzkqqR_HqXLbWuGWNFnLg.text: Good food for a great price. We ordered the crab puppies, white trash burger with sweet potato chips and the Greek pita with grilled shrimp. We had a solid meal, no complaints and an unbeatable price. The same burger would have been double the price anywhere else.

DACSP2uSiT1-NccKrm8U1w.text: Came here a few weeks ago. It's just damn good food. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Recommend the crab puppies, white trash burger, or the triple G! This is one place you have TO GO in Charlotte.

VZLu7UuGgwLjZhaCj65XRg.text: The wings and crab puppies were so good and they  also have drink specials all week long! 50% off meals for soldiers in uniform!!!

BkhD_mDI-TDVSazuDfNlcA.text: I started my evening with a nice Red Oak draft beer. I would have liked it a bid colder, but that's just personal taste. We followed with an order of ccrab puppies with an amazing sauce. Our burger was over cooked and dry but it tasted good and was well prtioned

cVc9cNurGwkjidhpZekFXA.text: Wasn't absolutely blown away based on the hype, but also I apparently didn't order their best options. I will definitely be back to try again.

Ske2GYqmx188BkbbyUxeQA.text: My husband had the el santo hotdog.  It was the worst hotdog he has ever had.  The bun was hard and dry, hot dog was like-warm and cheese want even melted.  That hot dog gave Nathan's a bad rap.  I had the white trash burger-supposedly one of their best sellers.  Under impressed.  Burger was cooked well done and bun was hard.  I have to agree that perhaps the triple D curse is in effect.  I Don't recommend.

sRafQignUJLiEv-VRAedXQ.text: Traveling through town and was not disappointed.  Wish we had more time to try the variety of unique dishes.  Enjoyed the unique atmosphere and taste.   Well done.  It is on the must stop list for next trip to Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main dining area

zafpo-D6Jm8mbgwR6fAaRw.text: Pinky's was great! I had the Pinky Dog and it was fantastic. I was afraid the pimento cheese was going to be something like cheese whiz but it was more like cheddar and a nice kick to it. The chili sauce was awesome. My friend gave me one of his Buffalo Shrimp tacos and that was really delish too!  I also ordered onion rings which were a little greasy but they had good flavor. The beer selections were excellent. 100% I will be going back.

KZiirNbSewxPNTvkB8rfvQ.text: I always love the yummy food, but the music needs to be turned down way to loud!!! Couldn't even have a conversation with the person I came with because I couldn't hear them.

C3Dyxp_hMrGs8AQP2-DjbQ.text: I love this place so much! I have been here to many times I've lost count! I normally come here during the weekends but this time 2 friends and I decided to come for lunch on a Friday. It does not matter the day or the time, Pinky's is always packed. However, the waiting time is not bad since they have many tables.  The parking at the restaurant is pretty small however they have a parking lot a few steps from the restaurants that fits a lot of cars.  Everything they serve is good, but I always go with the shrimp corn dog and the waffle fries. They are my favorite and I can't go there without having them! One one my friends had a chicken sandwich that she said was good and the other one had the white trash burger with some fried squash that she really enjoyed. My meal as always was really good!  The servers are nice and attentive. Since they are always busy the food can take a little while to get ready so if you are in a rush this is definitely not the place for you.  The decoration is cool and different and their prices are great! I didn't know they had banana pudding but reading the reviews on Yelp I found that they served some pretty good one. I had to find out myself and was really surprised! It costed a little bit over 3$ and was so much banana pudding that I had to take home to share with my husband! I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

ytSyKMOEm933Iqzwc-04kQ.text: Pinky's is a staple in Charlotte, good food to get you ready for a weekend of fun along with an eclectic environment to keep your eyes moving and the menu adds a twist on American favorites I suggest trying the crab puppies or corn shrimp

xMF5_6hPGChPepHRROsfqg.text: Pinky's is a great place to go for a burger and fries or any other type of greasy food. Their portions are large and the service is fast. Start with the fried pickles if those are you're thing!  If you're going for lunch, arrive before noon and park in their lot behind the restaurant.... otherwise be prepared to wait.

ylCTSZVqdZX7iOspXNGJUg.text: Pinky's is a Charlotte staple I found out about it on the foodnetwork show diners "drive Ins and dives" with Guy Fieri. I recommend ordering the white trash burger with fries. You won't be disappointed. Prices are great service is prompt

4kTdqBMoxZsmfq9fcAGAbw.text: Looking for an eclectic restaurant ? A place that stimulates both your vision and taste buds? Pinky's Westside Grill is your place! Located in a the corner of a busy intersection, they only have 3 parking spots in the parking lot in front of the restaurant. You will have to park in a dirt lot located behind the business. Not an issue unless its raining.   I ordered the Pimpin' french fries with chili as an appetizer and they were delicious! Order a side a ranch, just to make it a tad healthier ;) Loved the waffle cut fries they use for this dish because it allows for more surface for the cheese and chili! Maybe I would add jalapenos next time too! I ordered a White Trash Cheese burger and I will never order a cheese burger another way!! This cheese burger came with pickles and fried onion strips.. YUMMM... I added some mustard and maybe would have added some jalapenos as well.. .but that might just be my pregnancy craving at the moment. HAHA.  Service was great, food came out fast and outdoor seating is also available. 5 stars! Can't wait to come back!

rkNtTA_A_pOVexWUoyv8XA.text: So glad we stopped in while visiting Charlotte! I had the white trash burger and the fried squash. So delish! My husband had a chili dog and a mammoth burger. We also got an order of banana puddin. Everything was amazing! Except the sweet tea...too sweet. I know, how can that be? Would recommend this funky spot to anyone in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. White trash burger
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried squash

YGOQpWf1AsJoSBZeYMvo3Q.text: I was highly impressed with Pinkys. I've heard alot about it but was beyond belief at the great service and high quality of food. I had the Ric Flair with waffle fries and it was soooooooo yummy. The cost was so great I had to look at my check twice. I am looking to go back and try more dishes as so many things looked yummy. The wait staff was so helpful and everyone was very attentive. 5 star place to eat and highly recommend!!!

vqyKgyBH8vJDjHqmIu1LAQ.text: I ordered the mammoth and my wife ordered the white trash burger with onion straws and waffle fries to go. The meat on the burgers were good but the sides were just average. We carried out because there was no available parking. By the time we got back to our hotel in 10 minutes, the onion straws were mushy.  Not super impressed.

Aqy-xpfdH54WYiKbfK6Z6A.text: I was underwhelmed. After reading all of the great reviews, I ordered the white trash burger, a side of fries, and a side of fried squash. The fries were warm and your run of the mill frozen waffle fries. The burger was good. Cooked very well and juicy, but there was hardly any sauce, the fried toppings were bland, and it just wasn't what I was expecting with such rave reviews. The fried squash was my favorite part. Very good.  Wait staff was great and I was seated quickly. The atmosphere was awesome and laid back. I think if I was going to drink with friends, instead of eat, I would have been much more pleased.   Overall, cool place, but the food is just typical bar food for the most part. I'm glad I tried it, but probably wouldn't go again for the food.

2ghVtBuO7gm6ThT6aD_D1w.text: Every waiter and waitress will serve you. Great stop for a great burger whether beef or turkey.   The fried squash is delicious.   Don't take my word for it. Go now!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried squash
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey jive

PqwHfG3_6Do-2tnurHknUA.text: Great spot for variety of vegan/vegetarian regular everyday foods. They serve meat and sides thats are simular to like a burger joint. The banana pudding is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Impossible burger!!!!

vtgSZVOD1gp2S3dPfoCFUw.text: This restaurant could go for a Bikers bar but in reality it serves some good burgers; great customer service

QZ7oWhA-5q7U6nLfes6mMg.text: I don't go to Pinky's often but when I do I always enjoy it! We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table for two but definitely worth it! The food is unique and although not the healthiest, tastes really good! I had the corn dog shrimp and cheese fries and the portion pretty big.  The service was good, I never had to ask to refill my drink, but I will say at times they can be bothersome with how often they approach you. The restaurant isn't huge so I felt like they were trying to turn tables quickly. Within 5 minutes of sitting down five different people had asked us if we were ready to order. We ordered an appetizer just to get them away for a bit. So if you're trying to take your time this might not be the place to go.

4S9yTxCQ5PqsTG3rpP0dSw.text: I don't watch Triple D. I barely know anything about Guy Fieri other than the fact that he looks like a pro-wrestling 2000's raver. That being said, Pinky's just seems like the type of place that he would go to flavortown at. It's cheap, gimmicky, and an extremely popular place to dine whether you're a tourist or a local.   There's a bunch of fun menu items like Crab Puppies and Corn Dog Shrimp while the White Trash burger and the Toney Baloney are a pretty accurate representation of what the sandwich menu looks like. I had the Kickin' Chicken tacos and they were definitely pretty tasty although they were on of the more boring things I could have ordered.   They do something here called Ding Dong Style which is the combination of crunchy peanut butter, honey-cilantro slaw, and hot sriracha sauce to top a burger or tacos. It wasn't exactly my thing, but I gotta applaud a place that's willing to take a chance on an unlikely combo.   Considering the dirt cheap price tag and the entertaining environment I'd definitely give Pinky's another go if I'm in this part of Charlotte.

7lu1rCpoGZHPM9ru_3V1GQ.text: I ordered two of the kickin' chicken tacos with onion rings as sides, the mammoth white trash burger, and banana pudding. We waited forty minutes to get our food because they had to remake the tacos with the sauce on the side and then they forgot to even give us our onion rings so we were missing food even after that long of a wait. The burger was bland and dry. The bananas in the banana pudding were black like they had been left out for who knows how long. Then when you try to call them they can't hear a word I'm saying and only offer to have me come and get onion rings after all the time I already waited.  I thought this place had amazing reviews after so many people going there and I'm just disappointed in service.   Also there was no seating when we went so my mom and I sat at a table to take a rest for a minute a waitress rudely told us we need to leave and get up. She could've had some common courtesy.   The only plus was that the kickin' chicken tacos had good flavor. So just be warned with what kind of service your going to get coming to this establishment.  UPDATE: I would just like to thank Andy and the manager I spoke to, I couldn't remember the manager's name but he was amazing! I came in giving Pinky's another chance after speaking to Andy and I would just like to commend this restaurant for making things better than right. I had a much better experience and would like to thank the staff/manager/Andy. Plus I haven't had good chicken tacos since I was in California and this is as close to home as they can get. I would eat the Kickin' Chicken Tacos everyday of the week.

3kXQixNlQGmQGJu3_Ae7lQ.text: This was my first time checking out Pinky's. I went on a Friday at about 11am. By the time I left at around 11:45 it was getting packed. Sat outside on the nice outdoor patio. They had great service. The menu was very diverse. I got the Pterodactyl burger Westside Style, Sweet Potato Fries, and Wasabi Ranch for fry dipping. The burger was good just nothing life changing. The fries were fresh and I loved the ranch I wanted to buy a bottle of it. Didn't drink but their drink menu looked very good! Would recommend & will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu.

W5_jGVuhKhCSOl9BK-R8vQ.text: This place is off the chart great!!! The servers help each other the food is outta this world good!!!! We got Banana Pudding for dessert and WOW!!! We'll be traveling back just to go here again

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. You can&#39;t top this!! Banana Pudding to end one of the best meals we&#39;ve had!!!

g1fHW4VDLwgRvrs3CSg2_A.text: Love this place!!! I have been multiple times and it is always great! Went there for lunch Friday afternoon with some friends and I had Greg's pickles! They are the best fried pickles ever! I had a cheeseburger and sweet potato fries this time and both were on point! I love the spicy ranch! I have also had the chicken bites and they are delicious too! Also the corn dog is great! Has become a must go when in Charlotte!

TKtoZL5_AFioBaoc7pGuLw.text: Met my friends here for our Cheeseburger Friday gathering. You'll want to arrive closer to 11:30 because it starts to get super busy after then and you'll be waiting outside. It is a very small place with a very tiny parking lot (more space down the road) and they will want you to go when you've finished enjoying your burger.  I opted for the double burger with cheddar plus fries. It didn't take too long to arrive. Two large 5 ounce patties with all the toppings on a nice bun. The meat was hot and drippy and delicious. Waffle fries were fresh and hot, soaking up ketchup very nicely.  I chose the $3 beer special, which is a random can or bottle of whatever they want to move quickly. It was a tasty milk stout that I enjoyed.  Our waitress was nice about wanting us to move along - there were at least forty people waiting to get in.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Guy Fieri DDD
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double burger at Pinky&#39;s in Charlotte

wbz3ocFmy1OAKijfBpYJhQ.text: This place is great!!  It's different and unique.. not a typical run of the mill bar with food.  The atmosphere is great! The stag match the atmosphere. No one looks out of place to work here.  Just an overall fun place to visit.  I ordered pterodactyl burger, with pimento cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion. Side of sweet fries. Drink of choice was Granite Falls 3paw porter. Which is amazing in itself.  I definitely recommend trying this place out. Nice hidden gem just on the outside of uptown walking distance from the panthers stadium.   Thanks guys!

s7FNEmS26fDb_w0cJA3uwQ.text: No place like it! This is a Charlotte classic and staple of comfort food. Get the cormdog shrimp with cheese fries if you want to really do it up! Lots of great drink specials and fun atmosphere. This is a must if you are new to town.

JKpr2R4Gfpvm-BpGP-RGiQ.text: Very good food for the price and friendly staff this place gets better every time I stop bye to grab a bite.

9PKQzkHjt5sx7-ZAO7cvGQ.text: The first time we dined in at Pinkys, service and burgers were off the chain. We went right before 5 o'clock traffic hit, so it wasn't really packed. We got seated promptly on the patio, which had lots of fans! Made good for having a local canned beer, at half price! I got the mammoth w/ pepper jack & American, my other half got a triple w/ everything.. our burgers were a little ridiculous, but the best ridiculous way. However I will say, their onion rings are not onion rings. They're onion straws!   The other night I ordered through take out. Again, got the mammoth for the smoldering cheese but they put 2 kinds of the wrong cheese on my burger. I was pretty sad about it, but I will definitely be back for another dine in experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Triple w/ everything
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mammoth w/ pepper jack &amp; American

xb9weCSVGJknQRQ7oqeYUA.text: Loved the "vibe" of this restaurant!!!  The food was good, service was good, clean bathrooms, good music playing...  pretty much everything was good!!  I had the chicken nuggets with cheese waffle fries and it was awesome!!  2 different managers came by to see how we were enjoying our meal. I could tell that everyone working there really took pride in it.  We were seated immediately and served quickly! Would definitely recommend checking this place out if you are in the area!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken nuggets and cheese waffle fries!!!!! Yuuuummmm

rXCWrVqAsTFdi1mXghEA3g.text: Good if you're craving greasy, relatively cheap food! Every time I eat here, I leave feeling like trash because everything is DROWNING in grease (but sometimes you just eat a craving for that kind of stuff). Their veggie burger is good (again--deep fried so not really healthy). Fried pickles and crab hush puppies are really good. You can get your burger "white trash style" to get fried pickles and spicy sauce on top-- pretty good option if you ask me

Z6grvhWysbQ7szkBEDX9TA.text: Cannot say enough. We had the vegan chili, the onion Strings as appetizers. The BBQ sauce is amazing & the chili was sweet with a spicy kick at the end.  We then had the kickin' chicken tacos which were delicious. Chicken was juicy and the pico de gallo was so flavorful.  We also had the pterodactyl Burger with everything on it including the housemade pimento cheese. The burger was juicy & flavorful. Highly recommend this fun place with a super cool atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean BBQ Tacos
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickin&#39; Chicken Tacos
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan Chili

gnOvAA4nybRWDQmxrNPu7g.text: I usually like Pinky's, the one in Huntersville, NC.   But my last visit to this one downtown Charlotte was not so good.  I ordered the beyond burger and fries.  The bun was so flat and wet you couldn't even pick up the sandwich.  I asked for a new bun twice and they brought me the same thing again each time.  The bartender said they switched the  brand of buns.  I personally don't like to pay good money for cheaper quality food.  The little paper tray was so small,  it was practically useless to hold the sandwich.  I think if you are part of the downtown hip crowd maybe it's no big deal,  it's a bar with food.   I guess I expect better than that.  It will be awhile before I go back to this location.  But I don't think they are hurtling for business so I doubt my review will change anything.

sIIUf8xtM6Budc5EYWp9zg.text: Best crab hush puppies in Charlotte! I was a bit skeptical as first but one bite had me hooked. I could eat them as a meal !

vQiHh4zWCzZcX2LBVw05cQ.text: Landmark - yes, Pinky's is a Charlotte landmark in my book. You can't miss that VW Beetle on the roof!  It's definitely a unique place with a unique feel - definitely outside of the box from your typical burger joint. The White Trash burger is a staple for me and Unicorn Tears are my jam. On Thursdays $5 Unicorn Tears are my Discount Jam! Daily Drink Specials! Good selection of local beers!  Hot Dogs, Burgers, Vegetarian options - the Nature Boy (black bean burger) is pretty good. Solid appetizers too like fried pickles and Crab Puppies (kinda like hush puppies with crabmeat in the batter).  If you drive by and think it's too crowded, it may not be. The front lot is small! There's always room to park in Pinky's rear...hehe ... yeah, I said it...  Good place to bring out of towners for a little local flavor.  Pinky's makes me happy!

OKRNxC-ZJ94f42lEAjs1_w.text: Great spot to eat!!! Lived everyting I've ever ordered. And mg drink was the bomb too!!!!

2m9guUZOjypX6_Qr6nbdjA.text: Wish I wasn't trying to eat healthy that day I went to pinkys, didn't help much since I ordered a popcorn chicken salad but I told myself it's the healthiest thing on the menu. Wah...was.  This place is great! Friendly servers, cool ambience with neat decor, no frills place. My salad was huge in portion, popcorn chicken was crispy, and they added fried onions to the salad. A friend of mine ordered a white trash burger and was satisfied with the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hearty popcorn chicken salad!

8Mfsa1BAugQLQezGNYsQaA.text: This rating was based off of one persons customer service. After being seated and given my water the waitress didn't come back for over 10 mins. She was a white girl with black hair and a bunch of tattoos. Once you go to this place and see how small it is you would fill my pain and it was on a Tuesday night so it wasn't that busy. After seeing the look on my face that I was getting pissed one of the other waitresses came and took my order and it was all good after that. I would've gave them a better rating if it wasn't for the first girl. I had the corn dog shrimp with waffle fries and it was bangin. I didn't like the Cole slaw and I had got tap water to drink but that didn't taste good either so I will get bottled water or juice the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn dog shrimp w/fries ranch dressing

wMA5i3zC1RAyMJpJ9tlF_g.text: Everything is pretty fried and greasy but it's very good fried and greasy. Now I see why it is so popular. We stopped through here this weekend on a quick visit to see family in Charlotte. The service was great, we hit the timing right on parking so luckily we had no problems there, the White trash burger was pleasantly good, and there is a lot to take in with the decor and signs everywhere. Overall it was a great atmosphere and experience and we will definitely go back the next time we are in town. Docking a star because side dishes cost extra.

DQzQGiDu2H765olVn1dZmg.text: I was visiting Charlotte for a business trip and decided to stop into Pinky's based on the strong recommendations printed in various Charlotte-area promotional magazines. Well that was a big mistake. The first thing you'll notice when you step inside the building is a plethora of bigoted, hate-filled Democrat Party propaganda stuck all over the walls of the establishment. My (least) favorite of these items was an absolutely disgusting sticker containing a photo of the former NC governor with a drawn-on Hitler mustache containing the words "Rat McCrory." Lovely... call everyone you disagree with politically "Hitler," as if there is any kind of equivalency between the HB2 law and the slaughter of 6 million innocent people. There was similar hateful material strewn across their walls that ruined my appetite while I waited for my meal.  I got a double burger with fries. While they did give me a lot of fries, there was nothing exciting about this meal. The burger was dry, really dry, and not too big either. The bread was not particularly soft and felt stale. The waffle fries lacked flavor and needed a heavy dose of salt and pepper.    I guess the reason why they're promoted so heavily in Charlotte magazines has more to do with their politics aligning with the editors of those publications, rather than their food, because the food was not good. Stay away.  UPDATE 2/19/18: The business owner had the audacity to respond to my review with the ridiculous notion that equating Republicans with a German dictator who murdered 6 million Jews is "LOVE." I don't know whether to laugh at a ghastly attempt at black humor, or to cry that our world would consider an act of pure HATRED for other human beings advertised on the wall of this business as an act of LOVE.

1X9MwWIhm35XlQewKeaHZw.text: Pinky's Westside Grill is always a pleasure. The staff are friendly professional and outgoing. I've been going for a couple years and have never been disappointed. They always work as a team each taking the time to stop by the tables ask if there's anything else needed. My glasses is never empty and I always have someone taking great care of me.

SDGLZpcFhXUFyWqEMRTH8Q.text: I am so glad we finally checked this place out.  We went late (for us) on a Friday - around 9PM.  Got very lucky with a spot in the lot right by door.  Had that not been available, I don't know where we would have parked.  Our wait for a table was only 20 minutes or so.  They do a "shared" wait staff approach.  Its awesome as you have someone checking on you regularly but not annoying.  Great beer selection.  Seating was comfortable... no cramming 5 people into a space for 3.  :-)  The burgers were out of this world!  All the food was fantastic.  My 19 y/o and I had the Triple G.  I took it down!  Wifey had the Maddy Patty Melt my other teenager had the Ding Dong Chicken and my younger son had chicken tenders.  The dies were awesome too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance.

Q1QrNkHByLhtlN0uFxYX-Q.text: This place is a must try!...We went to a Panthers game and after wanted to catch a bite...Yelp to the rescue! I had a mammoth burger that was big but not overly "mammoth" meat was tasty although I wasn't given the option of ordering a temp...which would have made this burger one of my faves. Wife got the pattie melt which was actually better than mine...but the Fries stole the show!. We ordered the "pimp'n fries" because the burger don't bring any...waffle fries with pimento cheese...ridiculous!!  We'll be back to try some more! Average prices ok service...but food makes up for the shortcomings!

g2rkVHNaLYsxF_HSamQvTA.text: Out of towner and my buddy took me here straight from the airport. Absolutely straight comfort food (aka not healthy per se) and absolutely tasty. I had the white trash burger...thats the actual name, not inciting any trouble, and we had some crab tots, wings , and sweet potato fries. Like I said comfort food but all well done, its no wonder that there was a line to get seated. If its your first time in charlotte or the south you must try the sweet tea but be warned it is an acquired taste. FYI there is a burger/sandwich on the menu that has crunchy peanut butter on it so if your bold.....

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

3E6tZ2B3U2qDsDgPJPpUAg.text: Funky Spunky Food with some southern charm! Love this joint because it's always full of characters and the food is flav-o-matic!   Owners are from the infamous Penguin which ruled Charlotte tastebuds for a decade. Make sure to try the fried pickles, donkey style burgers, and don't be afraid to try something new. We love this divey food mecca and will always make a special trip for Pinky's!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sundrop Pound Cake
Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Donkey style!!

lifvfavLJk8GVjwFPTVdqg.text: Do not order the Corn dogs!  Yuck.  Was placed in a styrofoam container as a to-go order.  The fact that it melted the container all to heck did not help the taste.  The dog was wrapped in a super crunchy coating that tasted like it was prepared by a grade school cafeteria clerk, and didn't give a crap because it was their last day trying to make everyone suffer with their terrible tasting corn-dogs.  Next.  Waffle fries!  You can't mess them up right?  Womp womp! They're barely cooked, and like a mountain of flimsy tasteless sadness there they go...into the garbage where they belong after one bit.  That being said it was my first visit, and all my friends say the burgers are great!  But for me...I will just skip lunch if this is my only option.  P.S.  I climbed on the  the Triceratops! P.s.s. For Legal Purposes I did not actually climb on the Triceratops.

01Avua1vIVnAgH8H10NXqg.text: Pinky's on a Thursday afternoon for lunch always means a short wait but why not? It means $2.50 craft pints!   Today it was the Ding Dong Chicken, a thai inspired grilled, marinated chicken breast served on a bun with crunchy peanut butter, sriracha hot sauce and honey-cilantro slaw. Pimp'n Fries with homemade pimento cheese melted over crispy, seasoned waffle fries with chili ladled on top. Lightly battered and fried onion straws. Grilled Greek Pita with provolone & feta, tomatoes, black olives and oregano. House made Sweet Potato Chips served with fresh wasabi - ranch dressing.  And over a year later Pinky's is still...yes I said STILL... bad-ass-want-to-go-back delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pinky&#39;s from a wide eye view

q9MXfUlCsKAXIbh6pDoxJQ.text: Nice choice for a diner style burger joint. Not the healthiest however fits the mold of comfort food. Always good drinks and they have a heavy pour.

kZZP47MSw4N1LBI9wBlfMw.text: White trash hamburger is great the Crab Puppies are not as delicious as it sounds Staff is great

zTkD1Lbnkz2c4wQDeVA8IQ.text: Probably closer to a 2.5, thought everything was way too greasy and I like greasy.

ExjRMxXo4pNGQdxv_k34ag.text: Wow - pimento cheese burger, pimento cheese fries, $6 pitchers of beer. GO HERE NOW, don't walk, but run, fast! I am going back to try the peanut butter burger, my friend had it and he said it was awesome!!!  Kid friendly and fun decor!

photos.caption: Photo of Pinky's Westside Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. pimento cheese burger and pimento cheese fries

Bk-1oYtnOzi2JWrrbycSjg.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!  I've never been here - this was a Sunday afternoon where-do-we-eat-and-avoid-the-after-church-lunch-crowd idea.  And now it's my new favorite!  Our dishes were great! White trash burger. Awesome - fried pickles and onion rings were battered well and not at all greasy - the beef was perfectly seasoned. The spicy ranch was delish!  The fish tacos were equally terrific with tasty, fresh ingredients.  Service was spot on.  The servers all worked every table as a team, which definitely contributed to the fantastic vibe.  Everyone was friendly and helpful.   The outdoor eating area was perfect and the overall decor was truly unique and fun.    Cool, quirky and definitely a treasure, I can't wait to try everything on the menu.

5M00UPpycNTwm_46srjUrA.text: Service is always super friendly and the food is fast and fresh.  You really can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches and the fried pickles are a must.  It's crowded and loud but I eat there anyway.  If parking and seating didn't suck this would be 5 star review.

g_L_sXhOa0J3qqrOo_JIJQ.text: Vegetarian corndogs, it's good to meet you, but I might stick with your less clothed relative, jumbo soy dog. No offense, but I like 'em with less covering, I'm not a player, I just crush a lot.   And I'm crushing on these crab hush puppies. Oh crab-y, you know you fine with those big chunks of crab fried all golden brown. mmMM, damn good with that (tartar) sauce.   Fried pickles, girl, you might want to sop up some of that oil, there are many pools I'd like to jump into, but your oil pool is not one of them. Clean yo self up and we can talk then.  Cheap beer, you are my weakness. I keep telling myself I won't succumb to my desires for you, but your price point and promise of a good time keep pulling me back.   Pinky's, I know I'm all gross and sweaty from ultimate when I come in, but you couldn't care less. You still treat me right each and every time. I always visit on off times, so haven't felt the wrath of your crowds, which is good for me, because I don't think I could handle my jealousy.   I'll be back soon boo.

cB7SoSdCvPk6hHM2LhzMUw.text: It's good to see that Pinky's has finally got it together.  This is reviewing the take out at Pinky's.  After having two take-out orders previously, we (3 of us from work) were very disappointed in the quality of food vs the price.   This time was a welcome change as the food was hot, fresh, correct, and very tasty.  Since we use to make the trek to the penguin, one would expect a few changes and breaking in period before the same level of quality would be reached here at Pinky's......well, let me tell you, the food is good!  My secret to having takeout is to place the order between 11:00 - 11:20am , that way you are one of the first ones to be in the restaurant when the other folks are just getting ready to head to lunch.  No lines, no looking for parking spaces, but let me assure you, eating at that early time slot takes some getting use to unless you are still in high school where lunch starts around 10:45am.  So I had the mammoth burger, 2-5 oz patties, with provolone cheese and bacon.  My Grease-O-Meter was running hot, and there is just nothing like having a big huge piece of hot meat in your mouth with a little cheese and bacon, oozing out of the corner of your mouth......OMG that sounded kinda gross when you read that didn't it.  (SORRY) we are talking about the burger!  My co-worker had the buffalo bites, I stole one from his plate while I was bringing the food back to work, and I must say that was delicious! Ssshhh don't say anything, but I had to ask him how they were, so he offered (another) chicken bite so that I may taste it. Just like the first one, it was excellent! I would consider the buffalo chicken bites next time as it did come with fries, unlike the burgers.    I give these guys a fighting chance.....after all you have to be tough to have a name like Pinky's on the West Side of Charlotte.  Overall, this location has greatly improved. I am only speaking of the takeout as I just do not have enough time at lunch to dine in and review the service of a full meal.  If you like the Penguin, you'll get a the same type of feeling here, good food, small space, no parking, long lines, and yes, some pricey food.    Located (For us cool kids ....across the street from "The Pterodactyl Club")  (Now bulldozed and no longer a part of the scenery - RIP)  Located for the newbies to Charlotte, at the corner of Morehead St and the intersection of Freedom Dr.  NCFoodGuy
